Came to this elegant restaurant as a family of four on holiday in Dubrovnik, The first time we walked up for dinner (expecting there to be no outside tables), and were lucky to take a "no show" reserved table at the front of the terrace by the harbour front. We enjoyed it so much we booked for two days later. When we returned we were immediately recognised and shown to the same table. a 10% discount for a return visit was a bonus!

I had (on both visits) tuna tartare and sea bass. Both fabulous. The rest of the family had equally great food on both occasions.

Staff really friendly and helpful.

Overall, impossible to fault. When we come back to Dubrovnik this will be at the top of our restaurant list.
Excellent value for money. Bill was only 201HRK for two meals, wine and water. Professional and friendly waiters. The food is delicious. We got a free dessert. I definitely recommend!

Booked a table easily beforehand and were shown to a lovely spot on the outdoor terrace overlooking the harbour. We only had desserts and cocktails but both were divine. Social distancing observed and hand sanitizer readily available

Amazing meal, definitely worth booking a table so that you overlook the port.

Truffle tagliatelle and seafood stew were incredible. 

Service was also second to none, Marijo was the best waiter we’ve ever had! 

Perfect end to a great week in Croatia, we just wish we’d been able to get a table earlier so we could have come twice!
Delicious risotto, perfect location near the harbour & super-kind staff. We liked it so much we've been there three times in a row, every time ordering risotto;) See you next time Gradska!

From the moment we walked in, to the moment we left, we could not find fault with this place. The view is beautiful, especially at night with the Alpine Swifts busy in the night sky, combine this with delicious food and the most friendly and effervescent staff and you have a meal to remember. We were looked after by Marijo, Antonia and Ivan, who could not do enough for us and made us feel like royalty.

For our last night we were unanimous that we had to return, having loved it so much the first time and they didn't disappoint. Just before we left we were brought the last 2 drinks we ordered on our first visit, on the house, a lovely touch.

This has to be the most lovely location to eat dinner in the heart of the old town. The meal was delicious, and so was the 'basil is pink' cocktail of a special cocktail menu, the service was super friendly and attentive, I will definitely be going back again!

Decided to eat here on an evening that it was full. So had to wait the first night for a table on the square side. Nice setting to soak up the bustling life of old town Dubrovnik. Second night ate on the harbour side. What a spectacular backdrop!

All the food and service was fantastic. From the Dalmatian hams and cheeses to the seafood linguine to the superbly tender fillet steak accompanied by a beautifully reduced mushroom sauce. Also of note was the truffle pasta.

Wine beautifully chilled and reasonably priced. 

Will I eat here again? Definitely. Can’t wait. 

Thank you.
We had great times, our table was on the city side, which we preferred! You can sit, drink wine and watch people passing by. Real experience of the city atmosphere! Would come again for sure!
A must resturant. The service was really good. The food was very good. The starters are large so we had two to share between four. The desert trolley is to die for. Highly recommend.
We enjoyed a superb meal overlooking the beautiful Dubrovnik harbour in the Old Town. The food was great, the service excellent and we had a great time! We'd definitely go again.

Absolutely stunning! The setting, the food and the service were all just fantastic. Our waiter, Marijo, was so welcoming and accommodating - finding us the best table right at the front, overlooking the old port. A lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. We ordered just a few small plates to share - for me the standout was the marinated zucchini with soft local feta cheese - such a simple dish, but perfectly executed, fresh and delicious. The service is attentive without being intrusive, and the quality of the food, and overall presentation was really quite fabulous. I think if you’re coming to Dubrovnik, this place really needs to be on your ‘must visit’ list. Thank you!

We had a lovely evening, highly recommended. We booked a bit in advance (earlier the same day) and requested a table on the terrace, we were rewarded with a front row seat on the edge of a harbour, which was very romantic. The food was good, and the service was excellent, with nice attention to detail for example decanting the red wine. It is expensive though, be prepared.

Visited as per trip advisor reviews of others. We couldn’t get outside as very busy but sat just inside. The view still stunning. Mussels were amazing, really good. Fish was ok but despite filleted had lots of bones. That saying was delicious. Staff lovely.
Excellent service and tasty food but a little overpriced.. In spite of the candle light, very difficult to see what one was eating....shrimp soup was excellent and hot.

Located just in Old town port, this restaurant offers delicious food while enjoying amazing views of the harbor. The mussels and sea bass were overall the best in Dubrovnik. Had dinner there twice and definitely will come again.
2nd time we have eaten at this restaurant in 3 years. Both times were memorable as the best grilled squid I have eaten. Impeccable service and food. Highly recommended.
Right at the harbour end of the town, prime location, there is seating at the back as well which look over the harbour and seating at the front. Food was very nice and attentive staff!

Prime location and good food. Despite being quitw busy the service was attentive and Ermin did his best to explain the menu well. The steak tartar was very good as was the sea bass. The calamari was on the blander side. A must try when you are in Dubrovnik, after all this is one of the oldest establishments in a prime location.
An amazing date night, with a perfect view, great steak and drinks, all made special by the amazing service of Marijo who tended to us with great attention and speed, thank you Marijo

We have visited twice ... lunch and a few days later dinner. We were not disappointed on our second visit, food just as amazing and the most gorgeous waiter. The service is great, the food awesome and the location overlooking the water stunning.

Visited twice so far and likely to eat here again before we leave. The views next to the harbour are breathtaking and the food and service was also excellent. I highly recommend the seafood squid ink spaghetti and the sailor’s risotto- the depth of flavours and the quality of the dish was amazing. Really friendly waiters/waitresses. The prices are very extremely reasonable for the location. Thank you for a memorable experience!

we came without reservation. We got a nice table, were served friendly and with good advices. 
We had 2 different fishes. The food was nicly presented and tasted very good. 
Exellent place
Thank you for the service

We had a long dinner followed by deserts in this amazing place in Dubrovnik. It’s hard to talk too much in details because if you get a table at the first line port view you will most probably be charmed the second you sit down. Regardless the waiter was outstanding preparing the last part of our meal on a side table next to us. He was also a well of knowledge for the local grapes wines and was not taken aback to offer as a bottle from a winery of his home region. Honestly this is why we ask for recomendations first. The food was good and given the awra of the restaurant inexpensive ( obviously as comparison to other places, mind you that Dubrovnik old town can be costly ).

We had a great dinner with a very professionnal service from Marjio. Fish of the day was shelled in front of us and the beef filet was absolutly amazing : tender and very tasty !
We also received excellent advice for the wine.
We can only recommend it and hope to come back
The experience was great. The food was excellent, also the wine. The staff was proffesional and very friendly. The location is perfect.

This restaurant is just wonderful. We went there 2 days in a row, both for lunch and dinner. Somehow our waiter managed to remember us and offered us a discount on the second day, just because we came again. This was very sweet and unexpected. I would recommend an amazing risotto, seafood and local wine. Great atmosphere and location.

We booked the restaurant for my friend's birthday and our whole experience was superb. We had the mussels which were so fresh and the fish of the day was so tasty. Our waiter Marijo was the highlight. He was so incredibly attentive and went over and above to ensure her birthday was unforgettable. Thank you Marijo with a J!
Beautiful place. Very friendly, English-speaking, educated waiter. Elegant guests. Unfortunately the food was not as tasty as we expected it from such a place
This is a most wonderful place in old town. Diner and breakfaste was amazing.Very nice and frendly stuff. We will definitly come again 👌😍
Great service. Great coffee and desserts. The prices are reasonable for the location in old town centre. The view on the main street is scenic.

We went for a drink and a small bite to eat. We took the fried calamari and grilled vegetables. It was delicious! That together with an amazing cocktail was a great combi. In the end the price was very affordable. So, good food, good drinks and low price...... a winning combination
Awesome service. Waiter wiped down the whole table for us due to covid. Coffee was delicious. Prices were great. Beautiful Cafe, I highly recommend.

This was a perfect sport for a nice late lunch. The service was friendly and hospitable. The menu had a wide ranging selection at a variety of price points. The location and view cannot be beat! Highly reccomend.

Had a solo lunch and drinks, have to say I got more than expected, plave is outstanding with great professional staff, nicely served and very delicious. Top value for the price. Would recommend and will be back definetely.

Gradska Kavana Arsenal is a must visit for any traveler. This culinary delight is located in the heart of Old Town Dubrovnik. You are surrounded by history, beauty, atmosphere and dining on the patio is an experience that rivals a romantically staged movie scene. The staff is efficient and friendly. We are on a family vacation and two of my three children are extremely picky eaters. We arrived for our dinner reservation last night and fell in love with the Wild Boar Ragu. So much so that my husband ordered a second helping. I had the steak and my youngest loved their local chicken dish. 
We loved the entire experience so much that we can back today for lunch. Three out of the five ordered the Wild Boar Ragu while I ordered the Seafood Risotto. 
Everything we’ve tasted is amazing. The coffee, the food, the beer, the desserts, the local liquors. 
This is a dining experience you can’t miss. 
Ask for Maro or Marjio for the best customer service a traveler could hope for. Love!!

We visited this fine establishment twice and I can honestly say I wish we had the chance to make ir three in a row! The service was exeptional due to the high level of proffessionalism of the witers. The sweets we ordered were delicious and so was the coffe and tea. We are to trully sorry we did not get a chance to dine there as well...
We went there twice and enjoyed the food, drinks and service. The prices were great! Highly recommended
Good service, lovely food and very nice veranda to sit out on in the month of February! We made it a regular place to eat.

We enjoyed eating here on the terrace where you can watch the world go by over dinner. The meal was very enjoyable and really good value - especially considering the fantastic location. Service was friendly and helpful
Nice place perfect for coffei on this sunny still peaceful day in beautiful Dubrovnik on the perfece Croatia cost

Chances upon this restaurant as it looked busy with locals, always a good sign. Gave it a go and was not disappointed. Food was delicious, service was attentive but not intrusive and it was a wonderful meal and experience
Best pink gin with rose water, amazing! Great service and good food. Very good value for money. Well worth a visit.

If you would like to have a coffe in front of main square of Dubrovnik this is the perfect place...not only you can have a good lunch! I tried the beed burger and was very good! Nice position and nice food.

Just 26 Croatian kn for a latte coffee in the historic old town square. Friendly staff, free wifi, indoor and outdoor seating. Breakfast from 65kn. If the local guides use it, it must be good. Recommended

We were amazed by the high quality of the food and the excellent service. I had the Sea Bass Filet, perfectly prepared and presented. My wife had the Steak and it was easily the best she has had in Europe in these last 9 months. The service and decor are top notch. We highly recommend this restaurant. The price of the meal is commensurate with the quality of the food and service.
Good food but what stands out is the excellent service. The waiter serving us was very attentive making us feel very welcomed.

Wonderful service, fantastic food we spent some time every day about five day trip here.
It was our anniversary and we were treated like royalty!

We had both a coffee in the afternoon and came back for dinner that night.
Staff spoke excellent English, the menu was bilingual and the service was terrific. 
It has an old world charm about it like being in a restaurant from the movie Casablanca.

We found the menu extensive enough for us and had a great meal, wine and beer. If you go to the city give it a visit. Though in summer you may have to book. We were there in winter and the place was still full of tourists and locals. Says something about the place.

I ended up going there twice during my short visit to Dubrovnik in winter. It was one of the paces with more people, not just tourists but also locals. The food was really good, especially the calamari and the soup :-). The house wine was excellent as well. I compared to other places in Old Town, and I was surprised to see their price was lower than other empty restaurants.

Delicious food in a very nice and cozy environment.
All the dishes were tasty and had a nice presentation.
Service was excellent and all the staff members were very friendly.
And the end of our dinner, we were served complimentary homemade liqueur.
Lunch in the sun... Hit this Jem for lunch before 3 to capture the winter sun on your face with easy tasty food and great wine recommendations
Had breakfast here several times and thought it may be a little expensive until we saw the huge portion size. Then they kept bringing out tasty bread. We didn't need lunch we were so full.
We really enjoyed this restaurant! We liked it so much that we ate here a couple of times. Great wine selection, great food. And the presentation was also very nice.
Very friendly restaurant in the main street of the old town. Delicous food beautiful view and reasonable price. I can only recommend.

Looking for lunch while visiting the old town this place would probably be the best.
Extensive menu with great food, prompt personal service and an interesting view of all the activity in the harbour.
The open faced sandwich had a lot of cheese and really wasn't appetizing. The oysters and octopus salad was outstanding though !

Had the chicken with a side of cooked rice. The rice was some of the best I’ve ever had and the chicken was tasty too. Cute restaurant right by the Christmas Market with friendly staff too. Also one of the few places open in December!

Had a lovely lunch here at the cafe/restaurant looking over to the square, and on another evening had excellent dinner & drinks (mojitos are especially good), through the other side looking over the old port. Service was very good, even more so in the evening. Made our last night of the holiday memorable for all the right reasons.

The Service: I have to mention this first. The service is abundant and amazing, thoroughly top end! This IS fine dining and luxury service I would expect at the Four Seasons. We spilled coffee on the table, just a half cup. The waiters were understanding, kind, and on the spot. They switched the table entirely -- think "Goodfellas" when a table was made out of nowhere. They disappeared the soiled tablecloth and recharged all drinks on the table, no charge. They greet you like old friend and treat you like their family. They make personal recommendations for follow-on attractions or other cafes and venues to sample or try based on your tastes and desires. 5 star service, not a penny less...

Atmosphere: Dining outside city-side, or outside Arsenal (Harbour) side, or indoors you are in for a treat. 
Indoors, main sitting: Try upstairs, very intimate, cozy, world happening below. 
Indoors Long Bar / Large Dining Room: Elegance, action, a constant pleasant din of diners. 
Outside city-side: People watching, feels exclusive. 
Outside Arsenal-side: Ah, the old Arsenal, where ships were victualed and rearmed ages ago. This place feels old, ghostly even -- peaceful all its own, sunlight and brisk Adriatic air. 

Meal: Croatian food is based in simple elegance. The food here is amazing, starters to deserts. The wine list is large, the wait staff will help you arrive at the best choice. Croatian dry sparkling wine steals my heart.

5 Stars, fine dining -- the prices reasonable. The service beyond compare.

My wife and I had two meals at the restaurant, and we were happy with the standard of food. The experiences matched up to the good reviews of the restaurant. The staff provided attentive service and took the effort to explain the different dishes. In addition, the dishes were reasonably priced for a restaurant right in the middle of a tourist attraction. Highly recommended if you are looking for a nice meal in a cosy environment which is conveniently located.

We stayed five night in Dubrovnik and found so much to do each day in the old town and surrounds. Our only issue was the food. There are so many places that are just okay, with one item on the menu that might be good while others are not good at all. A couple of Michelin Guide places we tried were not great either. Gradska Kavana Aresenal was our best find. We had evening drinks, afternoon cups of tea, lunch and dinner there and found the quality of food to be consistently good, the level of service to be of a very high quality across all waiters and the outside terrace brilliant for people-watching. It's a small menu and what they do, they do well. We saw other clients doing the same as us - having a coffee or cup of tea and then showing up for dinner as well. It's November so not in season, and granted the great places may be shut. We're just grateful for Gradska Kavana Arsenal.

There's the part of the restaurant on Stradun, and the part on the waterfront. They share a menu, mostly. Good selection of Croatian wines by the glass (why are these wines not exported to the US?!), and good traditional Croatian food, including plenty of fresh seafood dishes.

The brooded was especially delicious.

Given its location, the prices are very reasonable.

Beautiful location i the Old Town, nice view, amazing service, and very good food! 
Very reasonable prices also, I love it!

We ate here in the evening. We were outside facing the port. It is a lovely location to have a meal. Felt very romantic and pretty. Service was great. Very reasonable prices considering food and location. We have salmon and fillet steak. Both great dishes.

In a town full of tourist traps, Arsenal is a delightful exception. The location just outside the city wall overlooking a small marina is scenic and just enough out of the way that it is not in the midst of the Dubrovnik crowds. The decor is stylish and inviting and lively without being noisy. Our server Maria could not have been better or more pleasant and helpful. The wine was good, and my sea bass entree on julienne vegetables was perfectly prepared and beautifully presented.

After our good experience, we recommended Arsenal to some not-so-easily pleased friends -- and they also were impressed. We recommend you give Arsenal a try.

Granted we only had one meal there, but we all enjoyed what we had. And the location, wow, we sat outside on the terrace on the street side. Sitting in the Old Town, the architecture is just outstanding as a backdrop to lunch. I had the Open Chicken Sandwich, and I would particularly recommend that. The prices do reflect the fact that it is a good restaurant in the Old Town, but they are worth paying. Best toilet facilities that we found in Dubrovnik too, these things are important.

Part of the Nautika group. Great location next to the harbour. Choice of food and wine was excellent. Great service from our waiter “Marioje” who was attentive to our needs. Quality of food meant we visited twice during our stay in Dubrovnik.

Didn’t have a reservation and asked to sit on the port side and it was no issue. In fact they offered me two tables, one a few rows back that had no later reservation and one right on the port that had a reservation in 90 min. My choice - and I really appreciated that option! I got the mussels as a starter (which was actually a full meal - over 40 mussels!) and then the sea bass. Both were great. I’d definitely go back. But it’s a huge place with outside space on the square and a huge indoor space - the tables on the port side are what make it worth it.

Probably the best location in the city and prices didn't seem much different from other places without the view.

Staff very help and had no problem getting in as it was late season.

We had dinner in this restaurant, located in the old port, wonderful view, decent decoration and great environment. Friendly and professional staffs, great service. Sailor style risotto was excellent, Grilled calamari and Confit pork belly were delicious. Value for money. Highly recommended!
Perfect food, location, setting and service, especially from our great waiter, Ivan-the tall one :)!

The most beautiful setting to enjoy breakfast overlooking the harbour. Staff were incredibly polite and attentive, food was delicious and view was perfection. We recommended it to everyone we met for the remainder of our trip. Thank you!

We stopped here for an afternoon cocktail in Old Town side and stayed for dinner.
The cocktails are delicious, so much so we ordered 2 more.
Service is very friendly and attentive.
We ended up moving over to the restaurant side and were served by the friendly and very efficient 'Ivo' who was amazing.
He should be a hospitality educator he is so good !
Food is incredible, we ordered the seafood salad and home made pasta with seafood both were incredibly tasty. Not to mention the home made bread and olive oil.
We loved our entire experience here and would highly recommend dining, drinking, just relaxing and enjoying this beautiful restaurant.
Enjoy

Wonderful dinner here with fabulous service and recommendations from Marko, our waiter. The portions are generous so we shared the sailor risotto for starter and had the sea bass and steak for our mains. Everything cooked to perfection. Compliments to the chef and once more to Marko 🙂

Spent a lovely evening here. Salmon and beef bourguignon excellent. Waiter very attentive. Our puddings were on the house and they have us discount card to use at any of their three establishments. Booking is a must especially if you want front row sea view . Best view in the house.

Beautiful restaurant with a beautiful view of the water. My husband and I stopped for a drink one day while we were in the old city. The staff was very friendly and I had one of the best aperol spritz I’ve ever had.

We are very happy to have spend our last night in Dubrovnik at Arsenal. The location is perfect -beautiful view at the harbour- and the food was great. We ordered the pork belly and grilled chicken. We got generous portions. Also the staff was very friendly and thougtfull. We found the food in dubrovnik is overall quite expensive, but this was worth the price.
We had a lovely night out at Arsenal. Service was great; the location was lovely; and my chicken was wonderfully juicy and flauvorfull 10/10 would recommend
We had an evening meal here and the food was very good. The setting was beautiful as we looked over the harbour

Beautiful restaurant with a view overlooking the sea. We only visited here for cocktails but had excellent service, lovely live music and great drinks. We were given the liquors we ordered after our cocktails on the house - this is the only time we were given anything complimentary in Dubrovnik. This place deserves such excellent reviews, thanks to the great staff for a lovely evening.

Dined here on a recent trip to Dubrovnik as it was recommended to us by a friend. I am so glad we took them up on the recommendation as we were not disappointed! You can eat on either the square side or port side, we chose the port side. Service was great from the beginning and bread was served promptly! 2 steaks were ordered. *Tip* if you like a medium steak like we do, order it medium well as medium is almost Rare. Steaks arrived in good time and came with fries with Parmesan sprinkled over! AMAZING!! Highly recommend this place to anyone! Bit more expensive but totally worth the money!

We have just returned from a trip to Dubrovnik where we ate here one of the nights for dinner. 

We were seated on the patio that overlooks the square and Main Street through the old town and had a lovely view of the old city. I ate steak tartar, the veal and then a chocolate cake all of which were delicious. Paired with excellent service. 

I would recommend this restaurant!

The service was fast and very friendly. My girlfriend was sick and therefore couldn't really eat much anything so they charged breakfast from only one of us even though they didn't have to since we had ordered it for both of us. Beautiful location. Would recommend.
If you are a person who love to enjoy scenery during dining time, this place is for you. Truffle pasta is great. Personally, I love iced coffee and this place can serve me.

We can’t recommend this place enough!! My boyfriend and I had to change the time of our booking and the waitress was super accommodating and we were still lucky to have the seats right at the front of the restaurant with the most spectacular view of the port. This was by far the best food and culinary experiences we have had in all of our time in Dubrovnik. Our waiter, Marijo was very attentive to all of our needs and made fantastic wine suggestions! We ordered a mixture of fish and meat and each dish was delicious. Book in advance - it will be well worth it!
One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time. Quality cuisine, fantastic service ( Ivan ), and an amazing setting. Highly recommended.

Just off the main street with front terrace but whilst its tempting to sit there don’t. Ask for a table by the harbour at the back, just stunning vistas with the boats bobbing, lights twinkling and the hills in the background. 

Great food, lovely wine which is served like its nectar, almost a ceremony in itself. 

Excellent food, think fine dining, fabulous ambience, a must with attentive service.

This was by far the best breakfast restaurant in the old town, the views are stunning and the history of the building makes it extra special. Great for people watching!! Drinks in the evening in the square before dinner are a must and I must mention the staff, especially Marijo who made our stay extra special and explained the history of the building, fascinating. We will return!! Xx

We visited on the last night of our stay in Dubrovnik and had the best meal of our holiday there. The food, location, ambience and service were all superb. It was one of our party's birthday and we were treated to some of the delicious cakes , hers with a candle in and happy birthday written in chocolate on the plate. This extra special touch was very much appreciated. This was personally my second visit to the restaurant as I had been a few years ago and it was every bit as good as I remembered. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Dubrovnik

My wife and I had dinner here on a last night in Dubrovnik. A fitting finale for our stay in this beautiful town. We had a really good table at the front of the terrace, overlooking the old port with all its activity. Food and service were first class. Highly recommended.

Incredible views over the stunning lit harbour.

The staff were fantastic and the food was just unbelievable! 
A beautiful setting for a personal dinning experience.
Good food and good value. Also, excellent location for people watching. There are two side to eat on. One facing the old harbor and one facing interesting area.

This is a nice restaurant in Old Town right off the main street Stradun. You can sit outside which is great for people watching. Service was a little slow but good. Food was fair and expensive, normally for Dubrovnik, but I would expect slightly better food for the price. Compared to other cities we visited the quality here was lower and prices were higher. Relatively speaking however the food was tasty. We spent about 380 kuna (57 USD) for two drinks, a chicken meal and a steak meal.

We had a lovely dinner at this wonderful restaurang! Amazing staff and amazing staff! 
If you can call and book a table outside. The view is worth it!

After trying other restaurants and getting disappointed, we ate 5 meals at this restaurant! Great location (on the marina), excellent food and world class service! The staff is trained well and goes out of their way to satisfy the customer. 

I highly recommend it!

I only discovered this restaurant on my last day in Dubrovnik. 

It is on the old port, a really nice place to have something to eat. 

I had breakfast, a good selection of food at reasonable enough price. 

I was well looked after, so had to give 5 stars.
Lovely dinner and great service. Would recommend to a friend visiting dubrovnik. Need to book well in advance for peak season

we ate our breakfast 4 mornings out of 7 as it was really good value for money. i had the stradun breakfast, omelette, tomato & mozarella, tea or coffee , orange juice, croissant, bread & preserves. my partner opted for the arsenal... sausage, bacon, eggs, beans, mushrooms,toast, tea or coffee, oj, croissant, bread & preserves. 68 & 82 kuna respectively. 
friendly staff & great service with a view to die for

The best food we have all week in Dubrovnik! The risotto starters are amazing, but be warned, you need an appetite, they would pass for a main course.

Excellent selection of cocktails.

We were serves by Marijo, he was excellent, knowledgeable, friendly, funny, the list goes on. He helped make a great evening fantastic, a real credit to the restaurant!

My partner and I visited this place due to its amazing view over the old harbour and came back again and again for the excellent food and the superb service, especially from Marko, Marija and Ivan. Staff are attentive and knowledgeable and strive to make your visit as pleasant as possible, for example with blankets on a windy evening to keep you warm. The live music is very pleasant as well. In terms of specific meals, I cannot recommend the Sea Dream and the octopus salad (which comes with a VERY generous helping of caviar) enough. I’d return to Dubrovnik just to enjoy this restaurant again!

This is huge restaurant which runs from the waterfront to the plaza on the other side of the building. The waterfront side is more elegant and is preferred for having a meal. We had a reservation, and even though we arrived almost an hour early due to a change of plans, they sat us at a prime table by the waterfront. We shared a cheese plate and had two pasta hot starters, which were all delicious and enough food for s. Service was friendly, unstuffy, expert, and prompt. We had a lovely evening having a delicious meal and watching the waterfront activity, and listening to the excellent pianist.
Just amazing view, excellent service and the food itself was delicious. Only improvement would be to have a wider selection on the menu.

I ate here twice and probably would have continued had I found it earlier.

The food, the service and the view is all worth it. It's a little pricey but definately better than others I have eaten at. 

The first dinner I had the salmon with potatoes, beetroot and asparagus in some type of sauce and was amazing.

Lunch the next day I had wine with dalmatian prosciutto and aged cheese in olive oil with some olives. Was so good. 

Definately recommend and they give you a card which gives you 10% discount each time you return.

Best resturant I ate at for lunch and dinner in the old town
We had the chicken main course. The menu is limited so we both picked the same thing. It was nothing special & the vegetable side dish that came with the meal was disappointing. Wonderful setting.

Good food and service, nothing spectacular except the stunning location.

Good place for your first night in Dubrovnik, to enjoy the harbour. After that, better food and cheaper prices found on the side streets and quieter squares.
Excellent food and service in a beautiful setting. Our best meal in Dubrovnik with special menus during food festival.

This restaurant delivers on excellent views of the old port. We also liked the excellent service we received in two different occasions. The food is simple, not fussy and the local wines were very good.

On our last morning in Dubrovnik we had breakfast in the sunshine on the side of the restaurant facing the old port before we headed to the airport. Excellent breakfast with good freshly squeezed orange juice (a rarity in my experience in Croatia which is a shame), great coffee, a basket of good bread rolls and croissants, selection of jams and simple but tasty omelettes. There is a good range of breakfast options to choose from. 

This is a stylish restaurant which also looked great when we passed it on the square on other evenings with lots of happy looking diners inside and out. We were surprised to find that breakfast was such good value in this classy place, helped by the fact that you can get 10% discount with your Dubrovnik card. The tables on the terrace on the port side are a perfect place for people watching, monitoring the ferries coming and going in the port and soaking up the morning sun.

I visited this restaurant on a trip to Dubrovnik with my family. We made the reservation in advanced and so they gave us a beautiful table in the front row. The view was unparalleled. In addition to the beautiful view the food was incredible. I had the traditional seafood soup which was phenomenal. The service was prompt and the waiter was very knowledgeable and able to help us with selecting a delicious wine. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.
Amazing service, beautiful location and great food! They also have space for walk in customers even if reservations are full

This restaurant feels upscale, although the food prices are similar to most other restaurants in the old town. The food was all excellent (we particularly enjoyed the ‘sea and mountain’ hot starter) and we had a table right by the port. Our service was a bit slow to start but then improved once we were seated. We ordered a bottle of wine to the bar during our 20-min wait, and didn’t actually receive it until we got to our table. Overall it was great for a nice dinner with some tasty local food!

I wanted to show off with an excellent Croatian seafood selection in front of my French friend (having in mind that Frenchies always annoyingly insist that the French cuisine is the finest one) and man, he loved it!! We were served by a waiter named Ivan from Metkovic and his French pronunciation was excellent as well, ha! My friend was stunned by the quality of the food and service and you made me, a Croatian fellow, so proud! Kudos to the team! ❤️❤️

Sometimes getting great views, great service, and great food is an impossible combination in a touristy location - thankfully Gradska Kavana Arsenal did a masterful job at all three! We had a delicious dinner overlooking the harbor. For starters we had the leek and pea risotto, mussels in a garlic white wine sauce, and a burrata caprese salad. For mains We ordered the bacon wrapped monkfish with a purple cabbage purée and wild rice, the truffle and cream pasta, and the veal blackstrap with bacon potatoes and bacon wrapped asparagus. Our waitress was very kind, helpful, and attentive throughout our entire meal. We would definitely recommend this spot for a nice dinner!

A stylish restaurant, open all day and right beside the old town harbour so perfect for watching the world go by. The stone vaults give airy shade and there’s a good choice of dishes on the menus. We enjoyed a fish carpaccio and some Croatian prosciutto for a light lunch. The fish was very delicate and beautiful but could have done with a lot more seasoning but benefited from the citrus and rocket salad garnish while the ham was delicious. An agreeable light lunch followed by excellent espresso. Service was prompt and professional but rather impersonal.

Loved this place. Lunch today facing the harbour. Coffee and drinks yesterday on the town side. Great for people watching. Staff (Marisa) I think just lovely friendly and informative. Food great. Even gave us a voucher for 10% off dinner in their sister restaurant Panorama which we are visiting tomorrow evening. All in all best place we’ve been too👍👍👍

Nice un rushed lunch. I had a steak sandwich and it made a welcome change to be asked how I wanted it cooked. Medium rare and that’s how it came, full of flavour with onions, tomatoes, fresh salad and chips. 
Beautiful view of the harbour, very good service, clean and well kept restaurant.

Wait to get a seat close to the water overlooking the bay, Alone it's worth half the price. Then, being on the sea, order Fish Stew, their version of bouillabaisse or cioppinno. It's fresh and excellent. With a couple glasses of local wine, nothing could be finer. It was the most memorable dining experience of our trip to the western Balkans. Forget the price. You'll never find this setting in Topeka! The front of the restaurant looks out on a square-- but you have to walk through the restaurant to discover the backside that looks out on the bay.

Must visit for the views either overlooking the harbour or overlooking the main square. Waiters were very friendly, knew their cocktails and also too some amazing photos for us! You will end up walking past this restaurant many times, well worth going for a casual drink or evening meal. We even had breakfast one morning and the morning views were breathtaking! We can't wait to go back
The food was delicious and the service was excellent. I had the beef steak and my friend had the veal. Food was quite expensive but very good, totally worth the penny.

We didn't make reservation so we couldn't get the table at the end (near the port area) BUT we got the middle table near it and still enjoyed our evening in this restaurant. The ambience is lovely with the nice scenic. Location is perfect! The food was great and the service was great. I can hardly have any complaint for this restaurant.

We had a great meal at this restaurant, and the atmosphere was great. We didn´t sit on the port side, but on the other side, inside the walls facing the square, as the sun was setting. And it was great. Lovely food. Great drinks. And good service. Highly recommended.

Fine dining at it’s best. The food is delicious, the location is perfection and my waiter was the consummate professional. Attentive, knowledgeable and charming, with perfect English. 😊 I highly recommend this restaurant for any meal of the day. But it is extra lovely for dinner. I always love the terrace seating. Treat yourself to one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik and try to sit in Marijo’s section for a truly enjoyable experience.

What a lovely restaurant the views overlooking the marina were amazing 
The staff were friendly helpful and very attentive 
We visited in the evening for dinner and the food was delicious and very reasonably priced considering it’s location 
We would definitely return and perhaps go for breakfast 🤗🤗

We had just checked into our apartment above the Ploce Gate, and decided to wander down into the walled city for a late dinner. Just as we turned onto the main street (Stradun), we saw a restaurant with an ample outdoor seating area, Gradska Kavana Arsenal. After a quick review of their menu, we decided to give it a try. We started off with Buzzara Mussels as an appetizer, with some Croatian wine. The bowl of mussels was huge, and the mussels were the largest my wife and I had ever seen...outstanding! My wife had the Pork Belly with cauliflower mash, and I had the grilled salmon with potatoes and asparagus. Both dishes were great, although unfortunately we couldn't find room for dessert! This was one of several memorable meals we had in Croatia, our waiter was very attentive, and this dinner was a great value overall - thank you.

We had one of the friendliest waiters ever, and that definitely enhanced our experience in a major way. The food wasn't the best I've ever had, but it certainly hit the spot. I really loved the view as well! My only complaint were the smoker surrounding us, but I suppose that can't really be helped.

Excellent setting, good music, friendly stuff, great service. Everything we ordered was delicious-octopus salad with black caviar , stuffed calamari, seafood risotto, burrata.
Love this restaurant

5 stars for the wait staff, recommended a semi dry white that was delectable and was very nice to deal with. 

The charbroiled squid tasted a bit on the burnt side. However, The mussels were amazing, would definitely go back. Used the 10% card from the chain of 3 restaurants.

This restaurent is in the old harbour with great views of the town and city walls. Once an arsenal it is now a very modern restaurent serving delicious food. Good service mid priced. They also are very popular for breakfasts which we didn't try but looked great!

Move away from tourist traps and treat yourself to high Dalmatian cuisine, gentle service and the most beautiful atmosphere. Use their website to book a table, where you could choose to face the beautiful square or the (maybe) even more beautiful backdrop of the old harbour.

We chose this restaurant for its location and the menu looked inviting...and what an amazing evening we had. The FOH lady was very beautiful, friendly and welcoming, the young wine waiter decanted our chosen bottle of red, whilst telling us all about our choice and making an entertaining performance of his service. The food was very good and, as we couldn’t choose between the five desserts on offer, we opted for one each of four so we could try them all, and the waitress brought us the fifth to try too! Lots of fun, laughter and great food. Would highly recommend.
We were lucky enough to get a table here at fairly short notice. From arrival everything was perfect. The setting the staff and the food. So worth a visit. A real must do.

What a fabulous restaurant in the harbour! We couldn’t get a table on our first night, so booked for the next. The Maitre’D was very accommodating for our party of 6, and let us choose the table we wanted inside as it had been a little breezy. On arrival, it was warmer than expected, and they happily gave us a terrace table instead. The pianist was an added bonus to what is a very chic restaurant. 
The food was beautiful and our waitress Marija was just the sweetest and most attentive you could ask for. The red wine was decanted perfectly at the table and she overheard that one of us didn’t have a sweet taste & gave him a dry complimentary after dinner wine! The staff here are exceptional. Congratulations to the manager on running such a fabulous restaurant.

I had reserved this restaurant for our first night in Dubrovnik. We were very warmly welcomed on arrival. Our table had a lovely view of the harbour. All staff were very professional and friendly and the food was excellent. Highly recommend.

This restaurant has everything going for it. The location is wonderful, being in the harbour and with the evening lights was quite magical. All the food we tried was excellent and the service was the best we had while in Croatia, they went that extra step..eg red wine decanted at the table. It was a truely special evening. Make sure you get a table on the terrace for the best experience ( they have blankets for the cooler evenings).

The food, wine selections and setting were perfect. The restaurant sits facing the port of the Old City/Dubrovnik. Excellent service, really good seafood selection. and the Croatian wines were superb.

This is a delightful spot to have lunch. My husband and I jumped in here to ditch the crowds in old town and pleasantly found this place by the port. Our server Markos was probably the best waiter we had while in Europe. Polite and attentive but not overbearing.

Food fabulous.
Staff excellent.
View to die for, I could have sat there all day.
Although pricey it is well worth going you will not be disappointed.

While staying in Dubrovnik for 8 nights we ate at Gradska twice. Firstly we went for lunch which was wonderful. We managed to get a table over looking the habour and had some lovely wine and some great seafood and steak. We enjoyed it so much that we returned for diner on our last night. This time we sat at the front of the restaurant by Stradun. Unfortunately we chose a night when a large part of the restaurant was closed for a private party - we believe that the service and food quality suffered as a result of this. It wasnt awful just not a patch on our previous experience.

After having drinks + snacks @ 1836 we decided we would like to try light lunch at another part of that Companies portfolio- we were walking past that day in the harbor area. I had a perfectly cooked sea mountain- pasta affair with squid ink, shrimps etc- very tasty and my partner had marinated zucchini I think. We also had alot of cold drinks- ubiquitous iced coffees and teas- which were a must - given the heat!! We found it cooler deeper in the Arsenale- which is a superb characterful place to make a restaurant with the high ceilings and oozing maritime history. Service was quick and attentive.
Gorgeous food, service was really excellent, a lovely evening sat next to the old harbour. Reasonably priced too, better than we expected! Would recommend the steak and the monkfish wrapped in bacon.

Our first night in Dubrovnik. We walked into the old town. I found this restaurant on TripAd. It was amazing. We had a fantastic table outside. The waiter gave us a warm welcome and very open and honest advice about pur choices. We enjoyed the zuchini and sailor’s choice risotto very much. Main course, beef cheeck and truffle linguine was fantastic also. The wine Daniel adviced us was also very good. The sauvignon blanc from area Zagreb, the area where Daniel lives and new this wine from, was also top. All and all: great night in a fantastic environment with a great service.

The View - The restaurant has a prime location overlooking Dubrovnik's ancient harbor. Huge arches allow diners, even seated deep into the restaurant, to enjoy the restaurant's beautiful views. 

The Drinks - From wines, to classics, to signature cocktails, over several visits, we drank our way through their offerings! They make solid cocktails, and present them nicely!

Service - We're American's and we can be demanding... on some visits, there were as many as 12 of us, and we only speak English, so we're a lot to handle. The level of service was consistently high, and attentive. On our return visits, the staff recognized and welcomed us warmly. 

Food - Their menu is tightly focused and we enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner here! At dinner, we had beautifully presented, delicious fresh fish, steak and veggie entrees, mouth watering apps, and tasty salads (in the Side Dish section of the menu). I specifically want to call out the Sea Magic app (tuna tartar, shrimp, oyster) - it was soooo good! For breakfast, sustaining eggs and pastries. And, yes, if you must, their burger and fries will make any American happy.

We loved Arsenal. From our friendly, perfectly speaking English waiter to the food to the view, it couldn't have been a more perfect final evening in Croatia. Oysters and muscles were fabulous! Portions generous. Local wine delicious.

Dubrovnik is expensive. Sometimes you don't get exactly what you pay for. So when we stopped in for dinner, we were expecting great views of the Adriatic and a nice dinner. We were absolutely wrong. It was amazing! From the initial contact with the hostess, to our server and the arrival of our food. The entire night was spectacular. We all had a fish dish, some had fish stew, and others the tuna, but everyone agreed that it was as close to perfect as you can get. Our entire bill with drinks and tip was around 550 kuna, and we thought it was good value considering the cost of a beer in Dubrovnik is three times what it is in Zadar. Stop and enjoy the waterfront dining with the walls of Old Town as a backdrop. It just doesn't get any better. Highly recommended.

We visited this restaurant on our last night in Dubrovnik. The food was outstanding, the view was amazing and as for the service, what can I say, they are so attentive, thoughtful and friendly. First class service we all felt as if we were royalty. 
If you want somewhere, where the food is outstanding, reasonably priced, a building with fantastic history, an outstanding view from your table and service that will leave feeling like your walking in air then this is the restaurant for you. I would eat here every night in a heartbeat. Thank you Arsenal for making our evening feel so personal.

My wife and I had dinner at Gradska Kavana Arsenal as walk ins and had the most delightful evening. The food, wine, view and in particular the service from our waiter (Daniel) was outstanding. Portions were generous and the price was very reasonable. A nice touch with an acoustic duo adding to the ambiance. Highly recommend.

Enjoyed dinner overlooking the harbour.
Beautiful views and lovey service
The food was delicious
Definitely worth a visit so book in advance

As soon as we walked in the atmosphere was so special. We had a waiter named Marjio who was very attentive, friendly and helpful. He was so lovely we came back just for pudding and he served us again. The views are stunning, there was live jazz music and the cost wasn’t any more than other restaurants. The puddings are displayed in an open fridge so you can go and pick what to eat. We actually were served puddings for free and the bread kept being topped up. I would definitely visit again as it was my favourite restaurant during my week in Dubrovnik.

The place is amazing, big terrace, amazing views and the food is very good.
Price is similar to other restaurants in Dubrovnik

We wanted a restaurant where we had a lovely view and good food and this restaurant was perfect. We were lucky enough to have a table "in the front row" facing the old port which was wonderful (best to reserve). Our waiter Daniel V. was first class, extremely efficient & friendly. There was ample choice on the menu and all the food we had was very good.We would happily recommend this restaurant and would love to return again.

This restaurant comes highly recommended and righfully so. It is right on the old harbor with great views. Even with how crowded Dubronvik is there was no waiting at noon for lunch.
The food and service were excellent. My wife and I shared the catch of the day. The fish was cooked whole and served with a side of the Croatian potato/vegetable dish whose name I don't recall. The potatoes are great. Crispy on the outside and soft inside with a good seasoning. I subsequently had them for lunch for the last two days, but the ones at Arsenal were the best.
Also had the Croatian cheese plate as a appetizer; very good. 
Highly recommend this place.

Visited on our second evening in Dubrovnik. Beautiful setting overlooking the harbour and excellent service. Started with mussels. Huge serving for a starter. First time I’ve had a bread crumb topping on mussels but it was nice. Followed with a lovely whole baked sea bream, expertly deboned and served at the table and finished with Croatian almond cream cake and coffee. A thoroughly enjoyable evening with friendly attentive service. Sat and watched the sun set over the water. Beautiful!

This place has a lovely view over the Old Port. We shared a perfectly rare chateaubriand and a bottle of Testament Babić red, both professionally served by the charming and well trained staff. It’s not cheap eating really good food in Croatia but the best, as here, is well worth the price.
Wonderful restaurant! Cosy atmosphere, delicious food, perfect service, amazing view! I will remember this restaurant! Highly recommended!

This was our favourite restaurant in the Old Town. The food was cooked just right and was presented well. We had Chateaubriand with vegetables. The service was very good ( especially Marijo Krkic). The tables are all under cover but look out onto the lights around the old port.

Perfect spot for our final dinner in Dubrovnik. Everyone’s meal was exquisite, appetizers and desserts were great, wine was lovely. View is fantastic and restaurant is spacious and modern. We loved it

This is the second dinner I have here.
AmazIng food, impeccable service and a worthy price!
This restaurant makes the stay great!
Super rexommended!!!!

We turned up here without booking a table and they were able to accommodate us. 

The staff were all very friendly and helpful. 

The food was good and the wine was excellent. 

A little pricy but good value given location and view.
We got a seat near an arch and it was a great view of the harbor. The live music was a treat. The food was very good.
Great position on the harbour side. Good value brunch set us up for our last day in Dub. Try and get a table by the harbour and enjoy people / boat watching.
Excellent food, great location on harbour, good service and reasonable prices. What’s not to like? Worth booking though as it’s popular.

This is perhaps the best value restaurant in dubrovnik. Outstanding location, excellent staff (attentive, informative about food and wine, unobtrusive and not pushy for tips) and great food. There are many, more expensive, less enjoyable restaurants than this one. We thought it was great and would come back in a heartbeat.

One cannot write beautiful view in Croatia too often. This view is of the old harbour and island beyond. It offered a bit of relief from the scorching sun at noon
I think reservations might be best as the location is superb

The perfect view of the famous old town port - there is no place you rather be and worth the reservation weeks ahead you may need to do to get a table. The service and ambience was simply sublime, so with that and the gorgeous food it was a truly special evening. If you want to take in Dubrovnik Old town and eat amazing food then you must eat at this restaurant. Very reasonable prices for what you are getting. When we come back to Dubrovnik we will be visiting again.
we came here with our foodie trip guide and had sweet dishes.Location was so good with awesome view of harbor that we booked it for our last dinner as all the previous days were already booked.

Delicious dinner here on our first night in Dubrovnik. Mussels, monkfish and fish stew. The stew was especially tasty. We returned for a delicious breakfast the following morning with an amazing view out onto the water. Make sure to get a table by the water ! Staff were super.
Beautiful setting, unique and well thought out menu and exceptional service. We would definitely return. Book ahead to get a front seat on the terrace looking out across the sea.

We came here for breakfast and returned for dinner as it was so good, the staff are so friendly and can’t do enough for you, the breakfast was amazing and worth more than you pay! Dinner was beautiful too, I had salmon and my partner had the steak, would definitely recommend if you are in Dubrovnik, there are so many restaurants to choose from but this is a must!

We ate out twice a day during our Dubrovnik stay and this was by far the best meal. Well deserving of its great TripAdvisor rating. The staff were very professional and an atmosphere of fine dining. The views of the old port wonderful. Magnificent risotto and fish screw. My husband had the best squid he has ever had in his life. Reasonably priced for the dining experience. Highly recommend.

We arrived at the restaurant last night without a booking, and were pleasantly surprised when not only did they have a free table, it was right on the waters edge (someone had cancelled last minute). The view was pretty good, food quite good (had the fillet steak which was cooked to perfection), but what made this for us was the ambiance of the place. The staff firstly were absolutely lovely, but the music being played in the background really made the evening. A good general buzz of conversation mixed with some relaxing piano music made this meal really enjoyable. Would definitely return to this restaurant. Five stars for the staff.

The first evening in Dubrovnik I found this restaurant. The terrace facing the street is beautiful, and it was what caught my attention. 
I ordered the sailor risotto, but it disappointed me since I was expecting more seafood in it. If I went again, I’d try something different. 
The service was professional.
Been before and just had to come back, the food is exquisite and the location is stunning, the waiters are awesome and attentive without making you feel uncomfortable. Its five stars from us.

Best restaurant and service in Dubrovnik Old Town. My waiter Mario was extremely attentive to my needs. I spent an hour there watching the boats in the port and enjoying the suggestions of wine he presented to me. It was the best "last hour in Dubrovnik" I could have had. I only wish I had discovered it sooner.  Thank you Mario!

The food was outstanding as was the service. Our waiter, Ivan, was exceptional. We had three bottles of Croatian red wine which was excellent. There was 6 of us, I had the beef steak filet, Jim had the Sea Bass, Jake had the chicken, the food was first rate and the view was even better. Highest recommendation and fair prices.

Needed somewhere to stop for lunch and escape the sweltering heat. We just liked the look of this place, it's great location and relaxed happy looking diners.

We certainly weren't disappointed. Great food, a lot of local speciality dishes and charming helpful staff.

Just goes to show that appearances aren't always deceptive!

Dubrovnik Old Town is an expensive eating destination so it is important to make the right choice. This portside restaurant was so good we ate here twice. The setting is magical, with most tables having a view of the boats coming and going while the moon rises and the mobs of swifts scream across the skyline. There is live music and a great atmosphere. The waiters are enthusiastic and knowledgeable, recommending dishes and proud of their local wines. We had burrata caprese to start, both evenings, then seared tuna with white beans, spinach and tomatoes one night, fillet steak with crispy potatoes and grilled vegetables the next. All beautifully cooked and presented. The Croatian Sauvignon Blanc was a great recommendation. A special restaurant in a special city.
If you wake up and in dire need of a good breakfast, come here as you will not be disappointed and also receive a great view of around dubrovinik and it's port .

Our party of 10 did not have reservations and of course they were booked for the entire evening when we stopped by on a busy Sunday afternoon. They were gracious and offered us a table at the time. Early afternoon. We decided to have an early dinner and so glad we did. Everything was delicious. We had oysters, Burrata Caprese, Green Rhapsody/hand made pasta , shrimp, mussels, arugula and nuts with homemade pesto/. Sea and Mountains /pasta with squid ink, salmon, prawns and mushrooms.
Truffle and button linguine. If I had to pick a favorite it would probably be the Sea and Mountains, YUM.
The restaurant was fantastic all around.

A friend invited me for dinner to this lovely place, with an awesome location - direct at Dubrovnik's Old Town harbor. Enjoyed in an excellent atmosphere and first class service, and the food proved to be not less good: pumpkin soup, beef steak and Dubrovnik rozata as a dessert. To everything added fine Ilok Traminac wine. The restaurant is definitely a contestant for star in the Michelin guide - albeit it would be a pity if it gets it (most such places then become less affordable for "ordinary" guests)

I had lunch here a week ago and found the setting to be absolutely gorgeous. I was a bit surprised that I made a reservation (and they didnt have many listed for that day), confirmed the reservation, and then was given a table a bit far away from the water - despite better ones being open. The food was fine. I suppose. I ordered fish and it arrived two minutes after I ordered - perhaps everything is preproduced. It was ok... just ok. Service was good. I wouldn't return - seems a bit overrated.

What a lovely
Meal we
Had , good
Service and reasonably priced too , would
Highly recommend this venue . 
O

Popped in here on the off chance we could get an outside table for late lunch, wasnt holding my breath but a lovely waiter called Ivan told us he would sort it for us. Thanks to him we had a great lunch with amazing views right by the water. Food great, cocktails excellent and stunning location. Recommend visiting here when in the old town.

Stopped in for brunch after walking the wall. The fish soup was delicious and the breakfast platter was good, as well. Note: their omelette is really eggs sunny side up so be aware. Service was great and it was reasonably priced.

We went for an evening meal and were fortunate enough to have a table right on the waterfront with a stunning view of the city. The food was simple but delicious and was excellent value for money. An added touch when we asked about the local drinks they gave us a little sample to try on the house. Really lovely evening.
Amazing setting and atmosfere. The food is good, but not spectacular. It would be great if they would serve afternoon food for dinner as well. The service is really great!

We had the pleasure of enjoying our final dinner in Dubrovnik at this venue and are so glad we did! 

The location was incredible, it is located on the very edge of old town with a view of the port and city walls with a lovely romantic atmosphere at dusk as the sun is setting and perfect for people watching. Highly recommend booking in advance to try and reserve an ocean front table if you can!

The service we received was some of the best we have experienced in Europe, the waiter was incredibly attentive and was very knowlegable about the menu, traditional cuisine and local produce and also made an effort to connect to his guests by sharing personal stories and jokes which contributed to a fun evening! From our viewpoint it looked like all guests received individualised service of this standard.

The food was so full of local flavour, seafood was fresh and everything was beautifully presented! 

We enjoyed the below:

Entrees:
Sea Magic (oyster, prawns, tuna tartare) 
Truffle and Mushroom Linguini (amazing!)

Mains:
Croatian Fish Stew ( amazing!)
Fish Alforno 

Dessert:
Creme Catalana

Drinks:
Pina Colada (amazing!)

Highly recommend you visit this venue whilst in Dubrovnik!

I have eaten here twice now, a month apart. First time, on the square side, the Maitre and I got chatting about local wines and he brought me a number of small glasses to try - and then took them off the bill! Second time, on the harbour side, great jazz duet playing (why don't people feel the need to applaud great music), again great food - do have the truffled tagliatelle!) , lovely wine and an incredibly attentive and friendly waiter. A magical and friendly place to eat great food at silly cheap prices.

This restaurant is very large and stretches from the Centre of the old town to the port. We went to dinner one night and went to the port side which has a lovely view of the port and is very pretty when all the lights are on. We had’nt made a booking but we waited for a table at the bar and we did not have to wait long to be seated. The staff are very professional and we had a lovely night .Food is good and marginally more expensive than some other places but the setting is worth it. We also had lunch on the old town section of the restaurant which has outdoor tables and a great place to people watch.You can also just have a drink or coffee in this part. We went to this part on a few occasions and I would definitely return if I visit Dubrovnik again.

Very good food and service!
We took beef steak, beef bourguignon, mussels and calamari. Soooo tasteful !
And Croatia wines are amazing !
Good food, atmosphere. People very kind. To recommend. I made the booking through mail. Anita was very kind and answered soon and very clear.
Really nice atmosphere, located just by the harbor. Food and drinks were amazing, very good value for money. Service was very nice and professional.

Situated in the old arsenal right on the edge of the old harbour this is a great place to eat.
A bit more "up-market" than many other restauarnts nearby, the food was excellent and the service very professional and friendly.
Fabulous service, wonderful food. Peaceful atmosphere, recommend for breakfast where you can sit in sun or shade!

After a long day exploring the old city of Dubrovnik, Lokrum island and swimming in the clear refreshing Adriatic Sea we dined at The Arsenal. If you can get an outside table while the sun is setting which is very romantic and bonus points with the wife but if not inside has its own charm. 
 The staff is friendly, happy to answer your questions and will not rush you to make a meal decision. While enjoying your drink calm breezes relaxes and cool you down. After your meal decision is made it will not be long before it is in front of you. You will enjoy this gastronomic eatery. A good walk will top the evening off.

It was the best meal we’ve had in Dubrovnik.
For starters we had oysters and mussels, both fresh and delicious.
We then had the monkfish which was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.
Our waiter was polite and attentive without being over the top.

Amazing setting, great drinks and food!

Would definitely recommend!

In 3 days in Dubrovnik we went to this restaurant twice. This is already a review!
Good food in a beautiful location, in the Old Town, with a very nice staff.
We ordered 3 main dishes and a bottle of water and the price was about 180 kune (around 25 euro) per person. Good balance between quality and price.

Excellent service and good food

Tuna tartar was excellent. We had a very good server with excellent service and view from the port.

We actually went for breakfast and dinner today. We ate on the port side both times which we thought was the best side. The view of the harbour is nice and there is a nice breeze to cool you off. The food was fantastic both times. The salmon this evening was very nice. Staff and very nice and efficient. We will be back tomorrow for breakfast again

Note that this place has two seating areas: one overlooking the city and other overlooking the port (choose the port for a relaxed meal and the city view for drinks/coffee or desert)

This place specializes in sea food, but does have meat and some vegetarian options

We tried:
- Starter: sea magic, which is a mix of their Tuna tartar, creamy shrimp and Ston Oyster: this was fresh and tasted excellent 
- For main: creamy truffle and mushroom linguine, creamy as advertised but more mushroom than truffle 

Good food, attentive service and great ambiance

A beautiful meal in a beautiful setting. The view here is amazing, great ambience, tasty choices and delicious wine. Not the cheapest but well worth the price paid. £150 for 4 adults for olives, a main course each and 2 bottles of wine between us.
Visited for breakfast - lovely setting looking out onto the harbour. Great service and reasonably priced breakfast. Highly recommend when visiting Dubrovnik old town.

We arrived with no reservation & got the front table next to the port- very lucky as it was full. 
We ordered a bottle of the Croatian rosé which was light & fresh & a bottle of sparkling water. 

For staters: the mussels & the octopus

The mussels were tasty but needed proper debearding & were extremely tiny. 6/10 
The octopus starter was ok, though the black caviar topping made it too salty 5/10

The main courses: fish of the day with vegetables- verdict on fish - fresh & tasty but the vegetables tasted like yesterday’s left overs. 
Fish stew- mussels/fish & super tiny prawns. 9/10 for flavour but the seafood itself was underwhelming. 5/10

We got a pistachio cake as a treat from the restaurant at the end, thank you. 

In total it cost us roughly €115 for 2 adults. 
The view & ambience was great but at the expense of food quality.
Fabulous restaurant great for fish staff excellent and lovely place to just sit for a snack and people watch will be back

The sheer number of restaurants touting for business in the centre of Dubrovnik makes choosing the right one extremely challenging. However, we were lucky enough to secure a table here for morning coffee on the Luza side of the restaurant and decided to return later for some lunch. We were indeed lucky as I suspect booking is usually essential?

We were shown to a pleasant table on the Old Town Port side where we watched the tenders from the cruise ships spew out literally thousands of gawping passengers, herded into walking tour groups. We felt slightly smug on our comfortable balcony.

Croatia is not yet a gourmet destination by any criteria but the meal we had here was one of the best we experienced, certainly in Dubrovnik itself. The price level reflected the quality of the food – not always a given in such a touristy destination? Fresh fish, tasty local desserts and warm, friendly and professional service, particularly from our charming waiter, Ivan the (very, very) Tall! Highly recommended.

This is the second time I've been here with my wife and two daughters. Both occasions were very good. However the second one was much better because my daughters dinner wasn't as good as the first one yet the response was fantastic. Not only did the staff replace her meal we were given free drinks. Excellent food and excellent service. Staff are very helpful and friendly.

Professional staff and nice setting. Did breakfast lunch and dinner here on different days. Busy spot but that is a good sign. Make sure to go to harbour side tables. Like all restaurants in old town pricey but this one was worth it. All others seemed to be indifferent

We arrived without a booking and received quick attention. They found us a lovely table looking towards the harbour. The attention we received was amazing. 

The meal sensational to make it simply the perfect evening.

This is really a perfect place to enjoy food and views over montains and marina/boats!
Situated at the old port you will find good food (with a reasonable price) and perfect service!

We came for coffee one morning and dessert one evening. Coffee and dessert OK (not great), service slow and the background piped music was too loud and did not suit the ambience of the location or this historical town.The view pf the main street is good or sit on the harbor side for a more peaceful time and lovely view.

We came only for coffee, desert and something quick to eat, nothing fancy. Coffee was bad, desert was nice, service slow, view on the harbor - very nice. Have to admit, legions of people were there and around, so staff was busy. Prices were extreme high, however normal/average for this area.

My girlfriend and I were served by Ivo who was gave us the best service we have ever had in Dubrovnik! The food was incredible and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone coming to visit. The restaurant is located next to the most beautiful buildings in old town and makes for a very romantic setting. We would love to come back here again soon!

The view from this restaurant is what made us go and eat here. Be sure to go in and sit of the port facing side rather than on the square inside the walls. It’s also worth booking ahead as the first 3 rows of seating outside are booked usually if you turn up on the day. The food was good, nothing spectacular but certainly not bad. The waiter was very friendly and helped explain the local water polo game going on at the time in the nearby port area which was very interesting. Worth a visit if your in the area mainly for the view early evening as the sun is going down.

What a great location overlooking the harbour. Food is spectacular, fresh and reasonably priced. Wine is fantastic, have the Pino Grigio... from the region! Outstanding....

Stejpan our waiter was unbelievable. So engaging, made us feel welcome and also he shared stories of the wine region.

Must try this restaurant.
Great food, reasonable pricing, outstanding service. We went for dinner and breakfast. Would recommend.

The ambiance of the Arsenal is amazing! Beautifully set inside the old walls of the city on the seaside. Service is excellent as well. The food could use some oversight. The pork belly had a good flavor but was 90% a thick piece of fat. The mashed cauliflower “potatoes” need some spice love. 
The salmon was fishy and overcooked and tough. 
In Dubrovnik all drinks are carefully measured. 
For an expensive restaurant I hope they put more effort into the food because the ambiance is amazing!

Gradska Javan’s arsenal restaurant serves the most delicious entrees and the service is exceptional. My group went back a few times to try other options and to take in the breathtaking view they offer!!!

Went here for an early dinner and managed a table with a view. If you want a table closest to the water you would want to reserve in advance. The restaurant is huge so I think you wouldn’t have an issue getting a seat. The restaurant is lovely and the staff was attentive. My husband had the steak and said it was fine. My monkfish on the other hand was very disappointing. The fish was so over cooked it was difficult to eat and the dish lacked flavor overall. The dessert (Dubrovnik cake) was good but overall I couldn’t recommend. The setting is great so maybe a breakfast would be your best bed here. The cocktails are actually amazing so this I could recommend. For price reference we had 2 mains, 1 dessert, 1 bottle of wine, and 1 cocktail and it was about €110.

Staying in Dubrovnik for 5 nights, this was the only place my wife and I chose to return to after our first visit.

The food and service were both exemplary, which is what brought us back the second time.

Both visits, we ate a classic dish - mussels and fries! The portions were easily big enough to share between two (we had just finished kayaking so had worked up quite an appetite).

The general vibe of the restaurant, is relaxed and friendly. During our visits, we noticed certain small details that showed the restaurant is well managed.

Daniel, our waiter on both occasions, deserves a special mention - humorous, professional, with a very good memory (he remembered us and what we ate from our first visit, warmly welcoming us on our second!).

Should we return to Dubrovnik, which I hope we will, we will be making a beeline to Gradska Kavana Arsenal and asking for Daniel!! 😁

Beautiful restaurant with impeccable service. Everyone from the hostess to the servers were extremely attentive and nice. The view was great, towards the port, with live music. The food was excellent. I highly recommend it for a great experience.

We had an absolutely excellent experience at this restaurant. The location is perfect, just overlooking the sea. The price is what you would expect for a high-spec restaurant, where both fish and meat are prepared to the highest of specs. The service was fast, courteous and efficient (our waiter, Ante, was looking after us in the best of the ways). We had a mix of cold and hot starters, as well as meat and fish mains. In all cases, the food was cooked to perfection, and the presentation was spot on. The selection of wines was really good (we opted for a local white, which was excellent); only thing not at the same level of the rest were the deserts, which were quite plain. We had an espresso to end the dinner, and this was really good! Overall an excellent choice of restaurant.

For my birthday and our wedding anniversary - the same day - we decided to book a front table at this amazing restaurant where, previously, we had light snacks and cocktails.
Not today - on a previous visit we discovered that Chateaubriand is a house speciality and served by Damir, our waiter, the steak was cooked perfectly and accompanied by mediterranean vegetables and fruit skewers with a flavoursome bearnaise sauce.... utterly awesome!
A couple of generous bombay sapphires with fentimans tonic added the sumptuousness and decadence that eating here embodies.
This places really needs a sixth circle on a TripAdvisor review.
Chateaubriand.... chateau brilliant!!!
We will be back!!

Would highly recommend visiting this restaurant at some point but should book as it’s popular. We were lucky to get squeezed in. 

The staff are superb and very attentive to your every need. Very helpful if you need advice with wines and food. 

The food is superb - would recommend the mussels, rib eye, beef bourguignon and cheese cake. Great selection of food and wine to choose from. Prices are decent. 

Great views of the harbour! We also had drinks here at the other side of the restaurant which overlooks the Main Street on another evening which was great too.

What a fine establishment, we were recommended to visit this restaurant by a friend and his recommendation was spot on. The food, service and ambience are perfect. Our waiter Marijo was excellent and really cared that we enjoyed our experience. We are here for 3 more days and will definitely return.

We had a meal here tonight. It was the best meal so far on the trip. 
The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, the ambience was outstanding. The view of the port plus the high ceilings. 
The food was delish and the kids had really wanted chicken and this was done to perfection. I had the fish stew. It was spicy and I have been craving spice and it was perfect. Just what I needed. 
The local wines here are so good and they had a white wine that was 100 kuna cheaper here than the Michelin starred restaurant we went to yesterday. 
This is high end but worth every penny. 
Thank you for giving us our best night in Dubrovnik!

Sophisticated restaurant from all aspects! The octoubus salad is a must and the waiters there are really wonderful, you can see in them their honest and genuine care that you taken care of. Location is the best in Dubrovnik old town.
