Unbeatable view of the harbour, food was incredible, the other 2 sister restaurants are definitely worth checking out too!

We were almost put off by the prices at this restaurant as they are higher than those around it however we were not disappointed. Worth every penny - the food was absolutely delicious and the staff were very friendly. Despite being a very busy evening we were quickly given a table. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was buzzing with live music and happy customers. 

Highly recommend this restaurant for a special evening.

During our short stay in Dubrovnik we wen to this restaurant twice! We loved the venue right in the water. The food and the service were excellent and the prices were fair for being in this premium location. If I get back will definitely go back and get a nice meal here.

Stopped in for breakfast.
Well presented staff cheerfully arranged a table for us, half sun, half shade, as we wanted.
Proper tablecloths and napkins, wonderful outlook through the archway to the harbour, professional and attentive service.
Cooked breakfast served with a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. Perfect.
Not the cheapest, but absolutely reasonable for excellent surroundings and a delicious, relaxed breakfast.
We have already recommended it to others and would definitely return.

A day before we departure it was impossible not no notice this classic restaurant at the end of the main stradun . After all our 5* hotel proposed it in such case we would manage to book a table. All restaurants in old town are more or less look the same touristic but this one was standing alone guarding Saint Blaise church from one side and other one at the old marina. We were lucky to speak with his manager, a tall gentleman named Antonovic or something gave us a promotion card of 10% and proposed us to come tomorrow and waiting a while to get a table. This is what we did and while we were placed in a back table at the veranda watching the old port, we requested to move forward on a front table.Before we even drink a glass of water we've been asked to move to the front-best ever view-table. The kind manager surprised us by coming and asking if we like the view (he took care of pleasing us). We ordered tartare steak and burata cheese for appetizers and their local white whine. Both were fresh and tasty . For main coarse my sea bass was much much better of the ones I tasted previous days,100% fresh with crunchy skin and a nose breaking gnocchi with tartufo . The total experience was surprising from aspect of discovering a classy place with decent service in a total touristic area. As for pricing believe me it was the only restaurant worth money to spend and less expensive

We were here for lunch and had a table right near the edge of the old town port. Beautiful table! Ask for table 201/301. Really tasty and flavorful food. We shared a burrata and caprese salad with arugula, excellent! I had the sea bass and it was soooo good! My wife had the monkfish, while good, was not as good as the sea bass. It really adds to the experience by having a table near the waters edge. Enjoyed watching the boats coming and going.

The staff is adorable. The food is just perfect. The setting, unsurpassable. I cannot get enough of this lovely place. I am leaving Dubrovnik in two days and I will return for lunch and dinner. Bravo.

For different reasons, I have brought groups of friends and family and students to Dubrovnik over the years, and part of my amateur “tour” is Arsenal. It’s so scenic and the food is actually pretty tasty and not touristy as you might expect in this location. Funny enough, I’ve had one waiter, Marijo, three times!! Each time he was sweet and friendly and attentive and made me and my people feel like welcome locals rather than people just moving through. I’d recommend a lunch or dinner at Arsenal on a beautiful sunny day when you want a breeze and a view and a pretty drink. And ask for Marijo because he’s adorable.

We had breakfast here and it was a nice relaxed meal with cappuccino. The assortment of jams provided with breakfast were excellent!
We attempted to return for dinner, but the wait was more than an hour. They recommended dining before 7:00pm
Amazing and friendly staff, delicious food and acceptable prices. Near city center and with great view over the city walls and harbour.

This place is spotless spectacular pleasant and peaceful. The staff are welcoming and the food is fantastic and the service is warm. The furniture is great and reasonably comfy. The restaurant is very busy due to the great location
It's view is just lovely while eating your ordered food. The fish selection is great as with the meat selection. It's beautiful surroundings of the stone building its so comfortable. We were served by Ivan who was very helpful and quick to serve. They have a great selection of beer and cocktail ntails as well to make this a satisfying meal and experience of Dubrovnik.
Dropped in for lunch. Very fancy. Had steak sandwich and 2 chicken sandwich's. Best ever!!! Lovely view over the old port. Bit pricey but just a special place.
This restaurant is in a great location. Make sure you get a table outside as you get a great view over the bay. The steak was nice and the cheesecake was especially tasty.

Limited menu but a little different from most of Dubrovnik Old Town restaurants. I had Parmigiani to start followed by Salmon , asparagus and potato while husband had pea and leek risotto followed by fish stew with polenta. The raspberry dream cocktail I chose was very refreshing too! Service efficient and friendly.

I made a reservation ahead of time through their website (super easy) and requested a table with a view. They more than accommodated and it was the perfect evening to end our days in Dubrovnik. The service here is amazing - very attentive staff who checked in with us often, kept our wine glasses full, and timed all of our courses perfectly! 5 bubbles for the view and service alone, but the food was good too ;).

I started with the octopus salad which looks magical. Check my photos. UNREAL. Topped with black caviar, there were chunks and chunks of fresh octopus and it was packed with flavor. SO fresh. My partner got the Dalmatian ham of course and loved it. You can never go wrong with the charcuterie in Europe. For mains, I tried something new and got the bacon-wrapped monkfish. The fish was a little dry but it was meaty and delicious nonetheless. My partner got the steak with baked potato. Now THAT was satisfying. If you are a meat and potatoes person, you need it. The herbed cheese on top was amazing, and the sauce for the steak was so, so good.

We did try the dessert, an orange "creme brulee"/pannacotta style dessert was described to us. It was definitely a firm, egg-based custard. It was not the highlight and I would have gone with a cake in hindsight or saved room for more ice cream! Just too egg-y and not sweet at all. Could be a preference. It was beautiful. 

Overall very much enjoyed the experience.

This restaurant has a great setting overlooking the old port of Dubrovnik on one side and an entrance to the main square (Luza) on the other. We requested a table overlooking the port when making our reservation and it is great for people watching and boat watching while enjoying our meal. The service was a little slow, but it was a busy evening and the food was worth the wait. We had the Fish Soup and Croatian Cheeses to start followed by the Fish Stew and the Salmon Fillet – see pictures for more details. The prices of most restaurants around Dubrovnik is very similar, so the fact this restaurant has a great setting and also good food quality is why it is a most visit if you are in Dubrovnik.

This was the first restaurant we booked in Dubrovnik old town and wow what a way to start. The setting is just perfect, menu has great choice and the food that we ordered was delicious. The friendly and professional waitress Maria made our evening feel very special.

I was in Dubrovnik on the hottest day of the year and did a full day Game of Thrones tour. After only having snacks all day I was starving and dehydrated from the heat. 
I started off with an excellent ice cold beer, and then ordered a steak that was delicious and perfectly cooked medium rare. I would definitely recommend this place after a long day of touring Dubrovnik.

My wife and I stopped here for lunch, facing the courtyard rather than the harbour.
The mussels I had were some of the best I’ve tasted anywhere! 
When we come back to Dubrovnik we’ll be back here for sure.

I booked well in advance and requested a table for two on the terrace by the harbour. We had, in my opinion, the best table in the restaurant. The food was excellent but the service was beyond that! Our waiter Daniel went out of his way to make our meal a special one.

Had found this place online and booked a table for two for a special dinner...
Everything was very good, service faultless and friendly... The food was amazing.
It feels slightly expensive but I can't think what you have to pay in the UK for such an experience.

Gradska kavana Arsenal is a very central restaurant in Dubrovnik with a great view on the harbor and city walls, which would make you think it is an overpriced and low quality restaurant as many in the city. However nothing could be farer from what this restaurant is: good quality food, more than fair prices, excellent and kind service. I wonder why we haven’t come here before, it’s definitely the best place we have tried in our trip to Dubrovnik.
Amazing views, tables are well placed and excellent food.... The rissoto and the red snapper were out of this world... Tasted so fresh... Waiter was on top form... Went with my son...

Visited Gradska Kavana Arsenal today the 15th August with my mum. We had such a fabulous experience for lunch. The staff were lovely our server Marijo couldn’t do enough for us. Would definitely recommend :)

Amazing experience and great service! Everyone from the staff is polite and helpful. 
We had both lunch and breakfast there and the food was great!

My husband and I ate dinner here last night and the food was delicious. Our waiter Ivan was very friendly and helped us pick a great wine. We had oysters to start which were fresh and yummy! I had the pork belly and my husband had the veal back strap. The Pink G&T cocktail was so good!
My friends and I loved this restaurant so we came twice during our time in Dubrovnik. The food, drinks and service were incredible and the stunning view tops it all off!
Besides the lovely view, the waitresses are friendly which you don’t find that often in Croatia they were also fast. The food came quick too, and it tasted delicious, a true recommendation!

Sometimes, even in a busy tourist destination like Dubrovnik you have a special lunch experience, and this was one such. It was busy in the old town and a hot day. This place caught our eye and we settled for drink that subsequently morphed into lunch. When I later went to the bathroom, I was amazed to find that the restaurant extended all the way to the harbour and that we had in fact walked past it earlier in the morning. For such a big restaurant, service flows very efficiently and the food and wine are good.

Made it to this restaurant at the 2nd time if asking. Great view over the harbour of Dubrovnik and a terrific vibe to the place. As with the better places in town, the fish was both fresh and well presented. Service attentive but unobtrusive. Really good evening all round.

We sat down at 6pm and got a cracking table that looked over the harbour. We both had fish dishes, one the special which was outstanding and the monk fish which was nice. Our waiter Marco, I hope that’s is his correct name was brilliant, was so kind and caring. Thank you so much for making us feel at home. 

Megan & Matt

We had a wonderful lunch at this restaurant. We walked past many restaurants and cafes in Old Town and even though we didn't have a reservation, we were offered a table facing the sea. Good food, good service, and beautiful view. 

Must visit in Old Town.

We came here on a very busy Sunday night without booking. We were told they’d be a wait for the table, which we didn’t mind as i had read the reviews on trip advisor and wanted to go. We were given the most incredible table with the most beautiful view... we even witnessed fireworks which was beautiful. 
The food was excellent. I had the half chicken and my partner had the mussels to start and the truffle linguine. All food was fantastic. We will visit again!!!!!!

Located right on the shores of the Old Town port - you can‘t sit closer to the harbour. Make sure you‘ll have a reservation.
Menu is rather small, maybe 5 cold starters, 5 warm and 5 mains - but totally enough. Also amdalilymspecial menu in addition.
Our waiter was really nice, very friendly and did speak excellent English.
The food was absolutely great. Had seafood all over (Octopus, fish carpaccio & catch of the day) and everything was perfect. Good drinks selection, too.
Also great value for money, had around 130€ in the end for 2, and it was
totally worth it.
Can definitely recommend, among our favorite restaurants in Dubrovnik. (see other reviews) And the best around the Old Town port.

This restaurant is set in an amazing part of the old town, with arching views of the harbour creating a magnificent backdrop and atmosphere.

The food, drink and service was also spot on too! We ordered a selection of different dishes, including the squid pink seafood pasta, the sea bream and the Chateaubriand. All were beautifully presented, well cooked and tasted amazing.

This place is family friendly and will adapt their menus to suit younger kids needs.

Price was reasonable too.

We managed to get a table for 4 at this restaurant despite not having a reservation, which we were surprised but very pleased about because the setting is so beautiful! The service was fantastic and the food was delicious, between us we tried the half chickens and the fish stew which were both lovely. Would highly recommend.

Lovely restaurant in Luzo square, the food is lovely with decent prices. The female member of staff on the entrance was very friendly and polite but the two male waiters were quite rude when they got our bill wrong and had to go off and correct it, they made us feel as though we had made the error. Such a shame as this spoilt our visit.
Reasonably priced and tasty breakfast with spectacular morning view on the waterfront. They supplied honey with peppermint tea which was a lovely touch.

What a spectacular restaurant, waiters were attentive, polite, good english, fresh fish dishes were fabulous, seafood stater was amazing, dishes not overloaded just enough. Try anded a front seat people watching is great a definite must go to place

We’d got up early to walk the walls, in the hope of beating some of the queues and heat. You pass above this fabulously-located restaurant while walking the walls and if finishing at Ploče Gate then this venue is easily accessible by turning left out the gate, then turning left into the harbour area and right along the waterside. Fabulous breakfast of croissants, fresh OJ, plain omelet with proper mozzarella and tomatoes etc. What a relief to be in the shade and eating such fabulous food! Very attentive staff, too - thank you!

We were visiting the Old City and came out to this fabulous place. At first it's look very fancy, very chique, ect. It might scare some people to go inside. But as they say: "Never judge a book by it's cover". We were welcomed by a very gentle lady and asked her if they had a free table for two without reservation. The terras on the side of the square was full but she invited us inside which lead us to the other side of the building (with seaview) and asked her colleague to help us. I must say that if it wasn't for that friendly waitress we would probably have never go inside and had this wonderful experience. The other waitress told us that it was fully booked but she manage to squeeze us in her planning. Something we really appreciated. The food was excellent. The price/quality is ok. The food is delicious and the service was top. We were so amazed by the view, the food and the service that we went a second time. And once again everything was top. It's was a wonderful experience. Great applause to the staff.

I had coffee here and then wine. Both times, the service was great. There are many other places along the Stradun but this seemed busy all the time and packed. The price might be a little bit more but it's the ambiance you're paying. Worth coming here at least once.

We needed to escape the heat and rushed in here for a sit down and a coffee and were pleasantly surprised to walk in from the street and find water front views at the back. We sat and rested over coffee and delicious cake and were so taken with the place, we booked for lunch later on!
I had grilled squid which was incredible. Service was great and food was good value. Great location at the harbour and lovely views.

Gradska Kavana is a top-tier restaurant in the heart of Dubrovnik. The wait staff is fun, attentive, and courteous. The food is also incredible -- my wife and I had the leak and pea risotto, the burrata, and the veal, all which were delicious. Most importantly, our waiter Karlo, was fun and gave us excellent wine recommendations. We loved our experience at Gradska Kavana and would definitely recommend!

Visited here on kind of a whim. We had tried to book online but were told no room until after our holiday had finished - so book in advance! Ask for the South Side of the restaurant if you can, as it overlooks the harbour. For starters we had tomato and Mozarella, and Charcuterie Board. Both nice, had better Charcuterie board. Prosciutto Ham was tasty but tougher than in other places we visited. Mains we had Calamari & Sea Bass, both of which again were very nice but nothing spectacular. Value was very good. They took 10% off the bill just because they could. 2 courses each plus a bottle of wine for approx £80 we thought was very good. Expected it to be a lot more expensive given the setting.
Absolutely wonderful location, very decent food and very attentive staff! We had mussels which were ok but the pasta with truffles and mushrooms and the fish carpaccio was great!

Elegant restaurant.Good eat, beautiful view!!!. Nice service, expensive drinks as everywere
 We recommend

Although not particularly cheap, the scenery, live music and excellent food make this an unmissable restaurant. The service was friendly and attentive and my partner went as far as to say the monkfish wrapped in bacon was one of his favourite meals ever eaten, not just of the holiday! We had lunched at one of the partner restaurants just outside of Pile Gate, Dubrovka 1836, who gave us a card for 10% off at this restaurant which was an added bonus. Would highly recommend!

This is one of the few restaurants in Dubrovnik that has both acceptable prices and breathtaking views over the old city’s port. We had here the truffle linguine and the grilled calamari and both of them were excellent. I highly recommend this place for an amazing dinner right in the heart of Dubrovnik.

Fabulous restaurant, great food and wine. Staff are very efficient and attentive without being intrusive ! 
Gorgeous views of the port of Dubrovnik !
Great setting, very good service and food. Pea and leek risotto was excellent. Tried reserving, but said they couldn’t guarantee. Walked up and they seated us immediately.

I was initially sceptical how the staff would be able to cope with the demands of a busy service period, but I was pleasantly surprised by fast and efficient service. The staff were all welcoming and approachable, always proactively approaching us throughout the service.
The menu provided a wide selection of seafood and meat dishes ( Not advisable for those looking for vegan dishes), in appetizers and main dishes. I had the hot appetizer of Sea and Mountains, adequate portion of salmon and prawns, but I would have liked to been given a slightly more generous amount of wild mushrooms. Interesting pasta dipped in squid ink but I did not seem to taste any different. My companion ordered the Tuna from the specials menu, which was excellent when cooked medium-rare.
I would recommend asking for the dessert from the waiter, as the Almond and White Chocolate cake especially was delicious!!
Overall, highly recommend visiting this restaurant, with a decent selection of food and welcoming and engaging staff, who went above and beyond to satisfy our needs!!

The location is fantastic with great views of the port and general people watching. The service is friendly and unobtrusive. The tuna steak was one of the best I’ve ever had and the Sauvignon wine suggestion from the waiter complimented it brilliantly. I would definitely recommend for lunch, dinner or drinks.

-Salmon was cooked to hell, pork belly was ok but absolutely nothing special. 
+ good service
+ ok wine list
We have Eaten a couple of times it’s a proper nice place to eat we have the chateaubriand one night it was lovely, boss views and that, would highly recommend this place !

The view is unparalleled to others ! Fresh fish and seafood of all types . Our Server Marijo was professional and friendly . Actually one of the first who possessed both in all our restaurant experiences in Croatia ! All seemed to work together and service worked precise and well. Highly recommend . Maybe get a reservation if you want a front view seat. Harder to come by.

Visited just after a morning boat trip and enjoyed an amazing meal with great views of the harbour. A special mention to the waiting staff who were brilliant, accommodating off-menu requests for fussy kids. Highly recommended

My boyfriend proposed to me up on the city walls so as a celebration we chose here! The meal was lovely although I was so shocked and excited I didn’t get to enjoy it as much! My fiancé had the mussels to start, I had the eggplant and sea bass for the main (which was amazing!) and Paul had the beef cheek which was beautiful as well. We shared the chocolate and orange cake and I’m not a fan of chocolate cake but this was lovely and light! Would definitely recommend here and the service and staff were lovely

We had breakfast here after the Early Bird walking tour. Croissants and coffee very nice. The only negative thing I’d say is that the fruit salad was rather uninspiring for the upmarket place it is - basically finely chopped melon and pineapple. Service top and the location absolutely second to none. Would definitely visit again!

Exquisite food with prompt and polite service. Came for my anniversary meal and it was just purely brilliant. Has a marine view and very idyllic atmosphere. If you come to Dubrovnik do not leave without coming here! Looking at around €80-100 for a good meal so make sure you have plenty to spend. Will not regret it.

We walked in w/o any reservation and thanks to the staff, they helped us to find a table that we can get a view of the port. Recommendations were great and we enjoyed our lunch including their local wine & desserts very much. Service was great too!
We visited this place 3 times in 2 days, really good food and service. Views are amazing as well highly recommend

Went here without a reservation, but the nice staff soloved the issue quickly and got us a table. The service was outstanding ans everything we ate tasted amazing. We took many starters, main dishes, desserts, drinks and wines. Beautiful atmosphere and amazing food! Go here!!!
We celebrated my daughter's birthday here and had a memorable dinner. Everything was perfect: location, views, food, wine and service. We will return

Underwhelmed by the food. We managed to get seated overlooking the boats which was very nice. The waiter was exceptional and attentive, they all looked very smart.
The food at best was very average.
Mussels for starters at 98kn each where very very salty and had a large number unopened, what did open were small and the flavour was overwhelmed by the saltiness of the liquor.
Mains, half marinated chicken was just bland chicken, belly pork one was OK and one was mainly fat and finally rib eye steak was good but cooked more than requested.
Passed comment to the waiter about the salty mussels and we received 10% from the bill which was a nice gesture.
Similar bill to the previous night but we had 3 courses and coffee and great food.

The location is excellent and the waiters are the nicest. 
They have local dishes and drinks. You can seat with a view from the cathedral or on the other side with an ocean view. 
The desserts are very good!

Despite hearing mixed reviews about this place the setting alone enticed me. So happy I did! I was greeted by a very welcoming hostess who gave me a number of options to sit. I chose a table on the terrace but far enough in to enjoy some air conditioning too. My waiter came along and just did everything to ensure I enjoyed my visit. So friendly, accommodating and efficient, he made it a really lovely experience. His name was/is Brianmir. He was super. On to the food: I had the parmigiana melanzane for lunch. It was delicious. I absorbed what the tables around me were having and it all looked delicious. Lots and lots of fish. As I was alone I couldn’t help but overhear what people were saying about their dishes & it was all positive. I highly recommend this place. You won’t be disappointed.

This is a landmark cafe (on the Square side) and restaurant (on the waterfront side). Worth having a drink at on the Square side at sunset during the summer, and to eat at on the waterfront side for lunch or dinner. Food was very good. Great atmosphere - elegant, sophisticated, but fun. They have music on the waterfront side. Service is generally good, but at times, some of the seating staff can be a bit arrogant/lots of attitude. The bathrooms, however, can really use a redo - very run down. Alright, but quite dated and old.
We ordered fish of the day for two. The waiter fillet the fish for us, and recomended a good croatian wine. It was very tasteful and delicious. Very satisfied with the service.

Last year my wife and I had a fantastic meal at Gradska Kavana Arsenal, this time we bought our whole family!
We had a lovely table overlooking the marina and our waiter, Zvonimir, was highly attentive. We had salmon, pork belly, calamari and steak - all excellent. The recommended Dignac wine was also very tasty.
We love this restaurant and hope to visit again soon.

We have done a 5 week Europe holiday including some really expensive restaurants in Italy and Croatia.
As this was toward the end we wanted something on the cheaper scale.
This place exceeded all expectations food and service wise. Marija was the friendliest waiter ever. She went out of her way to organize a meal that the kids would like smiling the whole time. 
All round a great place to eat.

Right in front of the sea, the place of that restaurant is perfect. Friday noon and it is full of people. The staff offers a nice table to sit. Food was very delicious, cocktails also very good and the final bill ok. For four main courses, 1 salad, 4 coctails, 2 beers and 2 appetizers we paid 120 euro.

We hadn't booked but they managed to find us a great table on the harbour side within 5 minutes. The views were amazing, as was the service. The waiters were very attentive but not overbearing. Food was great and plenty of it and the atmosphere was also awesome. The live jazz music was a nice touch. Would highly recommend

We had a really great dinner here, the best meal on our Croatia vacation. Great location and great food. Our waiter, Karlo, was was sweet and charming, and made great recommendations. We would absolutely recommend the place. Only downside is that it’s a bit on the pricey range for Croatia, but this is reflected in the food and the service.

This restaurant has amazing views on either side of it: the harbour on one and the old town on the other. It’s beautifully set out, the service was outstanding and the seafood was excellent. We had mussels, seafood pie, pasta and pudding. 
The cocktails were also so good we returned a second time for that too. If you’re going to try seafood and you want the type of romantic/classy ambience that you don’t get at other places, try it here. I came with 2 friends and we loved it. One of us had the creme caramel pudding, which was also amazing. For context: we are in our 30’s and this place had the perfect tone for a grown up meal where you can dress up. The waiters were fantastic and very attentive. Loved it.

We reserved the restaurant for our first evening in Dubrovnik after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We had a table under the arches overlooking the old port which was a great place to watch the world go by. The service was good - just the right amount of attention and good gaps between course - we just wished that the food could have been a bit more special - my Monkfish was overcooked and a bit tough, the bacon it was wrapped in was fatty and not crisp, the veg were a bit bland. Overall it was OK but certainly nothing special.
Such a perfect view and romantic music during our last dinner in Dubrovnik. They have a fresh seafoods.
Ordered the Beef Burger and was really satisfied. Great size, excellent taste and good looking. Came with fries, ketchup and mayo. Will definitely visit again!

Gradska Kavana Arsenal is the ideal spot for a long lunch. Situated by the small Dubrovnik harbour it is sheltered and cool from the heat of the Adriatic sun.
Book ahead for the terrace but the inside given its open air venue is still wonderful.
From the comfort of the terrace you can see the world float by with small boats and excursion vessels coming and going.
There was a very enjoyable piano accompanied by a trumpet playing in the background.
I had the octopus salad to start and the whole sea bass. The octopus was served under a layer of caviar.... excellent flavour and presentation.
The sea bass was deftly deboned at my table by the waiter and served with a medley of sautéed vegetables.
Whilst there were other appealing dishes on the menu, next time i am in Dubrovnik I will return to Gradska Kavana Arsenal for the same selection, the view and the music.

We really enjoyed lunch while watching the people and boats in the Harbour. It was really hot day and it was nice to have lunch under big historic arches . Food and desserts were excellent. Very friendly staff and reasonable price for the quality and service you are getting
Food and service both fantastic. Sailor risotto and fillet steak delicious. Moderately priced for great food and even better location

This was quite the most magical restaurant we have been to in a long time. The situation on the old harbour, the views, the food, the service and the ambiance - all were terrific. The restaurant is large and has several sections. You can eat on the terrace in the old town square or on the sea front overlooking the harbour and the walls. The service was very friendly and efficient, the food beautifully prepared and presented and very tasty. Coffee and cakes for morning or afternoon tea were lovely. We went back again and again!

We'd struggled to book a table here for several nights but on our last evening in Dubrovnik decided to take a chance as a walk in.
Look was with us and we got a table for two at the rear of the terrace looking onto the harbour. A great view.
We had no sooner made our orders than nature started to give a light show out over the harbour looking towards Cavtat.Thunder and lightning with a tropical downpour and gusting winds. The staff reacted by reseating those unlucky enough to be catching the brunt of the weather and leaving us in our (dry) seats with an uninterrupted view of the elements. I won't note the dishes we had because it became apparent that everything was of a very high standard and well prepared. 
Staff were excellent on arrival, throughout the meal and as it happened even afterwards giving greta service.

Enjoyed lunch here after a morning boat trip. The food and service was excellent and it a great place to sit and watch the comings and goings in the harbour. It is the same group as Nautika and Drubraka 1863.

Overall, I have been to this restaurant few times in my 4 days visit. With nice view of the sea and kings landing, the dinner food is fairly priced at par with Local rates in different restaurants I have tried. The breakfast has certain options at reasonable price and service is great. Will definitely come again.

Ice cold beer, good wine, great food and an incredible view of the harbor. Seriously, what more could anyone ask. Glad we selected this restaurant to have lunch during our recent visit to Dubrovnik. Also, very nice restrooms!

We went for a meal with a group of friends. 

Everything from the service to the decor to the food was top class. 

We had a good selection of the menu between us so we could try a few things and we could not fault anything. 

The food is fresh, well cooked and presented. 

In terms of value for money. Yes it’s a bit more expensive compared to other results but it’s worth every penny.

The same restaurant faces the old town on one side and port on the other.i prefer the port side which has nice views .I like the setting and vibe of the place.Service was excellent .i din like the dish I ordered they changed it immediately to something I liked.

Had a wonderful lunch/dinner here today. We were staying in Mlini and took the boat to Dubrovnik at 12.30. Made a 4pm booking for this restaurant as soon as we got off the boat around 1. Came back a little early for dinner at 3pm. Definitely the best time! Had a long lazy lunch with Daniel as our perfect host. Pork Belly, Sea Bass and Croatian Rose were all delicious. Worked-off dinner by walking the whole wall (entrance close the the restaurant). Time for a beer to cool off and watch the final set of Federer v Djokovic before getting the boat back to Mlini at 8.30 ...... a perfect day ..... thank you
Every time we are in Dubrovnik we love to go there for a light lunch. Nice view, quite ambience and very friendly staff. Excellent food perfectly presented for parents but also kids taste .

Villa Dubrovnik recommended Arsenal to us as a place for cocktails before our dinner at 360 (see separate review), and it was simply great. As we were only staying for an hour, the pleasant staff seated us at a prime table overlooking the harbor, and the view of the passing boats was terrific. There is an extensive cocktail list and our drinks were excellent, generously sized and consisting of fresh, delicious ingredients, The dinner menu looked great as well, so we hope to return to try the food. Prices were fair given the location and the fact that it's Dubrovnik. Highly recommended.

A most enjoyable meal in a lovely location, overlooking the old port. I had pre booked a number of weeks ago to guarantee a good spot on the terrace. The big galleon made an appearance in the harbour before sunset, too. 
We all chose four different main courses. Pork confit with cauliflower; chicken with ratatouille; monk fish wrapped in bacon; rib-eye steak were all delicious and sufficient in size. Our clean plates said it all. 
The complimentary home made bread baskets with olive oil and balsamic was a nice touch. For dessert we shared a cheesecake with ice-cream.
The staff and service was first class.
We can now enjoy a 10% discount at any of the other sister restaurants in Dubrovnik.
Looking forward to Restaurant Panorama before we head home and leave this stunning, historical & special city behind. We’ll be back!

This would be the second time i have visited this restaurant and had the best views and seats in the house. The staff cannot do enough for you and food is so nice. Take in the live music playing and the views around you. Truly unforgettable evening. x

My family and I came here for breakfast and it's really a fabulous restaurant. We got a table outside right by the water and the view is breathtaking. They have a good selection of food and freshly squeezed juices. The coffee and tea was excellent as well. It was so hot out when we went (in the mid 90's) so I had them bring a tea and lots of ice to make a fresh ice tea. Damir our waiter was fabulous.

The restaurant is huge. He tells me it used to be an old shipping yard. Just beautiful. The food was good and fresh. 

Also, just to tell you how honest Damir is, when it came time to pay I paid with my credit card but like everywhere else in Croatia, you can't leave a tip on your credit card so you have to leave it in cash. My were just coming from Prague where the exchange rate was different. I left him too much (the equivalent of 50% of the bill). He quickly gave me the money back and told me I must have made a mistake because it was too much. What an honest and classy guy that is a good representative of this classy restaurant where the waiters all wear ties.

I ended up giving him a really good tip for being so honest. I highly recommend this place.

It is located in an extremely privileged location, waiters are super nice and will remember you if you go more than once! (it also offers 10% discount if you go multiple times). The menu is a bit limited but quite tasty and the breakfasts are not expensive compared to other places in the area.

It might seem a touristic restaurant as for the spot, but the food and the service are of high quality. Classy place, good wine offer and tasty food. For the quality offered the prices are really good. Lovely atmosphere with live music. We will come back again if we plan a second visit in Dubrovnik!
Excellent service and very good food! Would definitely come again and recommend this to anyone visiting old town Dubrovnik. The Old Fashioned cocktail was AMAZING! Hands down best old fashioned ever.

Brilliant location and the food was excellent. Our server Daniel as such a lovely man, and he made the evening just great. The food may be a bit more pricey than others but wow it’s worth every cent.. a must visit I restaurant but book in advance to get a table with a view

The Gradska Kavana Arsenal is a beautifully classy restaurant and bar with two facades, one facing out onto the harbour, the other onto the main strip of the old town. The establishment looks extremely classy, somewhere you’d expect to pay a fortune, especially considering the location, but you don’t! The staff are extremely professional but very friendly and courteous with it. We went there, probably looking a bit sweaty and dishevelled on an very hot day, and the service was fantastic. It’s a lovely place to watch the world go by in very classy surroundings. I’d go back here every time I go to Dubrovnik!

We stopped here after walking aimlessly around Old Town Dubrovnik on our first night in town. I looked this up on TripAdvisor prior to entering. The reviews were right. This restaurant was a really nice place to dine. Upon entry, the host asked if we had a reservation, which we did not. He did find us a table though. 

I enjoyed the salmon filet with beets, asparagus, and potatoes. I would have liked more asparagus, but that was fine. My boyfriend ordered the sea bass filet and enjoyed it. For cocktails, we had the Burning Desire and the Taste of Spring. Both were very refreshing on a very hot evening. We ordered the rozata for dessert, and it was a fantastic choice. 

I would recommend this restaurant for the view and the tasty food. The server was attentive and very friendly.

Such a fantastic setting and location, I was worried that the food and service wouldn’t match but was I wrong!

We had a fantastic server, who recommended wine, dishes and shared relevant information, he was always available when we needed. 

The food was brilliant and easily the best restaurant we visited on our trip. Surprisingly the meal was just above average cost, considering the quality I was really surprised especially with other restaurants so overpriced in old town. 

The atmosphere was of chilled casual smart ambience. To get the full experience you do want to dress smart casual and if you want a sea/port view then I’d suggest a reservation way in advance. 

Lastly the ambient music gave the restaurant such a beautiful feel, especially as the sunset. It was only half way through the meal we saw it was live, 2 gentlemen’s playing continuously. They were fantastic and I thanked them on the way out. 

Overall a romantic location, fantastic food & great service, a must visit restaurant!

My husband and I ate here last night on recommendation from a friend and are so glad we did. We didnt have a reservation but got one of the last tables and the waiter moved us closer to the harbour before we ordered as a table became available. The setting and ambiance was amazing and before we had even had any food we already loved this restaurant. The service was the perfect pace allowing enough time to enjoy the setting and each course. Lovely bread was served after ordering and topped up by our server. I had the seafood pasta for starter and sea bass for main, both were delicious and really fresh seafood. My husband had the meat and cheese board to start and steak for main which were also excellent. The portions were very good, especially the seafood pasta to start which was very generous. Throught the meal a piano played beautiful music in the background including the game of thrones theme tune which we really enjoyed! Would recommend booking as we got lucky to get our table and ask for a table close to the harbour. The bill came to approx €100 which included 3 glasses of prosecco, 1 cocktail, 2 starters and 2 mains which for the quality, service and setting we thought was definitely worth it.

Overall we absolutely loved this meal and are already hoping to go back for our first anniversary dinner tomorrow night, it is definitely a celebration type of restaurant!

Had a lovely meal at this restaurant, the location and setting is delightful, the food and wine were wonderful and the service great.

The night we went was even on the chilly side and there were electric heaters and blankets provided meaning we were comfortable at all times. 

Couldn’t fault it
In this restaurant is everything in its place. The restaurant is very clean. The waiters are overwhelming. Food is great. Any honor for the whole team. You're great. Excellent view.

Beautiful location, great food, fabulous service. Enjoyed two beautiful evenings in the Port in Arsenal.
Highly recommended. Bravo to the excellent staff.....

We asked for a table overlooking the harbour, but these were reserved. We were seated inside but the staff moved us when one became available (without us pushing the point). Very attentive, service orientated staff. Lovely food, beautifully presented.
This is a lovely restaurant with excellent staff and quality food. Visited three times during vacation and each time enjoyed our food and service.

Sitting to the spacious terrace in the old town and having the best breakfast in town, that’s how a day in Dubrovnik shall start. The city is not yet busy by al the tourist and you get the feeling to flow with the locals into the day. The breakfast is well assorted and excellently prepared and presented. The waiters are still in best mood and will help you with all you need. Wen enjoyed all three mornings here during our stay in this beautiful city.

This restaurant is situated in the old city in Dubrovnik in a lovely setting. At one end of the restaurant you have tables looking out onto the port and at the other end where we sat twice looking over the old town. Both are idyllic, and we choose the old town view as you get to people watch and also enjoy the sunset. Staff are great, friendly,helpful and very professional. A simple menu that offers good variety mainly between seafood and meat dishes. For dinner we started with some oysters that were not large but tasty, this was followed by the salmon fillet and the sea bass fillet for myself. Both were beautiful and being really greedy we shared a slice of cheesecake that my wife said was to die for. A good selection of very nice cocktails as well. If you are in Dubrovnik in the old town I believe this restaurant is a must,

Lovely evening meal along the waterfront. We thought the service was brilliant, everyone was very welcoming, attentive and smiley. 

Food was the best we had during our stay - highly recommend the monkfish wrapped in bacon and the fish al forno for mains, the cheese platter and zucchini for starters. 

It was really hot during our stay but this was the coolest restaurant we ate at, sheltered from the sun and plenty of fans for a comfortable evening meal, as well as lovely views of the water. 

Would highly recommend this place if you’re looking for good food and a relaxing atmosphere!

The restaurant is perfectly located in the old Arsenal in front of the old port.
Try to sit outside, this is one of the best views in the old town.
They offer fish and seafood and some meat dishes, too.
I have eaten calamari with Swiss chard, a mixed salad with a big bottle of water and an Espresso.
The taste was fine, only the mixed salad was very easy, only green and red salad and 2 pieces of tomato.
All together 30€.
The service was very fast and good.
The price is too high but you pay for the perfect location.
I enjoyed my lunch with the perfect view on the harbor.

Great setting looking out across the Old Town Port. Staff were very helpful and explained which items on the menu I could eat that were gluten free and I was provided with my own gluten free bread basket which was a nice touch. The only down side was that my main had a sauce removed as it contained gluten but I wasn’t told about that when ordering. Would definitely return!

We decided to have dinner at Gradska Kavana Arenal as we thought it would be nice to have dinner with a view and the menu looked pretty good. We ordered the Burrata Caprese salad, mussels and whole fish (bream). Dinner was very pleasant and this was enhanced by the service of our very efficient waiter, Ivan the tall, who was very efficient and personable. Ivan also very skilfully filleted our cooked fish for us. We also ordered dessert but that was just ok. This is a restaurant worth visiting

Fantastic place lovely food beautifully presented staff so nice friendly we went a few time lunch dinner and coffee and cake.one member of staff was a look a like for a young prince harry aka karlos really nice ,one visit there was no table but he moved planters and put tables together for us,so we had a great meal on our last night.All staff were so helpful and friendly so thank you for making our visit special.

Gradska kavana Arsenal is a large popular waterside Mediterranean mid priced restaurant. Situated right by the waterfront at the old dock area of Old Dubrovnik town. To avoid disappointment I would advise booking, however we went early evening, and had no issues being seated. This restaurant has many tables and can offer external seating both out on the terrace facing the sea and out in the Main Street of old town. They also have inside seating presumably for the cooler months. The food is Reasonably priced, very tasty and excellent value for money. On the other hand however wine, so not such great value. The cheapest Merlot by bottle is 240.00kn. That said the wines are of a good quality, and do compliment the food well. The staff are very friendly, and our waiter Maro, in particular knew all about the food and wine the restaurant had to offer, making some excellent suggestions. We had a three course meal with wine for around £80. All aspects of the establishment were spotlessly clean, and attention to detail obvious both in presentation and staff training. My only point would be, not sure about they’re accessibility, the entrance and exit we used were both stepped.
My wife and l popped in here for a 'light' lunch... the service and food were great. Well worth a visit if you are in the area. Good too for 'people' watching

We were lucky enough to be seated at a corner right in front of the port, facing amazing view of the opsite side of old town. Food itself was great and creative, staff were very friendly and also proud of their recipe. Ribeye was cooked appropriately, which you don’t see that often in other Croatian restaurants. So far one of the best restaurants we have visited in Croatia!

We had booked in advance which I would think is advisable as this was a bustling restaurant overlooking the harbour. We had a table with a great view and the waiting staff were attentive and well trained. The food was good and price reasonable.

My wife and I wanted to eat some seafood in the old town of Dubrovnik. Friends recommended Arsenal and they were right on the money. Terrific ambiance, located on the edge of the fortification right on the water’s edge, with efficient yet unobtrusive wait staff it is a pleasure just to walk in. 
A large selection of drinks, beer and wine and a terrific menu focused on seafood. Our waiter Mihai also showed us a large selection of fresh fish that could be either grilled or baked. 
We had Croatian white wine that was dry but with the right acidity to go with the seafood, two different kinds of bread,a generous very fresh garden salad, an Octopus salad that was covered in caviar, just for starters. 
Our main courses were; three large pieces of sea bass grilled to perfection on top of a bed of julienne vegetables and a seafood risotto that was heavy on the seafood and light on the risotto. Outstanding!
We cannot wait to return to this restaurant again,

Arsenal is a great restaurant which is located at the Old Harbour, Dubrovnik.
We always call in to see our Croatian friend Tomislav who makes sure that you receive service with a smile.
We just wanted drinks today as we had already eaten. So we had a couple of cocktails.
The restaurant is in a perfect spot, the atmosphere is always great.
We have eaten there before and the menu and food is always exceptional.
 
Although you can sometimes be lucky, I would recommend a reservation 

I would also recommend this at the sister hotel Nautika, which is another favourite of ours whilst in Dubrovnik.

Try it you will not be disappointed!

My cocktail was Poseidon and my husband had an Old Fashioned.
Very, Very good

We enjoyed a dinner in this amazing restaurant in this wonderful location. The waiter who served us was friendly and helpful. We had 2 starters - a leek and pea risotto and a seafood pasta dish followed by a mains of a sea bass fish special for two with roasted veg. Also had a beautiful bottle of white Croatian wine recommended by our waiter. Best meal of our holiday, good value, good service in an excellent location with views to die for. Highly recommend a visit.

So many reasons to come to Gradska Kavana
First we arrived around 11:00 for desert and drinks
The girl at the front desk was so accommodating by
moving tables around and getting us by the window overlooking the water.
Then Ivan our waiter was excellent.
We had drinks and then some ice cream with chocolate syrup.
Love the gin and tonic, monitors great also.
The view was extrodinary and would love to come back in the future.

This restaurant is in a great location with romantic view over the water . You will be not be disappointed. The two of us spent about 50 euro with no wine - great value for what you get in terms of food quality and service . If you want a table by the water , reservation. Is highly recommended

Great food, beautiful location, excellent service and attention.
A special thanks to Nadina who organized a birthday cake and a trompet celebration for my mother-in-law.
We definitely recommend!

Absolutely stunning restaurant, and actually not that expensive. Would highly recommend booking and specifically requesting a waterfront table (this can be done online). We went at lunch which had gorgeous views over the water, harbour and mountains - which you might not get so well in the dark. Great service, fantastic food and has to be one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik.

We are fairly well travelled. We enjoy food and wine and culture. 

I’m sometimes incredibly irritating trying to find somewhere good to eat. This however is my new favourite restaurant in the world.

Everything and I mean everything works like clockwork. The service, the food, the maitre de, the wine, the view, the space, the style, the swallows (yes, the swallows) are on point.

The menu is limited and so much the better for it. It is not cheap. That is not the point. Is it expensive? No. Is it value for money? Indeed.

Even the coffee was on point.

Don’t go anywhere else, you will be disappointed.

If you do not like this restaurant, you are wrong.

Sorry about the photo.

Very classy restaurant with option of two views.... one side overlooks the harbour and the other onto Sponza Palace. Staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient and salad lunch & drinks were delicious. We also popped in for a glass of fizz prior to attending a wedding at Sponza Palace so sat at that side!!!

We reserved a table so we could sit by the arch way and enjoy the view which we would recommend anyone do as the restaurant does get very busy. 
We enjoyed staters and mains with a bottle of local white wine. 
The service was very good, our waiter made us feel very welcome as did all of the staff. Would definitely return.

We had drinks and a salad a couple days ago on the interior terrace side of the restaurant and it was so good we decided to go back and sit on the sea side for dinner. Ivan was our server and he was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine selections and gave us excellent service. We had the chateaubriand for 2 and it was amazing! We highly recommend this restaurant.

Was there with friends and discovered this gem around the old town, a bit tucked away.. but the atmosphere here is so much lovely, the staff were friendly and attentive and very kind and we had such a brilliant experience that we kept going back here. Became our favourite restaurant during the stay and a regular. 
Shame we realised that there are other restaurants from the same chain and we never got a chance to explore any of them.

Located inside Dubrovnik old town this is a restaurant with a double view of the city to one side and the harbour to the other . We just stopped for a drink but ended up having a meal - one of our best in Croatia - vegetarian starters included aubergine parmiagani, linguine with truffles and a risotto . The bread and oil starter was excellent and the wine a local saucing in well chilled if a bit pricey . partners grilled octopus salad was well presented and my aubergine dish tasty with grilled polenta - good size starter portions

We enjoyed a lazy coffee in the terrace overlooking the square in the morning and decided that it would be lovely to eat dinner overlooking the harbour that evening. Unfortunately we weren't able to book as the waterside tables were all booked even though there was a large seating area. However when we arrived we were quickly shown to a lovely table. Our waitress was great and the view over the harbour was good. My choice of food was also good, I had the fish of the day which was well cooked, but sadly my husband found his risotto starter bland and the pork belly and cauliflower disappointing as the meat was tough and the cauliflower puree was split and watery. Overall we had a good evening as the atmosphere was lovely with live music and lovely views but felt that the evening was slightly let down by the food.
We had breakfast here twice and it was lovely! Great tasting food complimented by an amazing view out onto the harbour. The price was also very good for breakfast!

We came here for our last breakfast of our 2 day stay and wish we had tried it earlier. The restaurant is very big and comfortable. We sat on the square side instead of the waterfront side which was in the shade and we enjoyed the cool breeze.

Lovely location but amazing food and service. We had Daniel as our main waiter, who was very professional but lovely too, and Ivan (the tall) also helped and was lovely too, carved our chateaubriand excellently. We eat out a lot and this was the best chateaubriand that we have ever had, and very reasonable at around £40 for two, all the food, starters , mains, desert excellent and whole experience made better by the service - perfect!!
A lovely place with delicious food, great wines, nice view on the port, live music and very friendly service (which is not that obvious in Dubrovnik). I would warmly recommend.

Beautiful place with delicious food. Such a friendly staff! Five stars especially to all the waiters, excellent service from beginning to the end! This was such an unforgettable experience for us and heavenly end to our Dubrovnik stay. :) THANK YOU!

An excellent location with the friendliest and most professional staff. The food was delicious! We had mussels, chicken and beef. The local wine matched our food perfectly. Such a nice ending for our vacation in Croatia! Five stars!!

Just a wonderful place for dinner. An incredible location overlooking the marina, really good quality food, good wine and AMAZING service. I must thank Ivan our waiter for making my wife's birthday so special. 

It's the small touches which make a restaurant top class (asked for my wife's name so they could sing it properly when they brought out a cake, always ensuring glasses were topped up) and this place has it. 

Make a booking. They will look after you and to top it all its really good value as well.

This Place has 2 seating areas, one on a balcony by the sea and a view of the castle and one on the street side with a view of the old town, which is where we sat people watching. Had a very acceptable meal and wine, and it was great for our first night in Dubrovnik.

We had an exquisite meal here. 
Excellent service. Amazing location on edge of old town with view. 
Very impressive food - amazing steak, gourmet style presentation and taste on all courses, generous portions. 
We did not book but would advise booking as we were lucky to get a table for a slot.

I had the best time. My waiter Vlaho deserves a shoutout also! Loved his recommendations on wine and food, ate facing Old Town and drank the wine facing the boats. 

The Sea-bass was just delicious, I needed more fish but it was delicious!!

A must go to spot!

Thank you Vlaho!

Went today with our friends staff were so helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Ante very efficient service . The food was amazing we had lunch there . The setting was spectacular would definitely go back

This is a fantastic Restaurant had the most amazing food and was served by an amazing waiter named Ermin. This guy has a degree in History and is a great character. He has great product knowledge and advised us on the best wine according to our taste. Going for the 3rd time before we leave. A must visit for both the location and quality of food and service.

We enjoyed a lovely dinner on the terrace facing the old port. By evening, the sun had gone to the other side of the restaurant leaving all of the port side tables in shade. Table 404 is in the middle, at the front if you want a beautiful of the port and city walls.

Cocktails were lovely, food was amazing! Staff were so friendly and wonderful. 

I would definitely rev booking and going here for a good evening out.
Fantastic food, service and a beautiful setting in the old town port. Slightly less expensive than average in dubrovnik, despite stunning location.
Spotted this restaurant from above as we circumvented the walls of Dubrovnik. Great food and engaging server made this a memorable experience for the 10 hours we were in port.
The reason I say this, not just because of the food but the overall experience, the view, the setting, the service!!
We had breakfast and dinner here. We loved the location, service and food. Beautiful view of the harbor! It always full here, so I suggest making reservation for dinner.

I visited at the start of June for my birthday whilst visiting Dubrovnik with my partner and we were not disappointed. The food, drinks, location and service was outstanding and staff were very friendly and accommodating, making us feel very welcome. We had such a great evening that we ended up spending 4 hours dining that evening as it was so amazing.

I would highlighting recommend booking in advance to get a table at the front with a view of the harbour as it adds to the whole experience.

But overall an amazing restaurant with great location, service, food/drink at great value and is definitely one of the best restaurants I've ever been!

Had a couple of meals here. Very good service & quality of food. Ate starters with a side salad as we found that this was large enough. However, like the rest of Dubrovnik, it is expensive to eat in the town and the cost of the wine.
This is a very popular restaurant, so, if you really need to eat here, I would suggest booking a table, although the staff will do their best to accommodate you.

The best thing about this restaurant was the service, the staff were so attention and kind and up for a laugh! Thanks to Romana she was such a nice server and a pleasure to meet. This was our second time here and we absolutely loved it yet again. The food was also beautiful, we had the monkfish and the steak which were beautiful. Not to mention the scenery absolutely was gorgeous. We sat out inside the city walls which id recommend but there is also an option to sit by the sea. Definitely recommend in Dubrovnik!
Visited a couple of times, had great food and service was amazing. Beautiful view of the harbour also. Highly recommend!
Polite staff and delicious food. I enjoyed the food and the beautiful view of the harbor. Would recommend :)

This is definitely one of the best restaurants ever! I had 2 dinners and 1 lunch here and i regretted not coming on the 4th day because i was on a day trip to Montenegro. I had the Fried Calamari with swiss chard and potatoes twice, the amazing whole fish dish with potatoes & vegetbles, Fish soup and some Oyster pieces with red wine. Everything was perfect! The food, service, cleanliness... I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone who’s visiting Dubrovnik. It is in the heart of the old town, next to St. Blaise cathedral and the clock tower. Prices were fine, given the excellent quality of food presented. The place was always packed with tourists though it is very large, the best example of how popular this restaurant is.

What an absolute triple threat, quadrupole if you include the service! Wife and I decided on here after some extensive research and were rewarded with some excellent food. The seafood risotto was one of the best tomato based risottos I’ve had, and the pea risotto also went down very well with the wife! Beef bourguignon and Salmon for mains were full of flavour, taste and great portion sizes. We treated ourselves to the Dingac Royal, which was more than our food, but what a wine! 

If you want high quality for great value, and a great view for that matter, this is the place to go.

Without a doubt our favorite restaurant whilst staying near Dubrovnik, we ate here twice and they were the best meals during our stay. The location, with tables either overlooking the harbour or on the square allows lots of people watching while being treated with fantastic service and drinking the fabulous local wines. The staff are attentive and knowledgeable and the food is just amazing. There's no rush to get you away from your table, so you can just relax and enjoy the whole experience. We were very pleasantly surprised that the cost of several courses and wine was so reasonable. It's worth booking for harbour side tables, as this is a very popular restaurant. Definitely not to be missed if you're in Dubrovnik.

Right in the middle of town. The best place for people watching with the floods of tourists pouring in all day. Sit back with a glass of wine and enjoy the delicious seafood risotto. We also had dinner one night and it did not disappoint. It has a beautiful view of the harbour on the opposite side of the restaurant. Other than the waiter forgetting the salad we ordered, everything was great.

This was our favorite dining experience in Croatia. The food, service, location and atmosphere all contributed to it being a wonderful last evening in Dubrovnik for us. This was the most expensive meal we had - but it was 100% worth it for the location and quality of the food, and still not as expensive as we'd pay for a similar dining experience in London. We had a main course each - Salmon and Beef Cheek - and were happy with the portion size, but squeezed in a desert too - Cheesecake and the Special. The meal was rounded off with a complimentary glass of the resturants own Grappa, which was lovely! All the staff were attentive and polite, but Daniel in particular went above and beyond to make our dining experience special. Highly recommend!
The food & entertainment was amazing! We were here for a Croatian “theme” dinner with a big group. 7 course meal = the best! Couldn’t get enough of all the food, it was just so good!

The first appeal was the amazing location overlooking the old port harbour- magical as the sun sets and the lights come out. The menu was enticing with wide local options and definitely did not disappoint- the Sea Bass special was absolutely amazing and I would also highly recommend the Rose Gin cocktail. 
Wonderful service; the waiters were extremely professional, quick and attentive to a solo diner with 
extra flourishes that made a great experience and heaters and blankets if you need them. Definitely great food and service for a very reasonable price and the band was great! A must visit for any trip to Dubrovnik.

We visited the Arsenal several times during our stay for coffee and pastries - which was lovely - and then we went for dinner. Wow - great food (starter was like a work of art!). The team were very welcoming and friendly and the food was fantastic. I would echo other reviews that say it is so reasonably priced for the food and attentive service you receive. Would highly recommend a visit.

My partner and I had a very enjoyable meal here this afternoon. The food was amazing and the staff were so nice, helpful and friendly. I suffer with a number of food intolerances and allergies, lactose, egg and yeast being some and have them printed in English and Croatian on a card. I enquired about the steak sandwich as I only wanted a light meal and asked whether it would be possible to serve it without the bread and cheese. The waiter said they could do that and took my card in to show the chef. The whole process was so easy, and the food and service were outstanding. Thank you for being so adaptable and understanding of allergies.

I had dinner here with a friend and was accommodated to be seated outside near the streets. We had the mussels with white wine as starters and the grilled chicken as main dish. The mussels was fresh and taste really good!! My hometown is known for fresh mussels so I would say I know how fresh ones look and taste like. The price is reasonable and I even came back the following day for breakfast. The staff have been very helpful and attentive both my visits. Highly recommended!!

The Gradska Kavana Arsenal is a delightful place to eat, especially if you are seated among the arcdes overlooking the harbor. It is even better if the pirate ship comes sailing in as you eat. Fantastic fish, too!

We thought this restaurant looked expensive but actually it represented real value for money, the food was beautifully presented, quick and effective service, and a great place to “people watch” we tried another restaurant but quite frankly it was more expensive and half as good as this one, so we went back - every day of our holiday!
Had a great time at Gradska kavana Restaurant! Great service and very good pricing compared to the rest of dubrovnik

We stumbled on this large cafe/restaurant after walking much of the city walls.It consists of a front terrace on the town side, a large indoor area and a covered area at the back overlooking the beautiful harbour. Heaters are provided at both front and back and blankets if you feel at all cold.
We had a coffee and had a look at the menu for dinner which looked good.
The following evening the concierge managed to get us a table for dinner as a walk in- they were fully booked as expected.The food was wonderful,the service from an array of different staff was amazing.The meal was concluded with a complimentary glass of some local fig liqueur.
Special mention to the girl who looked after us during the meal and took the time to talk to us at the end. I forget her name- she was some kind of supervisor, taking orders for food,preparing tables for the next diners. She didnt deliver food or drink, but did deliver the liqueur.
Also,the pianist playing that evening was good.
Reserve a table in advance at this fantastic restaurant, preferably in the covered rear area. Enjoy the view and the lovely food-the highlight and the last night of our stay in Dubrovnik.

We chose to eat here on our last night in Dubrovnik and it did not disappoint. The host managed to sort us out a table in the port looking out onto the beautiful view- which was spectacular!! The staff were more than accommodating and extremely friendly. The atmosphere in the restaurant almost felt that you were having a private dinner even though in reality the restaurant was packed! The food was amazing- we had chicken, sea bass and the parmigiana starter. 
Price was a bit steep- but you pay for the view and if you have a discount card you can get 10% off (which we only found out after sadly).
This is a must for anyone staying in Dubrovnik- probably one of the nicest meals I’ve ever had in the most lovely surroundings - thank you to all the wonderful staff 😊
The food was perfect, the waitress very helpful willing to recommend the best dishes, the pasta with truffle oil was delicious.

The welcome in the restaurant is perfect. staff look after you, available, professional and attentive. We had diner to this place 3 times during our holidays and we really appreciated the situation with the wonderful view on the bay but also the area which is smart and cozy. The dishes are excellent quality , fresh food and perfectly cooked . The service is high level . this is with no doubt one of the best place to eat in the old town. A little prayer addressed to future visitors, don’t forget to applaud the musicians , they are really part of the team and contribute to the nice moment we all spent in the restaurant. We found a bit sad that nobody will show a bit of attention and recognition . We congratulated them but we were on each occasion the only ones. Thanks to all great staff, ladies at the entrance , waiters, and musicians for the good times we had 
This will stay one good memory in our holidays in Dubrovnik
.The food and service is excellent, nothing too much trouble. I would recommend to anyone visiting Dubrovnik to stop & have meal or a drink at the very least. Amazing views,

Tried Arsenal based on a local recommendation for great food and atmosphere and was let down by the food a bit. Beautiful indoor outdoor patio to dine with live music and attentive staff. Had sea bass, seafood pasta, monkfish and seafood stew and except for the stew nothing was really special which is unfortunate for the price. Would recommend more for the view and ambience.

Wonderful breakfast on the terrace in the heart of the old city of Dubrovnik. Lovely setting. Good service: Karlo and Roberto were excellent. Nice coffee. Fresh pastries. Nicely presented. Good value for Dubrovnik.
Good place for seafood and people watching. Right by the port. The grilled calamari with spinach and potatoes was delightful. So was the grilled salmon.

Gradska Kavana Arsenal was our first place we ate when visiting Dubrovnik and it did not disappoint.
The weather was unseasonably cold however the restaurant was very accommodating with blankets and heaters to keep diners warm.
The service was amazing and the food good also
The wine was very good also which we allowed our waiter to guide us on the best local wines. 
The cost was a bit high however from what we have seen is about the normal amount in Dubrovnik, a meal for 2 with a few drinks each cost 540 kuna or €80 or $120 Australian.

Note: in Croatia if you want to tip for service it should only be done in cash so make sure you carry cash with you.

In the center of Dubrovnik, you sit in the shade with the (little) harbor in front of you. Unjostled as those sitting in the sun barely covered by umbrellas try to keep their elbows off their neighbors. The view is magnificent. The food is superb. It does cost more, but it is worth every Kuna. Four of us ordered two whole fish catch of the day filleted table side and served with perfectly cooked vegetables. A perfectly lovely leisurely lunch.

Excellent meal with VERY friendly and pleasant staff. We sat outside despite it being a bit windy and cool. The heat lamps and blankets were very welcome to ward off the chill. We asked for wine recommendations and our waiter chose just the right local Pinot and local white (delicious). Marinated zucchini with feta as an appetizer was perfect, the fish stew and salmon filets were also very good. I would highly recommend this place to visitors.

We were very unlikely when we stayed in Dubrovnik as it rained all weekend but finding this place really gave us a glimpse of how fabulous a stay in the city can be. 

We popped on for lunch and ask for a table inside as it was chilly and raining. The lady who welcomed us advised that the terrace overlooking the harbour would be much better for what we want. I was a bit worried about being cold but they had lots of heaters and lots of blankets. The food and wine were excellent. simple but well done. The staff were very professional but above all else, this restaurant is beautiful. 

Have already added to a list of much visit to friends coming later in the summer

We came to Arsenal when we visited Croatia as a couple ten years ago, and was a favourite then. This time we came for a family lunch with our 4 and 7 year old for old times sake. We ordered several dishes and recommend the Sailors risotto and zucchini salad with feta. They brought our 4 year olds chicken sandwich later than everything else, along with another soup which they apologised profusely for and offered two free glasses of wine, which we accepted as kind enough. However, when we asked for the bill at the end of the meal they refused to let us pay! The whole lunch free of charge just because two dishes came out in the wrong order. Definitely over and above what was required and we left a generous tip. An example of how lovely so many of the Croatian people have been throughout our holiday. Definitely worth a trip for the food, service and the view is the marina. Highly recommended!

We ended up coming to this amazing restaurant two nights in a row. The quality of food and service is outstanding (shout out to Ivan the tall) and great location overlooking the harbour, with reasonable prices.

Come here for the view!! Many may not know about it but this restaurant is split into 4 dining areas: the outdoor patio, indoors out front, indoors out back (looks like you’re dining in a cave), and by the sea. Definitely opt for the 4th option if you have the chance. Dining by the sea was such an amazing experience. Their oysters were amazing as well

What a setting for a restaurant! Unbelievable views of the old port and Adriatic whilst the sun sets and the last boats come to dock for the night. A chap playing a piano in the corner as some of the best sea food I’ve ever had arrives. 
The Oysters to start are sensational and only 19kn each! An absolutely marvellous place to spend an evening relaxing and dining in the beautiful setting of the Dubrovnik Old Town. Would highly recommend.

We happened upon this restaurant on our first night in Dubrovnik and it was excellent. The wine steward was very knowledgeable and suggested an excellent local wine. Our appetizers and dinner were fantastic as well. Very fresh, local, beautiful presentation and flavors. It was a really nice touch to have blankets at each chair for those who may have needed them. There are two sides to the restaurant, the one side is looking into the old city, the other side looks to the sea, which is where we dined. I would recommend walking around to the sea side for a beautiful view.

We found this very nice restaurant in Trip Advisor and the reviews are true: food very good, served by Karlo with sympathy. He also suggested a very good Merlot wine from Dalmácia (the region where Dubrovnik belongs). I ate a fish filet and my wife.choose beef - both were very good.

We have visited Gradska Kavana Arsenal three times on our trip. The food and coffee are excellent.

We are vegetarian and enjoyed the vegetarian sandwich with french fries and the vegetarian breakfast. We also stopped one afternoon for coffee and cake.

The staff are friendly and helpful. Having recognised us from an earlier visit we received a 10% discount on subsequent visits.

Would highly recommend this place.

We ate here on our first night, the food was lovely and the service prompt, the terrace views overlooking the harbour and the live jazz band was excellent. This is for sure a good spot to chill and have a relaxing evening meal.
A tad pricey but they do give out 10% vouchers for future meals there and there other x3 sister restaurants around Dubrovnik. 
Would recommend.

My friend organized dinner at this restaurant for my birthday. For starter we had oysters which were fresh, and For our mains steak and calamari, food was delicious. For dessert our Waiter suprised me with birthday cake which definitely completed my day . Thank you!

Just back from 4 nights in Dubrovnik with my mom. Our favourite place in the Old Town was this restaurant with the elegant seaside patio overlooking the harbour. (There’s a front patio, too, that looks out on one of the main squares of the Old Town.) We went twice! The first time I left my mom there to have lunch while I walked the city wall. She said her burger was the best she’d ever eaten. I joined her after my walk for a cocktail (Aperol Spritz - highly recommended!) and enjoyed the charming service as well. (Ask to be seated in Marijo’s section...he’s cheeky, funny and very good at his job.) We liked it all so much that we went back the next day and had a great experience the second time too. There are a lot of restaurant options in Old Town Dubrovnik, but this place is hands down the best in our books

We selected this restaurant based on reviews. The hostess was very helpful and found us a table along the harbor. It was chilly, so there were heat lamps and blankets. The food was delicious, the ambiance nice, and the service was fantastic. Our waitress Marija was an absolute delight. We had the Green Rhapsody appetizer, mussels and grilled calamari. Delicious!

On our first visit, we had just finished walking around the walls on a hot day and were relieved to find somewhere cool to sit, with a lovely view of the harbor. We had a vegetarian in our group, and he had plenty of choice (and this can be an issue in the east of Europe). The food was very good, if a little over priced compared to other places we visited in the city.
