However, we did get a little discount card for the next time we visited (10% off), so we did, and the food was great again and we had a table by the arch so had an unobstructed view.

The staff are all very friendly.

Dubrovnik in the rain, but then we found this wonderful restaurant. Atmospheric location over looking the marina in the old arsenal. Great wines and interesting menu. A wide selection of dishes that can be starters or reasonable sized mains. Beautifully served. Great find. The next day we realised that the came restaurant has another outlet facing on to the main square next to the Marin Drzic statue- great location for tea and cake after an afternoon of site seeing for people watching. We tried to back again for dinner, but it was full. Suggest booking ahead.

Came here on our first evening in Dubrovnik and what a great choice. The location is beautiful just like the restaurant itself. The staff were very welcoming and our waiter was helpful, patient and had a great sense of humor. We sat outside and my wife really appreciated the blanket that was provided as it was a little chilly, we were also treated to excellent background music provided by a pianist and saxophonist duet. Our food was delicious especially the Monkfish and the Dubrovnik Crème Caramel. My wife really enjoyed her rose gin and tonic and I the local red wine. We were given a 10% discount card which you can use here and at the Dubravka and Panorama restaurants which are also very good.

Look - this is a difficult one. The views are of course incredible - directly in front of the harbour - they have prime location! The staff were beautiful, friendly, attentive, talkative and even offered us a discount for their cafe. 
We ordered calamari for a light lunch. The portion size perfect! The calamari very very tasty with sea salt I think. On a bed of potato and swiss chard which was rather bland. The food is okay. The beer and wine were perfectly fine (local of course) - just feel the food let it down. But don't not go there because of that - its worth the experience of sitting there.

The food was fantastic! Staff were very pleasant and accommodating and the service was spot on!!! Vzonmir is an exceptional waiter. He knows his product well! Well done! 

Thank you for making my birthday extra special! U are great!!! 👏👏👏

Nice place, slow working and menu does not say exactly what they serve and no excuses for any apologies. 
I asked an Oktopus Salad. Nothing else describing the starter dish. For my surprise it was topped with caviar. Great for those who like it, I can’t. Absolutely small. The waiter brought me the menu to show it was described. It was not. We paid it, but if you do not want to be treated like that, do not go there.

Fabulous setting, great food, and incredibly good service. Celebrated my partners birthday on the 17th may, booked a harbour side view table and received such wonderful service, particularly by Marijo, who helped to make a memorable and special evening. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

There is no doubt that half of the appeal of this restaurant is it’s views and the fact it is covered to shelter from the sun (or in our case potential rain showers!) However the food is tasty and there is nothing better than a glass of Posip and mussels overlooking the harbour. Also got to try my first Mali Ston oyster and rozata (creme caramel) dessert.
A lovely dinner with beautiful views. The tuna steak and fish al forno were excellent and good value for money, and the waiter was very friendly and attentive.

My friend and I went there for lunch. Best restaurant in Dubrovnik. Idyllic setting. Excellent, professional, friendly service. Best octopus salad ever had! Delicious mussels. 
Superb fish dishes. 
Special thanks to Igor for really looking after us and to the manager Martin who gave us an amazing dining experience.
Can’t recommend it enough. A must for anyone coming to this treasure of a city

Had lunch here today absolutely fantastic food and service,I had a starter of pea and leek risotto with a main of beef cheeks melt in your mouth beautiful ,my wife had a superb burger and quite a tasty cosmopolitan our waiter Daniel was extremely attentive without being overly familiar with some great suggestions from the menu and tips for seeing Dubrovnik .I would highly recommended it for lunch or dinner and I found it reasonably priced €62 for the above and a mineral water.

Our group of about 100 had a planned evening of canapés, wines, local folk dance and musicians, and a plated 4- course meal. 
Nice job, lovely location, professional service.

Prime idyllic setting in Dubrovnik old town. 
Octopus salad - truly spectacular. Substantial portion of mussels. 
Very tasty local sea bass. 
Our waiter Ivan : very professional, friendly and helpful 
Everything was perfect and faultless!!!
P.s thank you all the team especially Igor general manager for making out last day special 
I can’t recommend enough

We visited this restaurant for lunch twice. On the second visit we had a full baked fish which was excellent with great views looking over the sea. 

We we go again ? 100%

I expected a restaurant in this location to be over priced, but thought i would risk it due to the view and the amazing aroma emanating from inside. it wasn't at all. In addition to the fantastic view the service was excellent, the food delicious and the portions excellent value for money. Thoroughly recommend it.

Beautiful setting and friendly staff! We went for lunch with our 4 month old little girl and the staff could not be more helpful, even offering to take back my husbands burger as it might have gotten cold as he was holding the baby while I ate. The food was also delicious!! The salmon dish was lovely!! There is also a baby changing table in the ladies toilets and they do offer high chairs which have padding in.

the outdoor seating area (not water facing) is set on a raised area so you can enjoy your breakfast safely away from the tour groups rushing by... breakfast was reasonably priced and very tasty. This is definitely my breakfast recommendation for the area.

After a long day, we stopped at Gradska Kavana Arsenal to enjoy a cup of coffee. It was relaxing and a great decision. My wife had a capuchino and I enjoyed a cafe latte. Great choices!

The menu is extensive and you can just about order anything to your liking.

After a really awful meal at another place, we decided to pop here for desserts and drinks! The staff were more than happy to help with this.

The cakes were amazing and the Bellinis lovely and refreshing. Friendly staff and lovely atmosphere.

Will definitely be back for a full meal!

This is a nice spot, we didnt sit port side, we sat on the side next to the Square, Service was great, we had 2 starters i had the Parmigiana and my wife had the Prosciutto, both were lovely and then the mains came promptly, I had the chicken and my wife had the monkfish, both mains were lovely. We couldnt quite fit in a dessert.

Not the cheapest place in Dubrovnik, but if you want to eat next to the Main square or Harbour then you pay the premium.

Would certainly visit again

Came here a couple of times. Amazing location looking over the harbour
 The hostess is fantastic so helpful and accomodating. We had one of the best wines here. The food was excellent and service outstanding.

Gradska Kavana Arsenal is everything you expect from a restaurant in the above-average price bracket: a superb location near the little harbour, good food, excellent and attentive service, and yes, above-average prices. Make sure you reserve your table if you want to eat on one of the two terraces!

Most of the food places inside the walls are the same price so we went for this because it faced port. Would say you can easily order 3starters and skip the mains. Big , nice portions, plus that way you could try more. We ordered 2 starters and catch of the day, and two beers. End up paying around £85...pretty pricey for what you get to be honest. Main, catch of the day was pretty disappointing with few vegetables, definitely not worth 350 ~ 380kunas . Starters were lovely, definitely more effort put into it. Waitresses pretty chatting, will check on you every 5mins. Can't have any privacy.

Stopped here with a group of 8 people following a tour. Can’t express enough how much we enjoyed the experience. Food was excellent. We tried the waiters recommendation of scorpion fish and we also had the salmon, the chicken salad sandwich, mussels, oysters, and seafood risotto. Everyone enjoyed their meal and our waiter Stepjan was amazing. In addition the views are stunning. Definitely would return again in the future.

Lovely friendly staff who will talk to you and helpful when choosing a gluten free meal. it was limited but the meal was great and a bonus for me was a slice of gluten free cheese cake! 

We sat by the marina had a lovely view while eating our meal. They gave us a 10% discount card that can be used at the other restaurants they have in the old town which we did use

We have just had a wonderful time at this restaurant. The service and atmosphere were perfect. My daughter is gluten free, she had the choice of the whole menu except a couple of pasta dishes. It was her birthday celebration so it couldn't have been better.

This is not just another restaurant. This is the best restaurant in town and one which can be justly proud of that title. The food and service are second to none.My wife and I came 6 times during our stay and each visit was a delight. Sheer pleasure. Thank you to the staff and management for making it for us the complete dining experience.
Very pleasant thoughtful staff. 100 euros for a plate of mussels (shared starter) two main courses and a local bottle of fizz.

We went to this fabulous restaurant for Breakfast, lunch and dinner. . The staff are attentive and friendly. The prices are very reasonable. They have a terrace that overlooks the main street, an inside area should it be raining and one overlooking the harbour. If its a bit chilly, heaters and blankets are provided. A great way to people watch whilst enjoying a glass of vino.
With an extensive menu and quality food we closed our sailing trip at this fantastic location, in the historic port of Dubrovnik.
Delicious grilled squid and a pasta with mushrooms. Get a table on the rail overlooking the harbor: #101, 201, 301 .... to 701.

This restaurant has everything. 
Two outdoor locations one overlooking the harbour & one looking into the Old Town + inside if you prefer not being open to the elements.
We eat overlooking the Harbour, which has a great view of boats coming in & out + a fantastic ambience. If you feel a little bit chilly they have blankets that you can put round you & there are also various heaters around.

Now to the food, there were 4 people in our party & we all chose different dishes , each one was of a very high standard & very tasty the local wine that the waiter suggested was great.

All the waiters were so friendly & very helpful , couldn't have asked for more.

There was even a couple of musicians playing great mood music.
Fantastic evening.

Me and my partner ate here 3 times over the last week and every time was amazing! From the toasted sandwich with mediteranian vegetables to the outstanding steak for two all of it was incredible! Thank you for giving us such a great time we can't wait to return . P.s the gluten free dessert of white chocolate and almond cake was to die for!

Used to come here regularly when I visited Dubrovnik a number of years ago and made a point on returning on our brief visit.
It was very busy but found seat on terrace. We just had the lovely hot chocolate and beer whilst people watching.
Staff were friendly and will be sure to return when we visit the lovely city of Dubrovnik in the future.

During our recent trip to Dubrovnik, we visited Gradska Kavana three times - and were served in three distinctly separate sections of this large establishment. Outside overlooking the old harbour, we had a wonderful meal of grilled calamari for my wife, and bacon-wrapped monkfish for myself. A week later, we ate indoors in an elegant setting with guests, and the staff made our evening very special. Thanks especially to Marijo! Before leaving Dubrovnik, we had dessert and coffee at the front part of the restaurant on the main square. Three unique experiences, all wonderful...highly recommended!

Sister restaurant to the Panorama at the top of the cable car. Tried this after having a fabulous afternoon tea at the cable car. Was not disappointed. The location could not be beaten, right on harbour front. Staff were amazing, that very fine judgement between friendly, attentive and respectful. We ate here on two separate nights and the food was amazing both times. The chateau-briand was the price of a basic steak in the UK, and was absolutely melt in the mouth. On the other occasion we had monkfish wrapped in bacon, which tasted like a huge scallop it was so meaty. Wish there were restaurants half as good as this one in the UK - very very special.
A supremely well-run restaurant with highly motivated staff. The food and wine were outstanding. We liked it so much we visited three times in three days. Very, very highly recommended.
We ate overlooking the sea and it was perfect food was beautifully cooked local wine was lovely too deserts were lovely perfect evening

A coffee stop for us, although many people dining and food looked good. We managed to get a table right at the front so we had "ringside" seats to watch comings and going in the harbour. And good wifi.

Enjoyed a very nice dinner here to celebrate Friends Birthday. Food was delicious and Tanja our server was so friendly and helpful. Great view of the harbour and quite good value. Would definitely recommend.

This restaurant is quite beautiful and has sides bordering both the old town square as well as the harbor. Our waitress was quite good and the food was fine. I had marinated chicken which was good but a friend had a hamburger that was a little too salty. We asked for some good Croatian wine and it was very decent.

We stopped for a drink on our first night in Dubrovnik on the Terrace of the Gradska Kavana Arsenal.

It is a very pleasant place to simply sit and watch the world walking by.

The prices were a bit steep, however that is to be expected in Dubrovnik town centre.

We took advantage of the 10% discount card that we were given when we had coffee at the restaurant at the top of the nearby cable car (which is not currently running so we walked up!). 

The waiters here are superb, friendly, knowledgable and attentive. We had the fish of the day, served with fresh vegetables cooked Mediterranean style
In olive oil. Amazing! 

There is a great choice of wines, and we sat outside during a spectacular thunder storm with torrential rain, warm under the heaters and protected from the weather by the magnificent stone arches. From here you look out onto the boats in the harbour and can see the sun changing the colour of the buildings on the coast as it sets behind you. Superb.

Highly recommended.

Me and my mother visited the restaurant in the middle of our 5 day mini break to Dubrovnik from London. We had a fantastic dinner and would recommend it to anyone. We like to eat out during our trips and felt especially taken care of by our waiter Maro (I think his full name was Maroje). He made sure we had everything we wanted, was extremely knowledgable and very on-the-ball. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and seated in the most amazing setting. The restaurant itself is huge and full or character, perfectly clean and decorated. My mum is coeliac and they were perfectly able to cater for us. We recommend ordering the truffle and mushroom linguine and the parmigiana.

We visited at the end of April as a family of five for lunch. This was in fact our second visit as having previously been in October 2017 for my husbands evening birthday meal. Not a lot had changed, food was still excellant and not too badly priced considering the location and view - we have sat on the marina side of the restaurant both times as it’s stunning to watch the boats whilst relaxing there. Service is good at lunch but I would say significantly better during the evening. Cocktails and wine are great and good value but the outstanding thing is the quality of the food. It was just delicious, perfectly cooked and by far the best meal we had on both our visits to Croatia. If we return to Dubrovnik again we will definitely be returning here.

Fabulous fresh oysters and a wonderful view. Weather could have been better but the waiting staff were perfect. Now need to come back as we have to try the correct wine with our oysters, Grk has been recommended and we will return to try it.

We had breakfast and dinner here. When having breakfast we noticed from menu they served Rozata, traditional Dubrovnik dessert. So we booked a table by the sea for the evening. Breakfast was good but dinner was great! Service was excellent. They brought small tables beside ours and cut the meat and fish there and prepared our dishes. Food was really tasty and wine the waiter suggested matched perfectly with it. And Rozata for dessert of course. Perfect dinner with great view of Old town harbour sunset.

This place takes is just amazing. Friendly and professional staff, beautiful atmosphere and surrounding and the most important, phenomenal food. We had a fish soup for a kid that came full of fish and mussels. So rich with ingredients and flavors! Wife and I took Adriatic octopus salad the greatest I ever had in my life (and I always have octopus salad when on a seaside vacation). For a main dish we had anglerfish in pancetta. Such an amazing dish! We had a local white wine from a producer in Dubrovnik as a recommendation from outlet waiter. Finally we had great deserts, again recommended by our friendly waiter. At the end, as a gift we got a glass of fig rakija for my wife and carob rakija for me. 

We left full of positive impressions and happy that we chose this place. 

We cordially recommend Gradska Kavana and we will come back again soon!

Marijo is worth a trip to this restaurant. He was AWESOME.
The food was delicious also. Beautiful view of the Old Town Port

Had a lovely meal at this restaurant, which offers tables outside facing the main square, inside or outside facing the harbour, we sat facing the harbour, and we were provided with blankets in case we got chilly. The waiter was very attentive and helpful and there was a good choice of food, all of which was excellent. We had also visited their sister restaurant Dubravka 1836 (which was also very good ) so we got 10% discount!

As the title says we loved Gradska Kavana Arsenal we visited about 4-5times during our one week visit. Staff were friendly and attentive and we just had drinks there each time. It’s great for people watching and sipping on cocktails. There are two seating locations, one is facing inside the walls and the other is facing outside. There are three restaurants connected which they have a 10% discount card (photo attached) the other two include the panorama restaurant and restaurant dubravak 1836. They generally ask you on your first visit if you have the card but if they do not just ask. Well worth it! Enjoy afternoon and or evening drinks with a view!

Few days ago me and my partner visited Gradska kavana, there we meet an older woman who was cleaner, she was very grumpy and rude to us. She had short brown hair, we did not ask for her name because we did not want to cause more stress to us.
We read great rewiews about this place and decided to visit Gradska kavana, but this was very unattractive behaviour so we left the place.

Service was so attentive and friendly, food was great, location amazing which made it all feel so special. The staff went above and beyond for one member of our family which made memories we will never forget. 
Highly recommend.

We ate here twice in the end. Views of the main street or the back of the restaurant has views of the old port. Daniel, the waiter, was excellent and really looked after us. Will certainly visit again on next visit - highly recommended!

We have been here for both breakfast and dinner. And on both occasions we had delicious food with amazing views, nice atmosphere and excellent service. Especially for our dinner our waiter Daniel was just excellent. Would recommend if you want a fine dining experience but without the price tag. As the prices were same as other restaurants but the quality of food and service were far superior.

Stopped off for a late slice of cake on our way back to our apae.

The cakes were delicious and the waiters really friendly and attentive.

I'm sure the food here would be great to. Worth a visit!

My partner and I had lunch here on our last day in Dubrovnik. We were lucky to get a table closest to the harbour. The food was gorgeous and we felt reasonably priced considering the location. Well recommended.

Really good restaurant facing the old harbour. Excellent menu, great service and perfect for watching the world go by. Sister restaurants at top of cable car and by pile gate offer discount with their card, both just as good

I loved this place and we went there twice! because food and service was so good. Once for lunch and once for dinner. We didn't even know that they had this great back terrace with seaview! So when we visited the second time, we had this great surprise. So ask them for a table there if you go :) The waiters there are high class and so nice! Even though some people say it's expensive - the prices are actually ok for Dubrovnik! And the food and service and of course the great atmosphere is really worth it. We will definetly visit this place again when we come back to Dubrovnik!

My friend and I spent our last dinner in Dubrovnik at this really nice restaurant! The view from the terrace is stunning and the food was so nice and really affordable. They make the best and most beautiful cocktails and the service was really nice. Our best recommendations!

We had such a wonderful evening here. Not the cheapest but you guessed that being 5 star. The service was nothing short of exemplary. The food was sublime. That on top of great views and some lovely wine left us determined to go back!

While visiting Dubrovnik we searched for a place in front of the sea for celebrating my 40th birthday. The only thing that made us enter this place instead of others was the presence of local people having lunch there and We never regretted it.

Since the moment we arrived the hostess Marija made us feel welcome and treated us like any guest deserve. We got a table in the terrace and the restaurant offers plaids in case you find the temperature too chilly (heaters are available but where not needed at the moment).

Our waiter, Branimir, treated us as we were part of any royal family. Observing the attention given to the tables on the surroundings it seems to be the standard of the place, so you will never regret to have a meal there.

The menu has diverse choices of typical and international options. All of high quality and presentation. Our choices are in the pictures.

Despite we did not ask for dessert, Branimir took the initiative of treating us with a piece of their delicious orange/ chocolate cake, making it even more special when he discovered it was my birthday. 

Thank you Branimir and Marija, you made my day!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Prices are acceptable and even lower that their closest neighbors in the area.

Should you visit Dubrovnik, this place is definitely a must in the list of places to eat.

We sat outside on the terrace facing the harbour, heaters and blankets provided for our first meal in Dubrovnik. The service, food & wine were all excellent, I had the Truffle & mushroom linguine followed by Confit of Pork Belly with Cauliflower puree, mini apples & cherry sauce. My husband had the Sailor's Friend Risotto followed by Beef Cheek, the waiter recommended a lovely dry white wine from Koracu.

Went here for dinner last night, had booked the terrace though was a little cold so sat just inside on a window seat, same views, just warmer! 
Service was excellent from beginning to end, staff were smiling, polite and efficient, yet relaxed at the same time. Had had agreat meal previous night elsewhere but this surpassed that. Drinks, starters, mains, everything was excellent. Couldnt fail to have a great time here.

The location is perfect, you can’t miss it. The food is excelent, possibly the best mussels in the town. I also recommend the beaf steak. The waiters are very nice and attending. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

Absolutely excellent meal. We ate on the patio the end of February when we arrived and then again in March before we left. Everything from the appetizer to the aperitif was amazing. Even loved the warm blankets provided. Will definitely visit again. 

Odd thing was the first time we went they made a point of letting us know in writing and verbally that gratuity was not included. This no longer seemed to be the case on second visit. It was a bit confusing.

We ate at the Gradska Kavana Arsenal restaurant on our first night in Dubrovnik. It was in a good location and you can choose to sit inside or out. We chose to sit outside and although a little cold and windy we were offered blankets and heaters.
The staff were very friendly and offered their recommendations on what to eat and drink.
It is part of 2 other restaurants which offer you a 10% discount card before you leave and each restaurant is great and comes highly recommended
I had the time of my life. I spent this evening with my best friend and this lovely waiter. Thank you for making us laugh so much. Great service and the food was fantastic! Love from Norway♥️

This place excels on multiple levels. The service, the cuisine and the wine were all excellent. Nemar guided us well and is well versed in local wines, cuisine and culture. The atmosphere is lovely. We ate well: Beef Cheeks Borgonion and the Seafood Risotto are both highly recommended.

This restaurant should be on your ‘must visit’ list when in Dubrovnik. The customer service is excellent & the food is absolutely delicious. We saw this restaurant on our first night in the old town but didn’t even check it out - it looked so classy we thought it would cost a fortune. So wrong! Despite its very high standards in every respect, the prices are actually very reasonable for Dubrovnik & the food & service are a cut above. It costs less to eat here than at many of the old town mediocre-good restaurants. Seriously! The waiters are very welcoming & perfectly attentive &, despite the ‘class’ of the restaurant, the atmosphere is totally relaxing. We both had fish dishes & both were exquisite. Great cocktails too! This is one of 3 ‘sister restaurants’ in Dubrovnik, including the Panorama at the top of Mount Srd. Eat at one & you’re given a discount card for all three. Excellent ambiance, great service & wonderful food. Recommended!

The restaurant is beautifully decorated, some great touches (table decorations, blankets, outdoor heaters) and a stunning view of the old port outside at the back. Yet it never felt stuffy or formal. This was also mostly to do with the staff, who served you immaculately but if you are chatty and friendly the reciprocated warmth and subsequent experience you will have will make it a meal to remember. The bourguignon was the most tender beef I've ever had, and the pork belly with cherry and apple but particularly the cauliflower puree was amazing! A must in Dubrovnik, particularly for couples.

We visited this place 3 times during our short break in Dubrovnik. 

Being in the heart of the Old Town and just off the main strip, you would think it’s one of those ‘tourist traps’, I would disagree.

Reasonably priced, and a perfect for just a couple of drinks as we did. After your first visit, you are given a 10% discount card for further visits. 

Outside seating available under a retractable canopy on a terrace over looking the street or for a dockside view under a stone roofed area.

Outdoors meal at a busy time of day was splendid. We were served by a young woman, Romona, with good English who gave excellent service. She asked what we wanted and gave helpful info about the food. She was adept at parrying my husband’s jokes but even better at quick, good service to our table and others. The many pigeons in Old Town seem to know when food is served and had to be shooed away, a small price to pay for being outside and watching the world go by on this busy, almost entirely foot-traffic street. I had monkfish with puréed red cabbage for an attractively served and delicious meal. My husband had sea bass that was so fresh and perfectly cooked, just the way it should be! The desserts we chose were far above the restaurant standards we have come to accept. They were beautiful and scrumptious and of a decent sized portion. My husband didn’t wince when he paid about $100 Canadian for the meal, wine, fine service and street views. Look for it not far from St Blaise Church.
Excellent service, great food, and fun people watching after walking the walls of Dubrovnik all afternoon. Cheese plate, pork belly, and local wine satisfied the hunger for an authentic meal.
This was a great spot for breakfast. Centrally located with a great views for people watching. The breakfast was well made and filling.

My mother and I visited Dubrovnik for a week in late February/early March 2019. We visited the Old Town on most days - if only for a little while - and I think there was only one day where we did not visit this restaurant. Sometimes we just had coffee or wine, sometimes we had cake or snacks, and one evening we had our dinner there. No matter what time of day we went or what we had, the service was excellent and the quality of the food and drinks was good. We felt very welcome and comfortable, which was not the case for some other places we tried in the Old Town. And it's a great spot for people-watching and just enjoying the views and the atmosphere. Highly recommended.

A Gorgeous location - On one side of the wall you have the best place to have delicious coffee and dessert while you watch the locals and tourists walking around in wonder at the inner beauty of the City. On the other side of the wall you have a gorgeous restaurant looking out at the Old Harbour as viewing the city walls, water, boats and entertaining people watching. Fabulous food, excellent service, lovely ambiance. I spend a lot of time in Dubrovnik each year and this is one of my favourite restaurants.
grest food great service great location best time to visit just before season starts other wise might get crowded

A great dinner with son of seafood risotto and fish stew with suggested wines plus almond and cheese cakes and suggested brandy. Ivo was a pleasant, attentive waiter who was excellent at suggestions for our palette. I’m am celiac, and Ivo and the chef endured my meal was 100% gluten-free. Definitely worth a visit!

Our guide recommended to stop here for dessert. They have several homemade cakes which one of the servers were kind enough to explain what each one was. We shared 2 desserts-each were delicious. Just be careful with the nuts as we found a couple shells. Nice location!

Look our stay in Dubrovnik has been lovely but the service has been overstretched. Gradska Kavana Arsenal restaurant has treated us like normal people. They greeted us and made us feel welcome. We had an Aperol Spritz which was well balanced. We then come back for dinner a bit later and the food was delicious and the service was to high standard.

Everything is perfect: the location, the service, the food, the attention to detail...
A great Dubrovnik experience, whether you are just having coffee or lunch/dinner/drinks...
This is where the locals go too - all year round :-)
Possibly a bit less perfect in the middle of July/August due to the sheer number of people visiting, but absolutely the best off season!

This charming restaurant, inside Dubrovnik old town serves a delicious food, at honest prices and has a perfect service! Ivo, the waiter who served was very gentle and attentious, making us to have a very good time.

Probably the best location in the middle of the old Town center in Dubrovnik.
We had the opportunity to enjoy both an amazing coffee and dessert in the afternoon and a great dinner later in the evening.
A limited list of dishes but definitely great quality.
Don't miss it, specially if you like to watch around when seated..

We just had a beautiful dinner here. Our waiter Ivan was extremely attentive and we chose his recommendations from the menu and were not disappointed. I had the fish stew which was delightful. I'm so impressed by the hospitality in Dubrovnik.
This restaurant does not disappoint, I would recommend.

Our 3rd lunch in Dubrovnik and having been at both the other 2 venues owned by the same person/group we had their loyalty card so saved 10%. We had main courses only but both (salmon & veal, side of grilled veg) were superb. Waiting staff were hugely professional. As previously noted a very limited menu. Despite this I highly recommend.

I just finished a 2 week stay in Dubrovnik and decided to cap it off with dinner at one of the best restaurants in town. I have dined here several times before and make it a point to do so when I visit because it is always a culinary pleasure. Excellent food and always superb service (if you get Marijo as your waiter you are very lucky). 
I expected my meal to be delicious but whatever magic the kitchen did, it worked! Because it was sooooo extra delicious! I had the beef steak prepared medium rare (perfectly) with a Demi glaze, carrot mousse and red cabbage with figs (what!?!). The flavors paired so well. I accompanied my meal with a glass (or so) of Dingač. A local full bodied red. 
Kudos to the kitchen for a meal prepared par excellence!

Over our 6 days in Dubrovnik we ate and drank many times (breakfast, coffee and cake, dinner) at Arsenal and it was always the same; excellent food and coffee, a pleasant environment, close attention to small details and efficient and thoughtful service. It provides excellent value despite Dubrovnik's higher prices. Highly recommended!

At the bottom end (south) of the Stradun or main street, to the right, is the outdoor (and indoor) AAA restaurant cafe Arsenal. Waiters are super polite and you can sit as long as you like, enjoying the street view of Dubrovnik's ancient capitol and the euro cafe lifestyle, not to mention awesome reasonably priced food otherwise a latte and a delish cake from the display case is de rigeur! A must.

We loved this place so much that we visited three times!

We began with lunch captured by the view from the harbour. This is a magical setting for lunch, we could have stayed all day. The food was light, beautifully presented and delicious.

We followed with dinner the following evening. The food and ambiance was just as good. With the view of the harbour it was the perfect setting.

On our last morning we chose to have breakfast facing the square. As always, it was delicious. 

Three meals, three happy memories. We cannot wait to return.

Had a very enjoyable meal under the arches looking out across the picturesque Dubrovnik old harbour. We were entertained with some live music at a reasonable volume and enjoyed our meals and the wine on offer. Certainly the best meal we had in Dubrovnik.

We are 2 families making up a group of 9 and had breakfast and then dinner on the 
same day at this restaurant. The meals were tasty with good sized portions with the breakfast meals particularly good value

We went there for dinner, the menu is small but includes some real gems: there is "Sea and Mountains", a pasta mix of frutti di mare and mushrooms, and the calamari on blitva (swiss chards and potatoes) are tops! The waiters are really nice, and we came back for breakfast which was also great!

My kids and I went there for a morning coffe.
The place is great,it's an old school place well decorated.The coffe is also great as usually at that position (in the center of town) is rare.
The service was quick and polite everything according the standard that city coffe shop should have.

I had been travelling for almost 2 week, surviving on cheap on-the-go food so when I got to Dubrovnik I decided to treat myself to a proper dinner. Needless to say, it was worth the wait to eat at Gradska! I had a table right on the water just before sunset and it was lovely to watch the boats come in. My waiter was absolutely delightful an the service was wonderful. I started off with a caprese salad which arrived with beautiful, fresh tomatoes, rocket and a generous, mouth-watering piece of burrata. I followed this with the fish special which was de-boned at my table and served with a delicious side of vegetables. The pinot noir I had was light and fruity and complemented the food very well. It was a very filling meal but I couldn't go past the baked cheesecake for dessert - with a cheeky dessert wine to finish off. My meal was so good that I had to go back for another visit before I left where I had a delicious plate of calamari. Highly recommend Gradska!

Whilst visiting the walled town of Dubrovnik we took in a very nice and leisurely three course lunch at the Arsenal restaurant. Our table was the harbour side of the restaurant that provided a comfortable dining experience. We had three courses, steamed mussels with white wine and garlic to start, a fish stew and grilled calamari on a bed of spinach and potatoes for the main course, and a slice of cake for desert. All was accompanied by a chilled bottle of Croatian white wine. All the food was of a high quality and the service provided equally matched it. Lunching at the Arsenal restaurant was certainly one of the highlights from our time in Dubrovnik.

We came here back in October, it has a lovely view of the harbour at the back of the restaurant. Good for people watching too!
Great staff and good food.

Situated on the eastern corner of the old town, this place is between the town hall and the church. It has both indoor and outdoor seating and on a good day, relaxing on the deck area would be fantastic, however we visited on a rainy day and sat indoors (also good). Value for money, although a little on the expensive side, the food was terrific and generally had something for all of our party. Small groups suit this place better as the tables are tight and quite close together. Staff were very helpful and friendly. If you like seafood, this place is certainly worth a try.

The restaurant is located at the end of the square to the right of the clock.

I had pan fried Salmon with Asparagus and beetroot. The beetroot was very much al dente and the asparagus was cold but the fish was perfectly cooked and tasted great. 

I will be visiting again during my stay.
Gradaka Kavana Arsenal located in square of Dubrovnik city, it’s delicious seafood soup you can enjoy in the city, smooth and fresh sea bass in your mouth spurred, it’s amazing!

4.5 stars. The food was really enjoyable. Loved the Dalmation prosciutto. The black ink pasta was tasty, though a bit overcooked. The sailor risotto was very pleasant, and calamari was done just right. Overall, an excellent experience, especially if you like seafood.

There are two great terraces - one at front facing Stradun and the other at the back facing the harbour.
Great views from either terrace.
Friendly service.
So many delicious food, coffee is perfect, juice is fresh and the staff are so friendly and nice. What else could i wish for? Perfect

I travel a lot and I like to try the gastronomy and restaurant offer of every country I come to. After visiting this restaurant I have to say that I felt a huge pride in the fact that in my country I can find a restaurant that is as good as all the beautiful places I've been to all over Europe. They do not miss anything, they have fantastic service, delicious, modern and nicely decorated food, fantastic interior and a famous location. I will not even think about other places when I come back to Dubrovnik. Please stay as good as you are!

We went to this restaurant twice while in Dubravnik and had wonderful food and service each time. We ordered their seafood special and it was outstanding but it was the friendliness and outstanding service by the waitstaff that really put it over the top. If you are in Dubravnik. I highly recommend dining here...the view is wonderful as well!

We visited this restaurant for lunch 3 times in the week we were there as we enjoyed it so much. The service was excellent and on the cold day we were there they were handing out blankets so we could still sit on the terrace and watch the world go buy. Food was excellent too a really lovely experience. Would definitely recommend.

We were in Dubrovnik for 5 days and visited this restaurant 3 times.... the atmosphere in each area of this restaurant was unique... although I must say waterfront with the lights of the City wall was my favorite... wine service divine and the only thing better was the linguini in creamy sauce with black truffles.... highly recommend for foodies and history buffs alike

We had an excellent meal here last week. It was for our wedding anniversary and it felt like a special occasion kind of place, but well-priced. The staff were very friendly and welcoming (although we felt slightly rushed towards the end but not much). They ensured that we were warm enough with heaters and blankets as we were sitting outside. We had great steaks (really well-cooked and tasty) and beetroot and scallop risotto.

I can’t say enough great things about this place. We were in Dubrovnik 4 nights and ate there 4 times! The food was really nice. The wine was great. And the staff were just really kind. On our last night they even gave us dessert and liquors on the house. Just lovely people. Go!

A calm and soothing place with an interesting menu. We had a sea and mountains pasta for starters which was divine! The typical fish stew was spicy but nice. The beef cheeks Bourguinon is a must!
The waiters are also friendly! 
The perfect place to relax...
Some very nice menu options, the food was a high standard and reasonably priced, the service was very nice and with a smile.

Ideally situated in the heart of the old town, not overpriced and very good quality and service. This review is for the Kavana nocni bar part of the property facing the main road in the old town. We spent time with coffee just people watching after a busy day walking the sights of Dubrovnik. Highly recommended!

Our waiter was very entertaining and did a great job! The view of the harbour from under the arches is a fantastic setting for a special lunch. The Mushroom and truffle spaghetti was divine. Other food choices were also great, the baby apples with the pork belly really made the dish pop, though the meat was a little under-seasoned for my taste. otherwise, a fantastic meal.

The restaurant overlooks the Old Port in Dubrovnik.
I had tuna tartare and then Istrian pasta, with squid ink, salmon, prawns, and wild mushrooms as a main. Both were superb.
Other meals we had were fish soup,
Burrata caprese, Mussels, and Cod fillet.
Our waiter was Stjepan, who was excellent throughout.
We had a 10% Discount Voucher because we had a drink earlier at the Panorama restaurant.
The meal was outstanding, and the prices were fair given the quality of the food and service.

Visited one evening with my wife and were seated in the middle of the terrace overlooking the old port.

The service, from Goran, was the most attentive during our visit to Dubrovnik.

We skipped the starters and my wife had calamares and I had beef cheek bourguignon, which I found a little tough.

We shared a local style creme caramel dessert which was very good.

With coffees and two glasses of wine the bill came to around 630 Kunas

Overall a nice dining experience we would recommend.
Exceptional meal at a delightfully located restaurant. The service was excellent and the staff really do care.

Staying in Dubrovnik for a few days we had our mid morning stop on the terrace next to the Rector's Palace; an ideal location in the shade. Decided to return for lunch and although not possible to book tables on the terrace we were assured they would find one and as it happened we were back at same table as earlier; interesting menu and good food; overall efficient although a side dish was forgotten and had to remind them; but the sun had come round and when we asked for more cover this was not possible but they offered instead to move us to the old harbour side where very comfortable. Overall a happy lunch with the staff very attentive and keen to please.

We visited here on our first night in Dubrovnik following a recommendation from a friend. When we arrived we were given the option of where we would like to be seated, either inside or outside, despite it being a chilly evening we opted for outside and were pleasantly surprised to find blankets on our chairs. We were given a table right on the edge of the restaurant with lovely views out to sea. The service from our waiter Ivor (apologies if we’ve spelt this wrong) was fantastic. We ordered a bottle of Prosecco as we were here celebrating our first wedding anniversary and Ivor was very attentive and kept coming round to ensure our glasses were topped up! The menu is fairly limited but there’s something for everyone. We would definitely recommend this restaurant and it was a brilliant and romantic setting for us to celebrate our anniversary. Thank you

4 friends and I visited this place for the 1st time, for dinner, and all of us were thrilled afterwards.
Fantastic view of the old harbour, professional and friendly staff and truly excellent and well served food, what else to add...We'll be coming back for sure.
And all this for a reasonable prices - thanks!

What a magic place to have lunch. Beautiful sea views. Amazing, friendly service . 
Delicious food. 
highly recommend.
My daughter and her boyfriend announced their plan to be married. Were given free liquers to celebrate.
Well priced, substantial breakfast. Amazing staff, very well trained and attentive. Wonderful views across the harbour,

The setting at night is magical. They had a live organist and violinist. The pork belly was tender and delicious. Service was impeccable. Food was reasonably priced compared with the surrounding restaurants. Highly recommended.

We chose this restaurant to announce our engagement/wedding to our families and we couldn't have picked a more perfect location. The view was stunning, the service was spectacular and the food was to die for. 

Can't recommend this restaurant enough!
Everything about this restaurant is first class. The food, the recommended wine, the setting and the staff. If only every restaurant could come up to this standard. Great meal!

An unbelievable evening. We went there on our last evening and had booked a table by the harbour side. What a great restaurant. The view from the restaurant was stunning as a starter! We took advantage of the Dubrovnik Food menu to have a sample of Croatian meat and fish- all was sensational from the steak tartare to the sea bass to the desserts. The wine choices were excellent and our waiter knew his stuff- confidently telling us to trust him and thank God we did. A genuine michelin starred experience - but great value. Can we come back please?!?!?!

We were fortunate to get a dinner reservation for our last night in Dubrovnik - I believe the hostess was Marjia. We sat on the terrace with a lovely harbor view and ordered the fresh fish. It was very good! Our server, Goran plated it at our table. He was friendly and attentive. Dessert was delicious too. Goran recommended it (wish I could remember the name), but it was dark chocolate with fig...not too sweet or heavy, just a perfect end to our meal!

Service was great. Wine recommendation was excellent. They know how to serve wine. Food was very good, no matter how small or large your plate was. Everybody was happy. The only problem I had was that my veal plate was like a shoe bottom and my broken tooth still hurts. But you cannot beat the view. Overall it was very good.

We visited the restaurant couple of weeks ago and had an amazing time. Everybody was really welcoming and they gave us awesome table on the terrace with some heaters and blankets since it was raining. The terrace is covered, but on the open which is really nice. We had truffle pasta and it was delish and squid,so juicy that it was really delightful! And drinks are really goooooooooood gotta try'em!!! We were little late in the place, so we missed desserts but will be back to taste that part! To wrap up, would highly recommend!

We were offered the set meal for the Dubrovnik Food Festival and chose the fish set meal which they were happy to alter slightly for our dietary requirements. 150k for a 3 course meal. Excellent value and large portions. Oh and the food was excellent too.
We sat on the peaceful terrace overlooking the Cathedral. They also have a larger area overlooking the harbour with great views but these tend to be noisy and bustling - so take your choice!

Myself and my fiancé came across this restaurant while walking around old town during the day, liked the look of the menu and returned for our evening meal. There was no booking required and they sat us in the back of the restaurant with amazing views of the Harbour. The staff were very attentive and we started our dinner with tuna tartar and beef carpaccio. Both dishes were delicious. For main I had the pork belly with cauliflower purée and a black cherry sauce. The portion of pork was massive but very tasty, melt in the mouth! There was a lot of purée and cauliflower (minor complaint). My fiancé had steak for main. The steak was cooked as ordered and came with a side of baked potato. The potato was filled with cream cheese, this was not to his taste but enjoyed the steak none the less. 

While the waiter collected our dishes they never returned to ask about desert. And such a time had passed before we caught the eye of another waiter we decided to leave desert.

In summery, starters were amazing, main course was good and service for desert was poor.

We ate at 3 restaurants in Dubrovnik: Domatino, Proto (fish restaurant) and Arsenal. While we enjoyed and would rank the other two restaurants highly, our favorite evening was spent at "Arsenal". The evening was a celebration of the 20th anniversary of friends and the restaurant did not disappoint. The waiter, whose name I now forget, was the best of our two week trip. He was broadly knowlegeable about the food and, in particular, the wine. He steered us to a wonderful Dingac 2013 (plavac mali grape) from 2013 that was a highlight. The entres were wonderful. I had beef cheeks in a wonderful gravy - the best meal on the trip. Others had seafood entres and enjoyed them immensely. The musical entertainment knew and quickly produced a very nice rendition of "As Time Goes By" for our friends' 20th anniversary. The location immediately adjacent to the harbor (under the arches where boats used to enter the city) was picturesque. It was just a perfect evening. The evening was pricey, but well worth it....... We would go back in a heartbeat.

I visited Dubrovnik for three nights with my new husband on our honeymoon and ate here twice for breakfast. Our first experience was superb and made us want to come back again the next day!

Let me say that this restaurant is beautiful and at first glance, doesn't look like a place where you can get a hearty breakfast for just 78 kuna!

My husband and I shared one breakfast between the two of us and ordered another drink on the side. Our breakfast came with two eggs, two sausages, a few strips of bacon, roasted tomato and mushroom, baked beans, toast, a bread basket, spreads and jams, a tiny cup of fresh orange juice, and a hot drink of our choice.

Depending how hungry you are, we felt that there was enough food to share, which made it really affordable. Plus, it was lovely to eat outside on their patio overlooking the port. 

What a great way to start the day!

My husband and I went here for dinner here last night. It was a very nice evening. 
The setting was beautiful. The service was very good. 
I had pork belly which was delicious. 
My husband enjoyed his beef cheeks. 
We also enjoyed a good bottle of red wine.

We went to this restaurant in the harbor on our first day in the city and could not get a seat. We booked for our last night in Dubrovnik in 5 days time. Truly we debated whether to go or not when the time came, as Dubrovnik is the most expensive city in Croatia and I think we were a little tired of eating out. 
So glad we went it was the best restaurant food we had in 2 weeks in Croatia. Lovely food great setting we had a water view table, the service was good. Would recommend.

I have been meaning to write this review for some months. Me and my boyfriend had the most amazing birthday meal here back in May. They welcomed us and wished my boyfriend happy birthday straight away. We was sat outside looking over the harbour which was an amazing view. The food was lovely and they even had someone singing/performing (They performed a mini happy birthday which was great). It really was the perfect meal, thank you!
Beautiful location and great service. The food is great, if you want to spend time in a pleasant setting I certainly recommend.

This restaurant is part of the nautical group offering fine dining, its perfect position on the old town port entices people in with its lovely views, I decided to celebrate my 60th birthday here.
On arrival It started off badly, ordering a bottle of house red(plavac Mali) and white (posip kunjas, both at 220 ku) the red turned up the waiter had set 6 red wine glasses, I mentioned that the ladies were going for the white, that had not been brought to the table, he acknowledged this(mistakes happen with languages) a long wait ensued, eventually getting attention of said waiter I again asked about the white wine another longish wait eventually see the wine appear, and in fairness after this he was attentive.
We ordered food and it was all good, very tasty, we were then offered a drink on the house To celebrate my birthday, a nice touch, it came with a free cake nicely presented on a plate.
I asked to pay the bill,on receipt of bill I glanced over it and noticed the free drinks had been added to it, my family told me to question this as it was £35 extra on drinks we didn’t order, they agreed that a mistake had been made and rectified the error, but as many have said these sort of thing should not happen in this type of establishment.
Food 4/5 service 3/5 ambience 4/5 value 4/5

I have never been compelled to write a bad review or any reviews at all in general but I felt that my experience today had to be made known to the public or the management.

The service was lukewarm at best and at times, mediocre. When we arrived, there were a few servers around, but nobody came forward to ask if we wanted to sit or anything. Why else would we even go into the restaurant if we didn’t wanna eat there? When approached the servers, they scattered like ants. I didn’t stink, in fact, I just had a bath and wore an awesome fragrance. I didn’t look like a slob either, I had proper and in fact, some would say, very fashionable clothing on. But I’m Asian, I don’t know if that mattered, perhaps they were sick of having noisy Chinese tourists around. 

We were greeted by an annoyed looking female server in a tight bun (go figure) and our tables were not set properly after that. We had to ask for a plate because we were missing one. Come on... really?

Food was pretty good. We had the mussels, pork belly, cod fish and risotto. They were all fine. 

The four of us agreed that the service was a great letdown. We’ve been in Croatia for two weeks and have eaten at restaurants almost everyday. We’ve never felt more unwelcome in a restaurant. Service elsewhere has been good, if not, impeccable. 

We also got the Dubrovnik card and there was supposedly a 10% discount which they honoured anyway, but told us that their boss made an exception and the 10% doesn’t apply. It was strange because it was indicated online, perhaps the terms have changed. 

Towards the end, the young man who was serving us did thank us a couple of times and gave us a 10% discount card for the other restaurants under the same management but we will not return and I will not recommend this to my friends and family (not that they need my recommendation anyway because the restaurant is so large and prominent, the ranking is so high on TripAdvisor too).

I really wanted to like it, and I felt bad that my face soured towards the end of the meal but I was just so annoyed. But I did say my “please” and “thank you” so I was still civil. I mean, I kind of have a Resting B Face so perhaps they thought I was being unfriendly.
We thought that because of the location this would be expensive, but it really wasn't. The staff were delightful, the food delicious and the view amazing.

On the recommendation of a friend who had visited Dubrovnik earlier in the year we came here for dinner on our first night in town. The staff were all exceptionally welcoming, helpful and friendly, and we were told that a couple of other people were already waiting for tables so we knew what sort of wait to expect.

The dining terrace is in a fabulous prime position overlooking the old port, and manages to strike a good balance between elegance and atmosphere with a keyboard pianist playing in one corner. 

We both opted for the fish stew, which I thought was excellent although the creamy polenta that came with it seemed an odd accompaniment. My chocolate mousse cake dessert was delightful.

Definitely worth a visit if you're after a dining experience that offers some sense of occasion.

We had a late lunch in this restaurant and it was a good choice. The food was excellent, the location is also percect. The waiters were very polite so we recomend it to everyone who want to have a delicious food.

This is a must do dinner location for Dubrovnik as it looks over the old port (book early if you want a seat overlooking the port). The food was great and the service 1st class. We were celebrating (Ruby Wedding) so eat well with a local bottle of wine and it cost us £90 so not stupidly expensive given the location at all.

Went here as a first stop after getting from the airport to sit down and have a meal and it was great. I had soup of the day which involved a genetous amount of seafood and then the grilled calamari for main which was prepared just right and served with a perfect accompniment of garlicy buttery greens.

Our host from the Airbnb calls this the restaurant with the best breakfast in town. he was not wrong. The service was quick and efficient. We had a continental breakfast which filled me. The food was well presented and fresh. We sat outisde looking out over the Adriatic sea and the Dubrovink Town Walls. We had breakfast here two days in a row. The price is also reasonable. The menu was in at least 5 languages

We came here for breakfast on our last day and it was marvellous.

Overlooking the harbour, in the sunshine, with a menu which offers good food and great value for money. 

My boyfriend had the Arsenal Breakfast, and I had the vegetarian breakfast (which I made vegan by giving my boyfriend the mozarella) which includes delicious grilled vegetables , fruit salad, hot drink, orange juice and a bread basket with jams/spreads. 

The service was great and we used our 10% off voucher which was given to us by one of the three partner restaurants in Dubrovnik (just ask, and they will give you one).

Highly recommend this place!

My husband and I ate here for our 28th wedding anniversary in September. We started with the sparkling red risotto with scallops. While the risotto was inventive in utilizing beetroot and was very good, the scallops were gritty and hadn't been cleaned properly. For our main course, my DH had the fish stew and I ordered the fish of the day which was sea bass. I was disappointed to be served 2 thin tail portions instead of a thicker filet. We were comped dessert, but it was too little, too late.

P.S. We also experienced intermittent whiffs of sewer smell during our dinner. Not pleasant.

We went to this restaurant on our first night and it was the perfect way to start our stay in Dubrovnik. 

The views were amazing, the live band was fantastic, the food was delicious and Valentino who was serving us, was very friendly!

My wife and I had some croissants and coffee for breakfast overlooking the old town and then went for a walk down to the harbour. We had a nice lunch overlooking the sea and realised we had eaten in the same restaurant without realising it !! Perfect location to watch all the activity with boats going to cavtat etc service excellent and food above average.
The location looking out over the harbour Is perfect and the service was good. We had breakfast which was very great - would highly recommend.

We went to this restaurant on our last night in Dubrovnik, I wish we had gone before, it was the best meal we had in our 7 night visit. We had an octopus starter presented in a lovely silver flowerpot shaped container, with a black caviar sprinkled on top and a single peashoot to look like a small seedling. Our main course was sea bass, cooked to perfection with a crispy skin and juliennes of carrot courgettes and in a buttery lemon sauce. Again lovely presentation. Our waiter Ivan ( my husbands namesake) was attentive but not intrusive. We had a complimentary drink of champagne, vodka and sorbet, delicious. We paid less than two other "fine dining" establishments we had tried.
For us this was a lovely end to our holiday in Dubrovnik and would thoroughly recommend you give it a try. We sat outside overlooking the port and twinkling lights of the houses on the hill with outdoor heaters and blankets if needed. Bliss.

It was ok. I had the mussels which were really small. Plus some were even closed. For that alone, I'd give this restaurant a poor rating. But my wife's pasta was great so I decided to give this place an average rating. Location was great, too. But yeah, don't get the mussels if they're gonna serve really small mussels.

Dubrovnik is a busy town overun with captive tourists - normally the perfect spot for poor expensive food served badly. 

This place is perfect. We had a beautiful ham starter and the baked fish with vegetables. Really nice wine and not expensive.

Best part was the service. Friendly and efficient. Fully recommended stop for lunch. And the building and view is beautiful

We had a superb meal on the terrace looking into the old town 
We both had the sea bass which beautifully cooked. The wine chosen for us by the waiter was great
The local liqueur was also great. I think the waiter was called Adia. There are lots of restaurants to choose from in Dubrovnik but I am really pleased that we went to this one.
This is absolutely the best location to have a coffee, drink or meal in the beautiful old town of Dubrovnik. Add to that good food and super service and you can’t ask for more !

The food was REALLY good! And the restaurant has a very nice environment, good view and friendly staff. Highly recommend this place. The calamari were great as well as the tuna tartare as a starter. Also very good for drinks.

We went here on the first night of our honeymoon and it did not disappoint. The location is gorgeous and the food was fantastic. I had the fish which was expertly filleted at the table. Would recommend to anyone.
Best view in the house...old town..port...water...great service and superb wine recommendation......the best local red wine..see 1st pic!

The food and service here was outstanding. We arrived after sunset on a pleasant evening and wanted to dine outside on the piazza. No tables were available, but a kindly "greeter" offered us a side table to order a drink and seat us once a dining table became available. Our server was professional, efficient and friendly. Absolutely top-notch service. We ordered wine and 3 dishes and dessert to share and all were beautifully plated, perfectly prepared, and served in a timely, professional manner. The lighted ancient buildings all around, and music being played on the square made for a magical, memorable last night in Dubrovnik.

Located at the end of Stradun, close to the old Port. 
Great place to sit outside and enjoy the people walking by. 
Stopped here for breakfast, which was great.

My boyfriend and me wanted a luxurious night out and ended up in this restaurant where the romance seams through the air. We were treated so well by our waitor Mario. We felt like royalty. The food was so delicious, there was live piano music and well, there is nothing we would change about our wonderful night out in this restaurant.
For a three course meal (and some oysters) we paid about 130€. Not cheap but sometimes you just need to spoil yourself a little! It was lovely!
Best restaurant since being in Croatia. Staff were brilliant (Marijo especially). Food was fab. Great view of the old port and felt relaxed even though you are in the heart of the city.
I got a house specialty of rose liquor, gin, and tonic. Absolutely delicious. Also had vegetarian flatbread that was tasty and filling.
Amazing location - and you can sit on the ocean or city side. Excellent breakfast at an amazing price including an omelet, breads, OJ and excellent coffee.
Amazing food. Amazing view. Amazing service. Marijo advised on what to select and the meal was beautiful to look at and delucious. Plenty of it too. Strongly advise a visit.

We had a table on the terrace with a great view but weren’t right next to a patio heater so they straight away brought blankets for us all. Musicians playing helped a great atmosphere. We had baked sea bass that was filleted by the waiter and was really delicious, and some good wine, the best meal we had in Dubrovnik and very reasonably priced.
This restaurant has beautiful view of the harbour. The food was delicious and the staff were very friendly. Very reasonably priced given its location.

My wife and I and friends had a fine meal there. Great run to watch the boats come and go in the little harbor. Excellent food, attentive service. They're fine with splitting entrees, something my wife and I do a lot of these days.

We were looking for Seafood and a lite meal at around 4.30pm. After looking into the two other Quayside Restaurants, we decided on this one. 

We ordered three starters between us Tuna Carpaccio, Octopus Salad and Red Risotto with Scallops plus a bottle of our favourite Edivo Dingac. The Waiter was very professional with the wine which was decanted and served at room temperature. The food was delicious and just what we had wanted. 

We saw someone being served for two Chateaubriand which looked fabulous. Another table had Sea Bream which was filleted at table side. They even brought out a huge whole fresh fish - perhaps Grouper to show a large table who turned it down but I’d have gladly eaten it. 

We seriously considered returning last night for dinner but went for Gatsby instead as wanted steak. No regrets but will return another time. 

Highly recommended.

The restaurant is beautiful and the view of the port is nice. We had a very good local fish stew and fish. Both dishes were very good. Price in accordance with the place, the food and the service. very good value
A fantastic restaurant with a framing view across the old port. Great service, lovely food and excellent ambience. Groups, couples and families will not be disappointed.

On our return from Carvat on the ferry we decided to have a drink and a cake.Right in front was the restaurant Arsenal a really smart looking place in a very good position looking out over the harbour.The service was first class all the staff well dressed and a credit to the restaurant.The menu was quite extensive and all the meals we saw looked very good.We moved through the building and came out on the old town side were you could also sit and people watch the best of both worlds.

My whole experience here was extraordinary. My family and I visited here, for dinner, for my birthday. The view from the terrace is breath-taking, an absolute must. They provide blankets and heat lamps outside if it becomes chilly which is a nice touch. 
The food was fantastic, everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal and had no complaints. Absolutely delicious.
The staff were exceptional, Marija was fantastic, so attentive and friendly. I could not have asked for a better experience. 
The place is very romantic, great for special occasions.

We went to Dubrovnik for our anniversary in August, and visited this restaurant on 4 occasions. Excellent location, with amazing views of the harbour. Food is amazing, and you will be spoilt for choice. On our third visit, there were a few service issues. To be fair to the restaurant, I put an adverse review on Trip Advisor. They responded very quickly and invited us back on the last evening of our break - and to make amends offered us a complementary dinner for 2. We took them up on their offer, and had a truly amazing evening. Great food, superb service, and amazing cocktails!! So I highly recommend that you visit if you are in Dubrovnik!! You will enjoy.
Very good location, superb staff, great choice of local vines. Great view both sea and old town. Moderate prices.
Great location just at the side of the harbour in the old town. Food was good quality and reasonably priced. Make sure you book in advance to get the best tables right on the waterside.

Had 4 breakfast’s here and 1 evening meal. Beautiful location overlooking the harbour. Staff are all so friendly and extremely attentive to my 11 month old granddaughter making us feel so welcome there. Breakfast was so good and reasonably priced. The evening meal delicious too. Definitely recommend eating here.

We walked past this and because of the location. I thought that the food wouldnt be good. It's at the end of the main old city street through and archway and then on the port.

We had chicken ceased salad, octopus salad and French fries. The octopus salad had cod's roe, tomatoes, onions and capers. French fries were freshly cooked. Bill was average for Dubrovnik and good value for location. Nice white tablecloths and so felt specual

This restaurant is fab, we stopped here for a drink on our first night in Dubrovnik, and then ended up staying for dinner, the pork and chicken were some of the best I’ve eaten. We went back again the next day. Great value too, similar prices to other restaurants nearby.

Our farewell dinner for a religious pilgrimage to Croatia was celebrated in this establishment. This restaurant is all about location, ambience, great service and great food. Almost all the tables look upon the harbor which is magnificent combined with the alive streets and the walled city illuminated at night. Our group was treated to fine cuisine, wine and dessert served hot, elegantly and professionally. I would love to dine with just my wife in this very romantic setting. I can't comment of the price points, difficulty getting a reservation or other logistics since our tour had everything set up in advance. If you are visiting the walled city, do stop and take advantage of what this restaurant has to offer.

This is a large restaurant in a fantastic setting, there is an open frontage so great views whether you are sitting inside or outside. There is also live music to enjoy and the service was very helpful and professional. Had salmon which was very good and a lovely traditional almond dessert. We would dine here again.

We had an early dinner so they were able to seat us directly on the Old Port side. Had the salmon and chicken - both were really good - as was the wine. As others have mentioned the service was very good - we had the pleasure of Zvonimir and he really was great. We will definitely return before we leave and hope for a similarly positive experience.

Definitely the best meal we had in Dubrovnik. I had the cod fillet with pea purée and my husband had The Calamari. Both were excellent. Service was very friendly and efficient and the view from our table on the terrace over the harbour was beautiful. Highly recommended!

A great customer experience. The food was wonderful, the view was spectacular, and the service was amazing. Everything was tasty. I saw the manager debone the fish with little effort. I will definitely be back.

We had breakfast here twice and it was Fab, food was amazing and service was excellent, would highly Recommended this place and we were sorry we didn’t have dinner here, it’s a beautiful setting both the front and back .

The restaurant was the spot where wall galleys used to be store, thus the name arsenal. It opens up to the harbor under curve openings with a great view of the harbor at one end and the other end facing the main street of town, coffee and light drinks at that end. The vista from anywhere of the restaurant is pleasant and the food is very very good. Compare with the fine dinning spots in Dubrovnik this place can hold its own but at a lower price. The most amazing part is the staff, they are energetic and friendly and will help you find a table at any time of day. We dined and drank here several times during our stay at various hours and were never disappointed. No reservation needed and they will accommodate.

Good service during peak times and a nice location looking on to the old harbour. Plenty of vegetarian options on the menu. We had an open vegetarian sandwich for lunch which consisted of fresh grilled vegetables but was let down by too much cheese! Which overpower the nicely cooked sandwich.

We visited twice on last Sunday. On the first visit, we had coffee and bread in the morning while seating on street side terrace at the core of old city. We went there again for lunch. We took seat on sea side terrace. It has great hover and castle view. Grilled fish and squid was excellent(the best during Croatia tour) even though it is a little more expensive than outside restaurant. Above all, waiter was very kind. Surely I will visit again this restaurant. 
아침에 성벽 안 테라스에 앉아서 커피 마시면서 쉬기 좋습니다. 항구 쪽 테라스에서 먹은 점심은 맛은 물론 전망도 너무 좋았습니다. 우리는 전식으로 연어 샐러드, 메인으로 오징어랑 도미 먹었습니다. 웨이터가 친절하게 생선도 반으로 나눠주고 맛있는 빵도 더 갖다 주고..(배불러서 다 먹지 못함) 후식으로 에스프레소 두잔까지 해서 가격은 약 470쿠나 나왔던것 같습니다.

Octupus salad was huge success, grilled calamari and mussels were also delicious . Sweet local dessert wine, i think Istria, and kir royal were refreshing and my daughter’s virgin mojito was also different! The music and settling was great and waiter Ivan was attentive! I would like to return and have a drink at the street terrace area as thats v elegant!

This is a restaurant of two sides. The side facing the sea is lovely for day time and the town facing side is beautiful in the evening. The staff are lovely and its great value for money considering their setting

Being serious foodies we are always looking for the better palaces to eat. But Arsenal is not a better place to eat it is the best to dine. Of course food quality, presentation and service are important but Arsenal goes beyond that. Add to the stunning view from the port side of a very extensive eatery a genuine care for you, the customer, all staff just want to please. Very professional service.

Back to the food. We have dined the equivalent of Michelin Star in Australia and the food quality here is on par. My wife said the calamari was the best meal she has ever had. And she had it two nights in a row. Presention is excellent and quantity will satisfy the big eaters. Great wine and beer selection with plenty of other beverages. In six days in Dubrovnik old city we ate here five times. On the last night they treated us like kings.

You MUST dine here, not to is a culinary sin!

This is somewhere where you can choose to look over the port, or if you love people watching.....the town square.
We chose the square, great service and nice food this combined to make a really nice, leisurely lunchtime.

Arrived late on a Saturday and we hadn’t booked. They couldn’t be more helpful and we had a beautiful table close to the front quickly prepared. The mussels were amazing to start, just little in size rather than meaty. The truffle pasta for main was the best I’ve had with a beautiful creamy sauce. I even ordered the wrong side, entirely my fault and they missed it off the bill. A pointer is though that they won’t take tip on card which is a shame because they deserved it!

Have eaten here twice.
Once harbourside and once at the front.
Evening meal and lunchtime both fantastic meals.
Such a relaxed atmosphere and brilliant service.Food was great.we had fish on both occasions and both dishes could not be faulted.
The whole dining experience was memorable.
Would highly recommend this restaurant.

From the moment we came across the restaurant we know this was a special place.We firstly visited for tea and cake on the Saturday afternoon, the setting the service we received and the food was first class, so much so we returned later in the evening for dinner. Again we had superb service ( from the same waiter as earlier in the day ) help with choosing local wines and delicious food The whole experience was the perfect end to our vacation a very special experience.

Amazing restaurant right in the Old Town overlooking the harbour. We went for a late dinner and staff/servers were great. Food was delicious. We had the Risotto to start and then beef and veal mains. All was great. Cocktails and wine were good. There were musicians playing trumpet and piano which made the atmosphere terrific.Pricey, but worth it. Would recommend.

Super service, warm friendly and a lovely spot in the Old Town. 

Breakfast is excellent and lunch out the back of the restaurant looking at the port!

Absolutely total amazing. 
The staf was excellent even though there were some allergies to consider.
Excellent service. Totally amazing food. Go here.

We visited on our honeymoon and were given a table overlooking the marina. Our waiter Ivan was very friendly and efficient. The salmon fillet and the sea bass fillet were fresh and tasty and beautifully presented. The chocolate dessert was excellent. All washed down with a bottle of gorgeous Croatian Zinfandel. All this for a very reasonable price. Add in the lovely ambience of the restaurant and all this made this a special dinner for us. Thank you!

I ate here on my first evening in Dubrovnik. Travelling on my own and was made to feel very welcome. The tables overlooking the port get booked up, so make a reservation if you want one of these. I still got a table with a good view. 
Complimentary bread and oils was followed by baked fish with potatoes, tomatoes etc. I had one glass of wine and a water. Bill came to about 270 kuna, which seems to be the cost of stuff in old town Dubrovnik. Really enjoyed my visit, didn't feel rushed and it was a lovely start to my break. Nice loos too!

We were here to mornings and one afternoon to eat. It is located right in the middle of old town tourist central, but big enough to "escape" it. We had a nice breakfast before 10 am, on one side of the restaurant (with a town square view) and dinner on the other side (with an ocean view) that opens after 10 am.
