Breakfast was eggs, beans, bacon, sausages, mushrooms, tomatoes, bread with marmalade and honey, juice and all kinds of coffee. I also tried the vegetarian breakfast with grilled vegetables. 
Dinner was a nice boef bourginion and a nicely served fish with grilled vegetables for my husband. Everything is nice and clean, white tablecloths and staff in black and white. Not very expensive. 500 kuna for the excellent dinner with wine and beer. Dubrovnik can be more expensive than that.

We were trying to look for a place to have breakfast that did not cost a ton of money and we found this place! It’s right on the water, incredible service and very delicious food. Our breakfast had eggs, bacon, sausages, tomatoes, breads with jams and honey, beans, mushrooms, fresh orange juice and a hot drink of your choice for 78KN (~$16.50 CAD). We ate there 3 times because of the location, price and amazing service. The location was an Arsenal where they built boats which was a very cool thing to learn!

I choose this restaurant as it was recommended by my hotel in the old town 
The restaurant fronts onto the main square of the old town, but also the port at the rear 
I choose the Arsenal Breakfast which for 70 kuna (£8.75) is not bad. The only disappointing thing on the breakfast was the bacon, too thin and too fatty 
But it include a basket of bread and croissants butter jam honey fresh orange juice eggs bacon sausage beans mushrooms and a cappuccino not bad for £8.75
The other breakfast items were also good value but the lunch and dinner menus were a bit pricey
We ate here a couple of times at night overlooking the quaint port in the old town. The food is good, the service is better and the overall ambiance is magical if you sit near the waters edge.

Had seen the resturarant whilst walking round the old town earlier in the day and decided to have dinner in it that night. It had splendid views of the port and the service was spot on. We had starters which were lovely and then decided to have fish for two for the main course. The waiter filleted the fish in front of us which was interesting to see and all part of the experience. The fish was delicious. The meal for 2 courses, drinks etc came to around the £80 mark which we thought was good value for the meal we had and the location of the restaurant. Would recommend.

We had coffee and cake here one morning and were delighted with the location (overlooking the old port) and the food and service. We asked if we could book a table for Friday night but were told the restaurant was fully booked but that we could have a table at the front by the waters edge on Thursday evening. We had arranged to do a trip to Montenegro on Thursday but decided to amend this booking so that we could have dinner at the restaurant. On Thursday we arrived at the restaurant to find that our table wasn’t at the front by the water and were very disappointed. We explained to the maitre ‘d that we had been promised a table at the front and he immediately gave us a table and apologised. We had a beautiful meal with great service and then our waiter told us that as there had been a misunderstanding over our table - dessert would be on the house! As we were leaving the maitre’d came and shook our hands. We were very impressed and have no hesitation in recommending this restaurant!

Personally I could care less about service if you serve great food, which thankfully this restaurant did. My sea bass was amazing, my friends salmon was delicious. The waiter assigned to our table wanted to be elsewhere, no water and we had to ask for drinks and then followed up when they didn’t show up. other than that would highly recommend for great food, perfect view and ambience. Lucky for me I had great company so Roberto didn’t spoil our night.

This restaurant offers an excellent value for a sit down breakfast. For 78kuna you get a full breakfast with orange juice and coffee, a basket of pasties, fried eggs, bacon, sausage, beans and a bit of greens. This is a much better value than 110kuna at most rival restaurants. Additionally, the location just off Stradun, on Luza Square (main square of the Old City), across from St. Blaise Church, is convenient and scenic. You are steps away from the old harbor for a water taxi to Sveti Jakov Beach or from the Ploce Gate and a short walk to Banje Beach. Come early, enjoy breakfast and a nice beach day. Unfortunately, the restaurant doesn't open the interior seating area, the one with the view of the harbor until after 10:00.

A superb setting with excellent service. When we arrived all seats were full but we were well looked after and given a table as soon as possible. The menu was good and covered all tastes. Dessert was not a strength. We had a great final evening to our trip.

There's a drinks area overlooking the main street and a terrace in the back overlooking the jetty. Great for people watchinf and food. Excellent fish stew Nd beef confit. Beetreet risotta was nice too
Gradcka cafana has long history,coffee taste much better with amazing surroundings,polite service and very clean.

This place is beautiful! The scenery is stunning & perfect for a romantic evening. The waiter Ivan was absolutely lovely & friendly. Service was brilliant. The sea bass was super tasty, must visit if in Dubrovnik!!!
The setting is very nice with a great view of the harbor. Food is also very good and reasonable. Service is excellent.

We went for lunch, luckily we got a table as we hadn’t booked!
The food was delicious and the view of the old town port is so pretty, would definitely recommend

Nice place to have dinner with great views while listening to live jazz music. We ordered fish “al forno” with vegetables and pea and leek risotto. Amazing flavour both of them.
Our waiter, named Goran, was really polite and so nice.
The service was quite quick.
Although the fish’s price was high it was worth it (25€). 
For desert we ordered a chocolate and figs cake and the waiter gave us fig liquor to go with the cake.

This became our favourite place for coffee as they did very good decaf for me and normal for hubby, One day we tried the chocolate fig cake which was yummy. We sat at the opposite end to the harbour side, which was very good for people watching. Service was excellent.

This place has a terrace on the port of Dubrovnik with amazing views. We initially were going in for just coffee but after seeing the breakfasts we each ordered an Arsenal breakfast. With this we got freshly squeezed orange, a latte/cappuccino and breakfasts. On the side we got a basket of rolls and croisants with lots of jam, Nutella and butter. The portions were fantastic and the food was amazing. Can’t fault this place atall, lovely restaurant for breakfast!
We loved the truffle linguine so much we went back twice. Fabulous location, service was fantastic and the food amazing. Not overpriced for the quality.

Romantic location looking out to the harbor, huge restaurant but very good service. The starters are large so beware if you are not too hungry. I had the pea and leek risotto to start which was very tasty but could have been a full sized portion it was that large. For main I had the beef bouginoun which was nice and my partner the steak which he said was delicious.

Octopus salad, mussels Dalmation style, sea and mountain pasta all faultless and delicious. Beautiful setting. We went at 3.30pm so it was very quiet and got a great table one row back from marina. Busier times will definitely need reserving for tables with a sea view. There are also tables on the old town side as well as an impressive interior. Service was quick, efficient and friendly but not intrusive. Good value given the location. Local white wine cheaper and better than a specialist wine bar close by. I had a sauvignon blend. There are 2 other associated restaurants in equally impressive locations which if we were here longer we would try on the strength of this one.

Visited here 3 times over the course of the holiday. Food is impeccable and mimosas top notch. The decor is classy and clean but still relaxing so during the day you don’t feel underdressed in shorts and a tshirt. Each time we visited the staff where polite and attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them. Definitely recommend they deserve above and beyond the 5 stars given.

Firstly - all restaurants and cafés in Dubrovnik are overpriced. This one delivers. Superb food; wonderful service; beautiful live ambient music; and great views. Make a booking for a table overlooking the water. If you are a couple, the premium tables are designed for you. Nice selection of seafood dishes and meat dishes. We only ate the fish dishes: seafood stew, cod dish and salmon. Superb. There’s a magnificent entrée of Tuna Tartare and a ceviche of white fish and salmon. Our waiters all spoke excellent English and were very attentive. The restaurant is very well run. It is a huge restaurant that has dining on a terrace on the Old City side also. It’s good value for fair prices.

We had dinner at the Arsenal, overlooking the old port of Dubrovnik. We loved everything, from the service to the atmosphere and food. It was our best meal in Croatia, in a 20 days long trip. Very good quality/price ratio.

My wife and I walked into this restaurant for dinner without reservations. Unfortunately we were not able to get a table closest to the water but it was close enough to enjoy. I actually enjoyed our table as we have a nice view of the water and the ancient arches of the wall. 

The setting if the restaurant was just as amazing as the food. We had the mussels as a starter (huge huge portion biggest we had in all of Croatia). My wife had the seafood risotto and I had the sea bass filet. All of the seafood is so fresh as one can imagine in Croatia. The mussels are a must, my wife and I couldn’t stop eating them, the sauce perfect for dipping with bread.

The staff was very friendly and attentive. Prices were not any different that most restaurants in the area. The restaurant is huge and I do not know if reservations would be necessary unless you want to secure a table close to the water.

Just finished a meal here 2 hours ago, never use TripAdvisor to write reviews I just read them. Have to say this restaurant was outstanding. Didn’t make a reservation so we showed up and asked to wait at the bar, the girl that greeted us was lovely, we asked if we could wait for a seat with a view and she sat us in the bar until one popped up. 10 mins later we were seated with a fabulous view of the dock. Ordered starters for the two of us, pea and leek risotto and mushroom linguine. Both amazing. I couldn’t finish the linguine so they gave us a free round and didn’t charge us for the linguine! I told them over and over again that there was no problem with the linguine I was saving myself for the beef cheek bourguignon main but they insisted that they didn’t charge us and that we had the free drink. The service was amazing, so friendly. Definitely recommend, as I said, I never write reviews but this one was worth a mention.

We’re on our honeymoon. Our flight was delayed, our luggage didn’t come with us and I’ve been wearing the same clothes for 3 days. I’m a bit upset.

This evening the luggage finally arrived and we dressed up and dined at Gradska Kavana Arsenal - It was a magic spell that fixed everything.

Glorious location, with two vistas over the old town and old port. Gentle laid back Jazz set the mood for a wonderful meal: half a dozen fresh oysters, marinated courgette, slightly pickled in citrus oil and scattered with pink peppercorns, followed by perfectly cooked and presented cod fillet and fresh squid. 

Food was cooked excellently, fresh and moist, balanced in flavour and texture and presentation. Our waiter Ivan explained the wines and the choice was spot on.

We thanked Ivan for rescuing our honeymoon and he flitted off returning with a delicious cake, of chocolate ganache and fig, traditional Croatian, and two handsome glasses of champagne.

Let me tell you that, aside from the delicious meal in a magical location, the simple kindness of Ivan fixed what had been a sad start to our honeymoon. Élégance attention and care went all the way in transforming the very nice into the very special.

This is a gorgeous place and we recommend it highly.

Delicious “Strada” breakfast, with tea, juice, croissants, fried eggs, tomatoes, and cheese. Wonderful people watching around the corner from the Stradum (Main Street). Watch as tour group after tour group stroll by in the morning.

We saw this place on arrival and thought it looked amazing with the views and live music. After further wandering into the city and looking at prices and trip advisor, we realised it was also reasonably priced for the location and compared to other restaurants there. We were given a card when we walked by which also gave us 10% off our bill, so after looking at other places to eat, we went back for dinner there.
We hadn't booked and it was busy but we we had a drink in the bar and then there was a table on the terrace with the views ready for us.
We had the mussels to start--delicious and I had squid which was also good; very fresh and cooked to perfection.
The staff were attentive until it came to wanting more drinks after our meal, then they were quite elusive and the drinks took a long time to arrive, but we can't grumble too much. The cocktails are also good.
All in all, we are glad we ate there. A lovely evening in Dubrovnik! Would recommend.

We ate there on our last night. We didn’t have a reservation and terrace was full so we had to eat inside. We didn’t mind as it was nice and cool and we were still able enjoy to view as the terrace was open. Food was yum and we got a free dessert each as the service was a tiny bit slow. Our waiter was very nice and tried his best but it was a busy night in the restaurant. Overall I’d recommend it :)

First the location is incredibly grand with a stunning harbour side view set back within stone arches. Waiter was polite and very busy but our starters came before our drinks. The food was good but aside from the octopus salad (see the plant pot in the pictures) none of it was on a par with the setting. Don’t get me wrong it was lovely and not as expensive as it’s surroundings would suggest but it didn’t stand out in any way. The mussels were surprisingly small in their shell, the squid was fine but maybe a little bland, I had a better squid dish in Perast, Montenegro for less money. The pork belly was nice the cauliflower purée worked well with the cherry sauce and fried apples but the pork was chewy and not brilliantly cooked. For me the octopus salad I had for starters was brilliant well thought out incredibly well presented to the point it made me smile if only the other dishes were at the same level! But the flip side is the price was reasonable for the area.

I do not generally give a restaurant 5 stars as it means I can not differentiate when I go somewhere outstanding. I would give this restaurant more than 4 so have decided to give it 5 stars as it gets it all just right. Great service, great food, perfect location with stunning views. We arrived at 7.00PM so were also able to enjoy the evening setting in It faces away from the sunset). The cost was reasonable at around for Dubrovnik at 900 Kuna for 5 people. We had mains only and a glass of wine each. It is definitely the best value for money restaurant so far and made for a really lovely evening. This is my top pick for Dubrovnik.

Where to begin food was exceptional and waiters/waitresses are well informed about the source and preparation of the food. Try to get the ideal location at the front row close to the sea and entrance, where you can enjoy the sea view and the piano.

We've been going to the Gradska Kavana for the past 3 years, about twice a year. We've always been happy with the food, esp. their market fish, wine selection and the way we were welcomed and offered a seat under the large arches, the best view.

Last week on the 23rd Aug, we wanted to reserve a table near the arches, as we usually do. A waitress (named Mirna) told us -to our surprise- it wasn't possible to reserve a specific table. As we told her we've done so many times before, she got very upset, told us we were rude to insist and used inappropriate wording.
Consequence: this restaurant is now on our black list, and we've urged all our contacts in Dubrovnik to avoid this place.
I'd suggest the management to have a word with this waitress.

A very nice, leasurely breakfast complete with a hot beverage, orange juice, croissants, and rolls plus an omelet. Fantastic people watching and you may get to hear Khruangbin's music in the background!

We had the best dinner in this place on our week holiday to Croatia so far. Everything: the service, the atmosphere, the food was top. Kids loved mussels and calamari while we enjoyed pea and leek risotto followed by their special dish of baked fish with vegetables. There was a live music playing on the background and the views of the old harbour were truly magical.
I loved the breakfast there.. the view and the breathe. The menu items are very good and very tasty.. I definitely recommend this place for breakfast
This restaurant is in probably one of the best locations in the world. The service is first class and the food is a cullinary treat. Atmosphere and excellence in one location. Superb!

Beautiful restaurant with stunning views. The staff are attentive, food is fresh and served hot. The menu isn’t extensive but it doesn’t need to be. Make sure you ask to sit on the back terrace so you can watch the boats coming and going!

Shame such a nice locationed place to be run by unexperienced twenty year olds not managing to welcome customers from from the beginning. We had to wait for thirty minutes before we complained about too many empty tables with a long wait. When we sat down we also waited another twenty minutes to get the menu and also another twenty minutes to order.
The menu was limited however the fish were.great and.fresh cooked to perrfection .

Quite beautiful place with excellent food. We had an adriatic tuna tartar which was great, a fish soup quite good and for main dish we shared a Chateaubriand that was awsome, with excellent choice of vegetables and fruits. 
Cocktails were very good as well.
My 4 stars go for service. It can be better, but dinner is so good that I strongly recommend it.
Breakfast is the best in all town. Other food was better last year, I was told that the restoran have new owner. Snacks are fine, burger is not. 3 ⭐️ for breakfast, can’t recomend other meals.

The loveliest dinner of our stay. We didn’t book, so couldn’t get a waterfront table, but the view was gorgeous none the less. The staff were wonderfully attentive, the food and wine were delicious, and it wasn’t over-priced. Well worth a visit!

Everything from the reservation making process to the seating and serving and food was done first class. Loved the cello and piano background music. Beef bourginion was tender and savory with polenta and a delicious sauce. Not unreasonable pricing for the experience

With a view of the port and dusk settling, we were treated to a fantastic meal in Dubrovnic’s old town. The calamari was wonderful and my fiancé’s salmon was beautiful. Couple the excellent food with the live jazz music and view and it was an exquisite night.
We ate at this place twice while we were visiting Dubrovnik and it was perfect both times! Service was very good and the terrace overlooking the boats and sea was wonderful

Fabulous views and great food. Price comparable with most in the old town, yet with a great view over the harbour. The food choices covered most options of meat fish vegetarian etc. We had the baked fish special for 2 and was plentiful and delicious.
We stopped here for a drink and decided to stay for food. The sea bass and the cod dishes were amazing! We will be returning before the end of our holiday!

We went here without a booking around 7pm and were surprised to be able to get a table. The whole experience was faultless. The food was the nicest we have had in Dubrovnik and possibly in all of Croatia. My wife had the Octopus entree and I had the mussels. Both were very flavoursome especially the Octopus which had a coating of caviar on top. For mains I had the beef steak which was definitely the best steak I have had in Croatia - just perfectly cooked and my wife had the beef cheek. 
The service was very attentive but not intrusive and certainly we were not rushed - the waiter even asked when we wanted the main course after finishing the entree which is the first time I have been asked that in Croatia.
The location of course is sublime, watching out over the port with the sun setting. Couldn't be better.

Ate here during our stay and had a lovely evening meal. Price comparable with others in the Old Town. £90ish for 2 sharing a starter, 2 mains, 2-3 alcholoc drinks each. Good astmosphere. Booked in advance and would return.
Wonderful place. Setting is amazing and so is the food. Highly recommended. I hade a fillet pure. Baked perfectly. Price/Q very good (Dubrovnik is not cheap)

We’ve been here several times during our stay in Dubrovnik. It’s right in the heart of the old town and really beautifully decorated- nice candles, comfy chairs and a lovely ambiance. 
The wine is delicious!! It’s not expensive at all either. I could drink it all day- it’s smooth, rich and fruity. A glass of local wine only sets you back about 45 Kunas, which seems incredibly good value compared to other nearby bars, where you can pay up to 100 kunas for the same thing.

My husband and I had dinner there and were attracted to the restaurant because of the lovely view of the water. They were able to accommodate my gluten and pepper allergy. My fish and veggies were savoury and the wine was good. My husband's meal was average, though.
Loved this restaurant, set in the arches overlooking the harbour. The food was gorgeous especially the pork belly.

We had a family cocktail at Gradska kavana. I had the best watermelon cocktail.
Service was at high level with very proffesional waiter, named Ivo.
Overall experience: recommend.

Had the chance to experience both bar and restaurant in a fiercely hot Sunday in beautiful Dubrovnik. 
Terrace bar is located at the most fascinating corner of old town .
Restaurant is either on the terrace fronting old town port or in a big ( and cool) hall.
Good risotto and burgers and salmon.
Really friendly services all around and affordable prices. 
Loved it.

We’d eaten here on our last visit and returning with younger family members wanted to do so again, a quick e mail and all was arranged perfectly. We arrived to find the perfect table at the front of the terrace overlooking the harbour waiting for us. Service was friendly and professional throughout and the complimentary desserts for the children was a lovely touch. Thank you!
Wonderful place for lunch. Great location, very good food. Excellent cocktails. Would definitely come again

Wonderful location and great service. The food was lovely and the staff were very attentive. It’s not particularly expensive given its location and the quality of the food. We had the mussels, rib eye steak, pork confit and the fish dish of the day (sea bass). Couldn’t fault the food or drinks. The cocktails were very good (rose G&T and cosmopolitan) and the ‘house’ red was excellent. All in all highly recommend.

Views of the old port
Great breakfast set with hot drink, juices, bread and hot dish.
Staff were very friendly.

We stayed in Old Town Dubrovnik for 4 days. The Gradska Kavana Arsenal had been recommended to me by friends that had been there before - and it more than lived up to the reputation. From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere is fantastic - from the vaulted ceilings to the bar area to the immaculate tablecloths on the tables, the impact is amazing. And then there is the view! If you're lucky enough to get a table by the harbour, it's just a spectacular place to sit and watch the sunset. The food was outstanding - and then in cruised an old Pirate Galleon, which does a daily Game of Thrones Cruise. We loved it so much we came back for breakfast the next day, enjoyed the other side with the Old Town view on the verandah. I travel a LOT - and this was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Great value as well!

Of course location is awesome, in the former arsenal in the heart of the harbor.
The restaurant welcome a vast number of guests, so you might always find a table available.
Food list propose muscles, calamar, octopuss,but as well chicken sandwich and burger.
You will be charged 20 to 30€ for a dish, good not stunning.
The service is factory like.
So you can go there for the place, you will eat decently and pay for the location.

We stayed in Old Town for 8 days. Discovered this great place for breakfast and came back two more times for breakfast and once for dinner. Blissful setting looking out at the harbour and beyond. Food was excellent every time and basically the same cost as anywhere else in a narrow alley in Old Town. Service was impeccable. Very attentive and friendly. This was hands down our favourite place to eat. Highly recommended!
Great view in the center. Good tuna but the waiter was very bad. It looked like he wanted to finish asap. They should improve the service. The place and the atmosphere is very nice and romantic.

Very nice spot at the port of Dubrovnik, live music, good energy. The service is nice and quick , even if the restaurant was fully booked , the hostess found un a good table for 2. 

The prices are resemble for the spot and quality of the products. 

Good vines list and cocktails. Try the sparkling vine from the region !
We both had the Chateaubriand. It was outstanding. The filet was done to perfection, great sauce. One of the better meals we had in Dubrovnik.
Fantastic location, great breakfast but service was realy poor. Jung and not trained stuff... They were quity unpolite.... Such a shame....

Visited 10 & 11 August 2018. We liked this place so much we came for evening drinks, breakfast and dinner over the weekend! Sat out on the terrace overlooking Luža Square where there was a lovely breeze. Good set breakfast – coffee, fresh OJ, omelette, pastries, rolls. Short-ish lunch / dinner menu but high quality ingredients & delicious food. The cakes and desserts were very good too. Was busy but the staff out front were great at helping you get seated.
Helpful, attentive & discrete staff.

We visited Arsenal on our second night, our first night we visited Panorama, a sister restaurant and were spoiled by the service - Niksa, exceptional and works at both restaurants. 
I booked months ahead and asked for a table on the patio, we were 3 tables back, a little disappointing, but still great view into the harbor. 
The beverage presentation was eye catching with extra touches. Our food was exceptional - well presented and tasty. 
The restaurant was busy, we didn't get quite the same level of service as at Panorama, but it was good.
Would definitely recommend you visit, well worth it!

We ate three times in the Arsenal and found the quality of the food and the service to be exceptional. The staff are extremely attentive and nothing was too much problem - good quality wine list and selection of food as well as an outstanding view over the harbour made it a fabulous setting and experience

We wanted to have a meal one evening in the old town of Dubrovnik as we were staying a little way away in Slano. We had booked, and I would recomend that, it is pretty busy and an ideal location to watch the people and boats of the old town marina. 
The meal did not start well. Having been seated, 20 minutes passed without a waiter appearing or a drinks order being taken. We called over a waitress callled Marja and complained, who then took responsibilty for us for the rest of the stay and really turned our experience around. 
The food is stunning, some of the best food I have had for some time. Portions are generous as well so it's not just pretty plates. If you like fish I would recomend the Octopus salad and leave you to experience it !!
The wine was excellent, go for the local stuff. 
Thanks again to Marja (I think we got that name correct) you made our evening a memorable and happy experience :-)

What a wonderful meal we had at this beautiful restaurant that is located just by the harbour and offers breathtaking views. The service was exceptional, our server Goran was knowledgeable, efficient and very witty. He helped us choose the right things to order. We forget on their seafood ..... fresh oysters , mussels and other seafood. Every dish was delicious. Couldn't have had a better lunch! Highly recommended.

Food was almost incidental as we watched the drama of the staff tantrums and disagreements.........raised voices, trays smashed down - all in full view of diners. Entertaining, though not exactly professional.

We went for breakfast, and the food was ok......omelettes, juice, croissants coffee. Service was very slow........maybe they should focus a little more on the customers and a little less on arguing with each other.

For our final meal in Croatia a wonderful meal by the marina. We tried to book the night before but unfortunately they were fully booked for the next day but recommend turning up on the night as not all tables can be reserved and luckily they were able to seat us with a stunning view. The service was excellent- the waiter recommend we share the seafood starter and he was right as it was a generous portion. My fiancé had the fish from the specials list and like my steak it was cooked to perfection. A truly wonderful evening!
We sat on this lovely patio for after dinner drinks. Such a beautiful backdrop of the square. A perfect way to end your day!
We enjoyed our meal here so much, we came twice during our stay in Dubrovnik. The food is wonderful, the service is good, presentation is original, and the views are some of the best in town.

The first thing to say about this restaurant is it's setting. You have two choice either a table overlooking the old port of Dubrovnik or right at the end of the main thoroughfare in Dubrovnik Old town (Stradun). I don't think there is [possibly a restaurant anywhere with this kind of setting - a truly beautiful location - We had booked a table in advance and we opted for the Old Port side. We decided to share the fish dish of the day for 2 people and were treated by our waiter to the preparation of the fish before eating. We didn't have a starter but enjoyed a couple lovely glasses of white wine and finished off with a dessert between together with a couple of coffees. The cost overall was 586 kunas. The food was delicious - though again the vegetable were a bit limited - and the service and ambience were top class - a piano player was on hand to serenade us as we had our meal. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you visit Dubrovnik
Really enjoyed our meal had the pork belly it was excellent fantastic setting and not too expensive the service was also excellent

We booked in advance requesting a table overlooking the harbour. It's got very busy as the eve went on and we were glad we pre booked. 
I had the salmon fillet and my husband had the tuna fillet. His was definitely the better choice. We ha the recommended dessert, a Croatian creme caramel which was quite bland. The best thing for me was the complimentary drink at the end which was lemon ice cream with vodka and prosecco 🙌🏻
The location and surroundings were wonderful.

Great service with a great view. You can choose to look at the harbour or at the square and people watch. The food and drinks were very good and service was excellent. Would definitely recommend and go there again. It’s a bit pricey but not much more than other restaurants in Dubrovnik.

This was our special "last night in Dubrovnik" treat. We shared it with new friends that we had cycled the islands with.
The serviced here is first class, the food is good, but the serviced is what they stake their claim on. The setting for this restaurant is spectacular. This building with its three stone arches used to be the main ship repair yard in Dubrovnik and you can really sense the history of the site and imagine the boats being hauled out of the water to be defouled and recorked with all the sounds and smells that that involved.
As this place is on the expensive side and we were running out of money we opted for one course each but that we could share, I chose a beetroot based seafood risotto while my partner had the calamari salad. Lovely fresh food, beautifully cooked and full of all the right flavours. Sorry I don't remember the wine choice but it was very good.

As I said not cheap bu6 a lovely place to eat.
Food was amazing. The staff were very friendly. Location is ideal with sea view. Romantic restaurant and would recommend.

With a patio cafe overlooking the square and a shades dining terrace on the harbor, this is an ideal lunch spot during a day of touring. My wife, 15-year-old daughter and I had lunch the first time at our tour guide’s recommendation. We went the second time based on our experience. 

Probably great for dinner, too.

To me the sign of a good restaurant is what kind of service you get if things dont go to plan for the licth staff. Well they must have been very behinf because we didnt get our steaks for a while and what I can only describe as the best service I have ever received anywhere ever. The wonderful waiter came out with some tapas of cured hams and breads to help keep us going and apologised before we became annoyed over wait. He then returned to our table with a wine for me and a coke zero for my husband as that is what we where drinking and told us it was on the house. We then got our AMAZING steaks served. After that this waiter returned to collect our plates and he asked us to pick a dessert of choice and a cocktail on the house. We told him no it was far too much and he insisted. My husband was not drinking so I told him to pick me a Gin cocktail and for him to get a dessert but the waiter insisted to him he picks me a dessert also. The food was to die for, the beautiful atmosphere and exceptional service made this resturant our top experience in Dubrovnik and that is exactly how you look after customer's

Header says it all. Great position either on old port or in city walls with views of key buildings.

Crazy busy so jump on a table or book ahead.

Nothing outstanding but nothing to complain about.

Really good food,friendly helpful staff,scenic waterside setting all at a reasonable price.
Would recommend this restaurant.
I highly recommend this restaurant when in Dubrovnik. Very nice food and very delicious. Better to do a reservation. The staff is very professional. The food was delicious and fresh.

This restaurant was recommended to us by friends. It was no disappointment-although we couldn’t have an outside table we were almost outside. It is airy with high ceilings and good air conditioning. The service was very good. We wanted to try local food and wine and our waiter could not have been more helpful. The food was fresh, tasty and plentiful. We are here for 11 nights and will definitely return for a second helping.

Live music, a setting sun over the old port harbour, people milling around, a hot night. Wonderful service, and the food was terrific. We ate the brodet (great depth of flavour), mussels with fries (white wine broth), and a tuna tartar to start. A real buzz. Highly recommended to book.

The Gradska Kavana Arsenal is a great spot for people watching over a drink or a snack. At one end you are looking out towards Stradun and the other towards the port. They serve a wide selection of soft drinks, wines, cocktails (including a number of non-alcoholic options).

We stopped here for lunch. The view is breathtaking; overlooking the harbour. Elegant atmosphere and ambience. 
Our starters got a bit late. We didn’t complain but they apologized when they served it. They offered us two free drinks and even a discount on the bill which we didn’t ask for. But it was very professional approach which we really appreciated. 
The seafood (we ordered only seafood) was fresh, well prepared and delicious. Service was friendly and professional. 
Highly recommend it.

We had a large group at this restaurant, everyone was impressed with the bayside setting, large interiors and chic vibe. Staff were attentive and very professional, alas food and value were lacking when you consider what everyone else offers locally. Platters of local cheese and meats were really just ok given the price, fish served all good and very fresh but so simply done I don’t think it was aligned to the sophisticated setting. An expensive meal, only a 4, could have been 3 as it really doesn’t tick every box at all........

3 different seating locations - alfresco on Luza Square, a second underneath an impressive ceiling on the Port side and the third sandwiched in between. 
We sat on the Port side and were treated to all the wonderful shades of pink reflecting on the buildings from the setting sun.
✅ The food was delicious, loved the Pinot Sivi Kolaric and the service was perfect for us (attentive, but not stuffy or pretentious). A wonderful blend of smart & casual, all the more charming because the staff epitomise that awesome Croatian warmth.

We walked past this place and thought it’d be great to stop for drinks on the terrace, it’s a really comfortable spot to while away the afternoon with a glass of wine and people watch on the Stradun. The next day, we came back for breakfast and wanted to sit on the terrace on the port side but unfortunately it didn’t open til 10am so we had breakfast on the Stradun side terrace. They have some great deals for breakfast, we had the arsenal breakfast which had a bread basket, complete with a variety of jams and spreads, coffee, orange juice, toast, bacon, eggs, beans, mushrooms, sausages and tomatoes for 78 kn, plus a croissant which came with a coffee and orange juice for 14 kn. It’s great value and great food!

This restaurant is on the waterfront in the old town, in the very touristic small port, why my initial thought was that “this is going to be the usual somewhat non-memorable place to have dinner”. To my surprise, the food and the wine recommended was excellent. It is a lively place with tourists but nevertheless the standards are kept high.
Had 2 glasses of very good wine, carefully selected by the waiter according to my taste. Had delicious fresh mussels as well. Beautiful romantic setting and great services.

We had an excellent meal here during our holiday in Dubrovnik. We had walked past a few days earlier and saw how lovely it looked so booked ahead, and were delighted to be given a table right next to the harbour overlooking the water. The staff were really friendly and welcoming which was really appreciated as up until that point we felt like the locals treat tourists as second class citizens and nothing but a nuisance, so it was a nice change to feel welcomed! 

Our food was the best meal we ate out, I chose pork belly which was beautifully presented and tasted delicious whilst my partner chose squid. The wine and beer were also lovely and overall I felt the whole meal was really good value, we expected to pay a lot more for what felt like a high end restaurant.

We had a fantastic meal in this restaurant during our stay in Dubrovnik.The staff was outstanding and the food was delicious.I had beef steak (best beef steak ever).This was one of best restaurants we had visited during our travel and definitely we will come back(:

We visited three times and had a wonderful experience each time- smooth coffee very chocolatety hot chocolate and cold drink were very refreshing. Excellent location and. atmosphere overlooking the harbour. A must go to in Dubrovnik.

I read about this place in one of the guides I’d picked up at the airport in Dubrovnik so we decided to try here for our first breakfast in this beautiful city. The menu was quite limited but with the main breakfast came croissant and a variety of mini spreads and jams, hot drink of choice and a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice which was incredible. The main hot breakfast was nice, not your typical “English breakfast” but a welcome and enjoyable local spin. 
The service was good and the views were just lovely.

My husband and I dined here on 23.7.18. We were lucky enough to get harbour front table with lovely views of the harbour and surrounding areas. The food and wine were reasonably priced and the rib eye steak was delicious and cooked to perfection. We paid approximately £100 for two steaks, side dishes and a bottle of Pinot Grigio. Our waiter, Valentino was very attentive and although we had a prime position table did not feel we were hurried out. Will definitely be back.
Great food, service and views. The grilled squid is the best, thank you for a nice time in your establishment

We booked this restaurant for our last night in Dubrovnik. We were lucky enough to get a front row seat on the terrace. Our waiters were very helpful and gave us good recommendations on the food and wine. Our meal was a great treat for our last night - a great restaurant in a great place.

Prebooked visit for two adults and a baby. A bit of confusion about baby carrier vs baby chair resulted in not getting menues for quite some time. No big deal; can easily happen. We asked for some hot water to mix some baby porridge, but that was surprisingly difficult. Coffee machine wasn't working due to electricity outage. They were still serving hot food, so how difficult can pot + water = hot water really be? YOU DO NOT OFFER A SIX MONTH OLD BABY HOT TAP WATER - THAT IS A HEALTH HAZARD! In the end, they managed to get some remaining water out of the coffee machine.
We ordered starters and mains, some soft drinks and some glasses of wine. The waiter took care to ask if we wanted the wine with the mains, but forgot to actually serve it and had to be reminded. 
The power returned and the sound system came on. A little while later, a two man band with piano and trumpet started playing soft and nice. Unfortunately, the sound system stayed on and the mix of soft and pop was not a good one. I had to point it out to the staff, before they switched it off. 
Finally; deserts. Ask your waiter for the cakes, was what the menu said. The waiter will list everything he remembers and you're supposed to just pick one from the 8-10 he lists. It's not easy to translate/explain unfamiliar names on a spoken list and you really get no time to decide, with the "menu" standing by the table, awaiting your desicion. We passed on deserts. 
The food itself was excellent, but the overall visit was a disappointment.

We had a great experience here, with a very attentive and knowledgeable waiter who directed us to try the Croatian sparkling wine ( dry white ), which turned out to be the right choice. We also experienced a live music performance which was also very good. My only slightly negative criticism is that I booked online two days in advance & requested a table closest to the harbour. We were sat ‘one’ back from the harbour? Perhaps I needed to book further in advance ? Apart from that it’s a definite recommendation!

We visited on the recommendation of my daughter and were so pleased we did. Our waiter Marjo was the best I have encountered in years. Knowledgeable and chatty but knew when to stay away. His food and wine recommendations were spot on and we had a delightful time. 
The tuna carpaccio. Red risotto with scallops and octopus were all outstanding. Great coffee and a complimentary lemon/vodka drink provides the perfect ending.

What a beautiful restaurant. We thought it may be expensive as for the setting in the harbour but it was priced much the same as all the other restaurants. Lovely menu and great staff. The food was excellent - fish - wine excellent - we also got to see fireworks going off in the harbour which was a bonus - a must visit restaurant in Dubrovnik
Food delicious and unique. Staff attentive and caring. We had the mussels and raw fish. Then octopus with caviar. So fresh and full of flavour. Ideal lunch or dinner.

This place was so good I would rate it 6 stars if possible. The food was perfect and so was the service. We really enjoyed our evening and I’ll strongly recommend this place to anyone who wants a bit better of everything.

If people watching is something you enjoy while sipping on a glass of wine then this is the place for you. The couple beside us ate there 3 nights in a week but I wouldn’t go back. That may sound harsh, the service was excellent, the waiter was extremely attentive. We shared Oysters to start and they were succulent, just divine. I was excited for my next course, I ordered Red Beetroot, Prosecco & Scallop Risotto. It was a hot starter so I wasn’t expect it to be huge but it only had two scallops. It tasted just like beetroot which on its own isn’t an overly exciting taste however it was presented beautifully.
A great spot to enjoy the atmosphere in Old Town Dubrovnik, just make sure to get a table by the square and let history fly by

Looking for a grand restaurant in Dubrovnik old city (to celebrate a special occasion), this one fits the bill. Part of the Rector palace complex, this restaurants offers great views of city harbour, Ploce's gate, monastery, city walls and docked boats. 

The food is great, wine list extensive and service is classy.

Really good food with such a lovely atmosphere. Nestled in on a corner of the waterfront, definitely book ahead of possible to get a front row table. Great for people watching and seeing all the boats coming in/out. Nice selection of non alcoholic cocktails too!

This restaurant is in prime position overlooking the busy harbour, so there's plenty to enjoy while you're there

Our salmon & rib-eye steak mains were very tasty & we enjoyed a nice bottle of local rose

Definitely worth a visit

We stumbled upon this gem on our way to another restaurant, and we’re glad we did! 
We had a very nice lunch sitting right next to the waterfront. The cocktail list was fabulous and we enjoyed a mojito and a sort of rose cocktail which were both beautifully presented. Best cocktails we had in Dubrovnik and very reasonably priced too. 
Our lunch was roast vegetables, smoked cod ceviches, and mussels. All delicious!
We recommended this place to a few of our friends too and they very much enjoyed it.
Great food and excellent service. The fish was fresh and delicious. Stunning views of the harbour too.

As you might expect from this location, this is a very buzzy restaurant. We hadn't reserved but were shown to a nice table (this in mid June) looking out onto the harbour. Two of us shared a large sea bass (wild - not farmed) and the very attentive waiter (excellent service by the way), filleted it for us at the table. Also gave us complimentary schnapps at the end of the meal. HAs a very classy feel and I wouldn't hesitate to go back - was my favourite of all the restaurants we tried in Dubrovnik over a week's stay.
The food, the service, the views, and the site. It is like you are living a 1000 years ago and today. It transports you to a different time with perfect wine and delicious food.
We sat down for some drinks in the heat. The drinks were great with an artistic side to them. Great and pleasant waiter. Good place for a lunch aswell.

Huge place but book ahead and request waterside dining. Menu looks enormous but is really quite simple. The starters and mains we had were well presented and very good. Service was efficient. This was definitely one of the top places in the old town without being too expensive.

We really enjoyed our dinner on the city side of the large restaurant. The people watching is terrific and you’re right in the middle of the evening atmosphere.

Lovely cocktails and lovely grilled squid priced for the location as much as their taste.
I visited on a number of occasions. The service was fab. The food was delicious. The setting was perfect. Such a lovely experience. I could sit there all day :)

We had a really lovely dinner with excellent service. Our waiter Marijn (I think that's the spelling) was very attentive, friendly and funny. The restaurant is not really vegan friendly, but the chef gladly made an off menu pasta dish for one of our party. All the food was delicious and the view is really amazing. We arrived during daylight (8pm reservation)and watched the sky darken and lights come on. It was wonderful. We thought that the prices were very reasonable for a very upscale experience. You should definitely get a reservation as it is very busy.
The breakfast combo variety is the best we came across in old city . Food taste ok and fast service . You can get 10% off when visiting consequently by asking for the promotion card
An amazing night! Valentino was a great host to our evening. Great food, service and drinks. Remember to have the final cocktail offered!!👍

We had a fantastic dinner in a superb setting.
The staff are very attentive and friendly.
The food was delicious and good wine choices. 
Perfect end to our stay.

This location shares a bar wait area with Gradskavana ... which is an elevated patio inside the walls on the Stradun. The service was excellent... the floor manager was busy running things and yet never forgot to check with us to make sure things were ok as we waited (we showed up without reservations later on in the evening, and wanted a seat outside on the railing overlooking the marina. Staff were very polite and knowledgeable both about the kitchen as well as the wine. Decantered the wine, deboned the fresh fish in front of us.... it was wonderful. Highly recommend listening to the recommendations as the local fare was very fresh, well-prepared and balanced. We enjoyed it.
We used TripAdvisor to find a restaurant for lunch and we were impressed with the seafood choices. I had the most sublime grilled calamari on a bed of chard/potato.

We have just booked this restaurant for the second time in 6 days. The food, setting, servers are all fabulous. We all loved the tuna tartar, grilled salmon, fish of the day, ribeye steak and to top it off the gorgeous after dinner ice cream drink that was on the house. Looking forward to another perfect experience tonight!

We found this place by accident and I only saw the reviews after because we had such an amazing experience I wanted to write a review. 

Ended up eating here tonight. First, in the casual lobby bar patio that overlooks the main square which is superb. Then, we discovered the dining room through the back of the building which is the best view in town! Could not imagine coming to the city and not eating here in the formal dining room outdoor patio overlooking the harbor. The food is just as amazing as the food. And surprisingly, service is outstanding too.

There are a few places that have a view of the marina, but this place has the best.

Not only does it offer attentive staff, good food and decent surroundings, but it also has the best fish stew in town. It's packed full of seafood and comes with a side dish of polenta.

Top tip is to ask for a card that gets you 10% off the bill and can be used again and again.

We visited this place a few times for mojitos. The mojitos were fantastic! Also had breakfast here. The quality is very good. For example orange juice was freshly squeesed. In addition to good quality, the setting is perfect but the prices are not any higher than in other, not so fancy, restaurants in the old city.

Visited here on our last evening in Dubrovnik. Didn't book (which with hindsight is recommended), but we got lucky. 
Absolutely stunning restaurant inside with amazing views through the open air vaulted walls looking into the old harbour. 
Service was attentive, helpful but not overbearing. The prices, given its decor and location, were comparatively reasonable. Not only did we receive a free apperitif, but also a free dessert. The food was stunning. I had the pork belly, and it was not a tiny portion. More than enough to offer samplings to my folks sitting opposite. 
Would certainly recommend booking, it seemed full all night. The temptation would be to book a table closest to the marina, but given there is a public walkway right there, nosey pedestrians are but a few steps away. Further in is just as nice, and you experience the full ambiance of the visually impressive interior.

A big place on the water in old town. Doesn’t get more touristy....so expectations were low. But out of the 10 days we stayed in Croatia this was one of our best meals. The adults had delicious Croatian dishes and the kids had pasta with a nice Croatian red. And, one of my favorites, a free after dinner drink, digestivo, always causes me to warm to a place. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us a couple different history lessons on Croatian history and politics. A good time was had by all
Good location with sea-view, friendly services, delicious grilled cuttlefish 🦑 & octopus salad with black caviar

This is a quality restaurant in an excellent location. The published menu outside does not do it justice as the food and the "Specials" are simpply exceptional. Good selection of wines with expert help if you are not familiar with the Croatian wine regions. We simply had to go back after the first visit it was too good to miss!

While on a cruise we docked into Dubrovnik for the day, we disembarked and walked around the OldTown, it was lovely.While there we had lunch at the Kavana Arsenal, the food was of a very good quality’s and the waiters were very attentive and spoke perfectly English. There was a wide selection of food and drinks.

What a gem this place is. An outstanding view of the old town harbour, great service and the food was exceptional, so much so that the four of us chose to eat there again on our last night in Dubrovnik. 
Nearly forgot about the cost, well, suffice to say you could pay over twice the price for a meal of similar quality so extremely reasonable.

We usually avoid restaurants in the main tourist areas, but we were drawn to this harbour side restaurant and I'm so glad we were. We were offered a table inside with a fabulous view of the harbour, the waiters were friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. We had the salmon and the squid ink pasta, everyone in our party said this was the best meal we had by far. I can't wait to return.

My girlfriend and I had planned on visiting for a steak on the last night of our holiday and we had scoped out arsenal a few days before. The night before, we visited the restaurant to make a reservation but unfortunately we were told that they were booked up but if we came without a reservation they would do their utmost to accommodate us. We weren't disappointed.

On the last night we came, were given a good table no problem. We both had a cocktail, the ribeye steak and a dessert each and it was fantastic. It was such a lovely end to our holiday and we went home very happy. The service from the waiting staff was first class and they should be very proud.
I would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to enjoy a special evening :D
Sundown aperitifs on the square with a plate of oysters. Efficient polite service, and and when a bad oyster was detected they gave us some more free (good ones!). Great place to people watch.

We visited this restaurant at the end of the "Game of Thrones" tour. No reservation but they quickly accommodated our party of 8 on the patio. We enjoyed tasty cocktails and local beers along with our lunch meals, which were also quickly delivered and delightful.

Visited not once but twice during our five day stay in Cavtat! On both visits we had the Steak & Cheese sandwich, sounds boring but it was so good we couldn't resist another one!

Second time around we booked a window arch table as soon as the boat docked so that the view could match the food and it did!

The restaurant runs straight through the building to the city centre giving a top quality restaurant and up market cafe to please everyone, both have amazing views.

Food, service and price all excellent.

Highly recommend *****
We sat facing the water— great service and wonderful brunch drinks! Beautiful building from the outside in the center of Dubrovnik.
We loved the people watching at Kavana nocni bar - looking out to the main plaza and toward the strada was great fun. We relaxed, we enjoyed and we were well looked after! Coffee v good.

We found this perfect for breakfast each morning, something that was otherwise not so easy to find in the Old Town. There were 3 good breakfast choices and the food was delicious, great quality and more than plentiful and we discovered that the waiter had recognised us and applied a discount to our bill! Most impressive. 

We also booked for dinner one night on the other side of the restaurant overlooking the sea. Again the food was lovely(limited menu which is always a good sign), beautifully cooked and served and the staff so very nice and pleasant and very welcoming. Recommend for all meals!

Had lunch here due to the great location by the harbour. Sadly though the food was really disappointing. Mussels weren't cleaned properly. Full of grit and seaweed. Side of soggy fries weren't much better. Did complain and they did remove the mussels from the bill so at least they dealt with the complaint. 

Disappointing though and really wouldn't recommend!

Fantastic food, great service and a view to die for. Can it get any better? Restaurant is a superb mixture of high quality food and attentive, friendly service. The view out over the old port just adds something else to a great meal. Sensitive, appropriate live music. If it is a little more expensive than the restaurants in town then it is worth every Kuna more and represents excellent value for Dubrovnik.

We had a lunch here and even though there were no water side tables, they quickly moved us when one became available. We all enjoyed our lunch choices and it would have been nice to eat an evening meal there too. The interior is really lovely and stylish (and cool!) as well as the outside being a very desirable location with seating options by the harbour and on the other side of the building at the end of the main strip. They do nice cocktails and drinks too - not badly priced and they will give you 10% discount cards to use again on food and drink and also at their sister restaurants in Dubrovnik - Panorama at the top of the cable car and Dubravka (but not the more expensive Nautika). Highly recommended.
The food here is beautiful, would definitely recommend both the risotto and seafood pasta. Great service too.
Just stopped for drinks at about 4pm, the best cocktails we've ever had. Seated next to the sea with a fantastic view. Worth the extra money.

This restaurant is in a wonderful location by the harbour.
The food was the best that we had during our week here and the service was excellent.
Highly recommended!

If I could give this restaurant any more stars I would. I saw this restaurant and I knew I had to come here. My husband and I had the best dining experience here EVER!! We were served by Marijo and his service was impeccable. The food is amazing and if you are in Dubrovnik you must give this place a try! I am from Australia and I would jump on a plane, travel 24hrs just to come here again for dinner, it is so worth it! Thank you so much for making our last night in Dubrovnik so memorable! Also the traditional Croatian desserts are a must! Highly Recommended!

Great food in a nice setting. Ate there two days in a row and tried their fish stew, mountain and sea pasta, grilled squid , octopus salad and deserts, all lovely and tasty. Service is superb too - Ivan is an amazing server he gave us good recommendations on wine. Pricewise they are not cheap but definitely very reasonable and well worth for the quality of food you get. Highly Recommend!

We bumped into a friend who recommended this restaurant. With its great location on the waterfront in Dubrovnik old town, great service and great food you can't go wrong. Oh, and it's reasonably priced too...for Dubrovnik! So good we went twice. Recommended

We’d just arrived and checked in and were famished. After perusing several restaurant menus in the area, we decided on this one. The terrace seating gave us a nice location to enjoy the square and the total ambience of the Old Town by night. The food was good and inspired us to try the other restaurants owned and operated by the group. We ordered the fish stew with polenta and the grilled squid on Swiss chard. The table bread here was excellent. Service was friendly and efficient.

A large open terrace restaurant with stunning views over the Old Harbour of Dubrovnik with passing traffic of boats and pedestrians alike, it has tremendous atmosphere. The menu is not large but what is there is high end fine dining but in no way ostentatious and we had the most memorable very late lunch, early dinner there.
Our Waiter Vedran was superb, recommending dishes and complimenting local wines which we have found incredible so far( coming from South Africa we are spoilt, but we have not drunk cheap Croatian wines yet)
I can highly recommend the ham and pea risotto and i would go so far as to say that the seafood risotto is one of the best i have ever eaten. The mussels which is what i had for a starter was not one of my favorites purely for the fact that they use bread in the sauce and it becomes like a paste in your mouth, but the flavour was great and the mussels cooked to perfection.
Mains were Pork belly- unbelievable- Veal Back-strap- i was told this was also unbelievable.
Incredible food, wine and service once again in the most incredible setting

Book ahead of going here ! The food is great, the service is very nice. Waiting staff are very knowledgeable about their offerings. 

Sit by the harbour - the views are magnificent. 

If you tell them that you have been to their other restaurants (which we had) they give a 10% discount. 

Recommend this place. It’s fabulous.

This restaurant was recommended by our Hotel, The Punic Palace Hotel, as a good luncheon venue because of the view, which overlooks the busy Dubrovnik harbour.

The view was perfect and a most enjoyable outlook. The ambience was open and airy and being out of the hot sun, was comfortable and relaxing. The tables are well apart and separated by occasional attractive planter boxes.

The restaurant is quite large but wasn’t very busy when we arrived at 12 noon.

The service was excellent, very attentive and informative , especially in respect to the local wines.

The menu is printed in a large newspaper sheet style, and was comprehensive both for snacks and a la carte entree and mains.
We chose a combination of a beef burger, with fries and salad, and it was a huge meal. The other choice was calamari and garden salad. The calamari was a large serving and most enjoyable.

The beverage list is not extensive but adequate, and we chose a bottle of Croatian Chardonnay and it was a good choice.

A delightful experience and we will return to this restaurant. Recommended, and importantly for the view.

One of my favourite restaurants we visited in Dubrovnik,beef bourguignon was excellent with extremely tender meat and great flavours.We sat on the street side with a lovely view of the Old Town,the waiter was very attentive and polite in this very beautiful restaurant,it reminded me of the Cafe de Paris in Monte Carlo but with very reasonable prices considering the outstanding architecture and setting.

Our friends had seen this Restaurant earlier in the day and thought it would be good to try that evening. We hadn't booked but after a short wait in the bar area we were shown to our table. Waiters very friendly. We ordered our wines which were served promptly and professionally and our meal order was taken. All starters and main courses were well presented, hot, and served professionally. We had one dessert only a creme caramel (or Croatian equivalent). The meal and meal experience was very good but nothing was exceptional and it is difficult to see how they can justify their prices. Two course (1 dessert) Dinner for Four with 2 bottles of wine and a sparkling water cost £250+ with tip.

So London prices ++ and although as I've already said it was very nice it's not really what I would call value for money.

Visited Dubrovnik for 4 days and customer service is not at the top of their agenda in spite of it relying heavily on tourism. But our experience here was totally different in a very good way. We walked in (party of 6) without a reservation and the hostess was very helpful - we wanted a harbour side table. Suggested we sit at the bar overlooking the harbour while a table became available which we did. The waiters were friendly and very pleasant. Was shown to our table in about 30 mins. The food was superb and our waiter - Vedren - was extremely polite and helpful. 
The ambience was great and we got fig liqueur after dinner on the house plus a 10% off our bill for the wait for the table.
All in all our best dinner in Dubrovnik.

Right on the port with outstanding view on the wall and marina.
Service professional but not really friendly and food very average.

As this restaurant is right in the centre of the touristy harbour area I was unsure what to expect but we had some delicious food, a lovely view of the harbour and polite staff. I had fresh fish (sea bream) with roasted veg and my partner had a burger. Despite the price of our meal being similar to the other places we ate (300-400kuna), thr restuarant felt quite classy and i actually felt a little undressed having been walking round a hot dubrovnik all day so I think it would be even more lovely to come to dressed up in the evening. Useful tip- this restaurant, dubravka (near pile gate) and panorama (mount srd) do 10% off at the others once you have eaten at one.

Great for Lunch & Dinner - must book WELL in advance for prime table .
Once again first & by Pile Gate
For our last night we chose here and were not disappointed the food ambience and view all made for a fantastic last evening in a beautiful city.

We just stopped for a coffee but after looking at the menu and having a sneaky look into the restaurant at the harbour side we stay for lunch. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the food was first class the wine was very good and we sat and ate nobody rushed us we enjoyed the food the view and for what would appear to be a classy restaurant the prices were good too
We will return
Had a wonderful time at this restaurant. Everything was exceptional, to include the service provided by our waiter Marijo. Highly recommend this restaurant. It’s a MUST!

We were worried this restaurant wouldn't be very good as it's in such a central spot - in London this would be a tourist trap and nothing more! However it was a real gem...the food was reasonable and very tasty (we had oysters and mussels) but the main attraction is the view looking out to the harbour and the romantic atmosphere. The service was initially very slow and it took a while to get asked for our drinks order, but once that was done the rest of the service was attentive and friendly. There was a keyboard and cello duo performing background music who were fabulous. They played pop songs but with a classical twist...we had lots of fun trying to guess the tune!
Was a beautiful place. Beautiful food at a reasonable price with very attentive staff. Would definitely go back again. Not to mention the view was priceless.

We visited on more than one occasion for drinks and also had a lunch here.
Sit to the front on the main square or on the port side, both offer a beautiful view of the Old City. 
Service swift and professional. Greeting impeccable and you feel well looked after. Good selection of wines and the uncomplicated food menu has something for everyone.
A well executed formula and a must when in Dubrovnik.
Would return.
We had a lovely dinner here, sitting at the seafront, enjoying the sunset. I had the grilled octopus which was great. Staff is very friendly.

Good variety of breakfast ...well cooked eggs. staff is very courteous and helpful. besides the view of the street while sipping your latte was cherry on the cake. 
We have a dinner also one evening and the staff were very helpful in preparing off menu vegetarian dishes for us. Loved the ambience and setting

After going to panorama the night before we were given a voucher for 10% off this restaurant so we decided to give it a go. Panorama was so food we thought this had to be the same. It didn’t disappoint. Excellent service and the food was fantastic. Great seats at the front. Would go back!

3 visits and 3 wins! Ambiance, food, wine, service, atmosphere, views; all fantastic! And if you are lucky, you will be serviced by Goran. Thanks guys. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Great idea having snacks addition for easy/quick lunch.

Instagram: EATINGWITHN - food and travel blog.
One of the better places ive been to in Dubrovnik.
The food was very good and the service was great as well.
The view was my favourite part.

I rarely write negative reviews, especially when I didn't even get to eat here but was so disappointed with the service and attitude! We walked past and thought what a lovely place to sit for lunch overlooking the harbour. There was a table free at the front, as people were just leaving, so I asked for that one and after some discussion between a couple of the waitresses told I could have it if we waited whilst they prepared it. We were taken to a waiting area and a few minutes later taken to a side table, set back from the front and not the one we had been told we could have. When I queried it I was told it was reserved, which was rubbish as another couple had just walked in behind us and by this time there was another one free! So we were seated and we waited for a considerable amount of time without being asked what we wanted to drink or being acknowledged in any way. Consequently we got up and left - not impressed! We then went to Above 5 Restaurant where we had the most enjoyable lunch, service and views!

We ate a late lunch here before our flight home. We chose the street view and had the best aperol spritz of our trip. The food was really good and quite big portions. The staff very helpful, moving us inside during a thunderstorm and finding us another outside table when the sun came out. We were given a discount card to use on our next visit and if we had more time there we would definitely have used it.

Really superb experience, just dropped in for a coffee at the beginning of lunch but this was not a problem.
Treated ourselves to lunch next day, glorious roasted sea bass & kids v happy with their choices. Staff were all lovely & Danijel was as nice as could be. Totally recommend 5***** :)

After reading all the reviews on Tripadvisor and seeing the pictures of the beautiful view of the port, I really wanted to try this restaurant. My partner and I turned up around 7pm with no reservation and asked for a table out the back and they found us a great spot. The service was brilliant, all very friendly and attentive the whole time. We ordered the mussels as an entree to share, the white wine sauce was delicious! We shared the fish stew and the sea and mountains pasta and both were incredibly tasty- all made with fresh seafood. Had a lovely evening at this restaurant and would definitely recommend anyone visiting Dubrovnik.

We stopped by around 6pm for an evening meal. The restaurant has a double aspect facing the harbour and the main street as well as inside seating. The service was excellent from start to finish. We had a main course each and a local white wine recommended by the waiter. The food was well cooked and well presented. The fig liquer served foc after the meal was equisite. We will be visiting again.
Nice locations, especially for people watching. Food good, staff very attentive. They brought out blankets when a couple of our party got a bit chilly. Reasonable prices (for Dubrovnik)

Beautiful view over the harbour of old town Dubrovnik. Would recommend booking a day in advances to reserve a table by the front. Variety of choices but mainly sea food from the Adriatic Sea. We had the Tuna steak and salmon which was lovely, food was reasonably priced.

We loved this bar/ cafe/ restaurant so much that we went several times a day - for breakfast, for afternoon tea, for drinks and for late-night coffee! There is a restaurant overlooking the marina/ port and also an inland terrace where we camped out. The breakfast was the best we had whilst staying in Dubrovnik, and we thought the cocktails were outstanding - the pina colada was to die for - really!

Very good restaurant in a perfect location in the core of the Old City with two views: city or the harbor. Food was very good an tasty, reasonable price and excellent quality of the service. Definitely a place to try.

The position and terrace attract you to this rather elegant looking eating place. Turned out not to be nearly as expensive as it looks.

I had the very filling Confit Belly Pork and my wife the very satisfying salmon fillet. We had a bottle of Croatian rose 220 kunas, bottle of water was 39 kunas for 75cl. 
Total bill was 541 kunas but we were given a 10% discount which means we will very probably be back during our second week here.

Staff were very attentive, in fact I got my fingers smacked for trying to refill my own wine glass!

We stopped by here during our walk through old town and were very glad we did. The back patio of the restaurant is overlooking the port and has excellent views. The food was extremely good we even joked about going back again the following day. The fish of the day was sea bass one of my favorites it was delightful.

My partner and I spent the first and last morning of our trip at the Gradska Kavana Arsenal. First morning due to he high reviews, and the last morning because we couldn’t think of anywhere better to finish our trip before heading off to the airport!

You can choose to sit inside, as well as from two outdoor seating areas, one facing into the main square in its own off-street, raised area (slightly nicer and secluded compared to most other restaurants where you are seated essentially on the street), and another area facing out with fantastic views of the port - probably one of the most photogenic spots of the port in Dubrovnik!

Staff were friendly, helpful and polite on both occasions, and the food was well prepared. Though at first it may seem expensive, the main breakfast options (unless you wish to freestyle!) come with a basket of ~6-8 breads/croissants with plenty selection of jams, honey, Nutella, a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice, hot drink, and a decently portioned main breakfast (Arsenal aka “full English” in our case); thus in all very reasonable!

Accept cash or card, and it seems if you wish to visit more than once, enquire about their discount card which they may offer for free on your first visit, which will save you around 5%+.

Very professional staff, yummy breakfast packages including fresh juice, hot chocolate, croissants with jam and honey, omelette, and fresh tomato/motzerella salad- would have had this every morning if I could!!
My wife and I went here for a late lunch. Really impressed with the quality, of the food and the service. The great setting just completed the experience for us. Good job guys

We first visited on wed 9th May 
Petra welcomed us and despite the restaurant being busy she was able to find us a great table 
Mario was very attentive and discussed the menu in detail
Starters we chose were seafood risotto and my husband had the Sky and mountains tagliatelle .. beautiful presented and delicious 
Mains blue fin tuna and I had squid 
My husband was on antibiotics and unfortunately could not drink that evening but the wine I had was wonderful - Mario then produced a complimentary desert for my husband to compensate for him not being able to enjoy the wine ... chocolate granachr with figs and mint
So good was the restaurant we asked Petra for a table for our last evening in Dubrovnick on sat 12 May and we had the best table right at the front overlooking the harbour 
This time we had lovely starters followed by the chateau Brianne Dubrovnik style and 
Stjepan was a fantastic waiter and sommelier 
He recommended the most beautiful wine to compliment our food but not the most expensive 
He was amazing 
Again we received a complimentary dessert to share of panna cotte 
Both nights had great music playing 
Would recommend booking to get the best tables at the front

Our experience was so wonderful! Our waiter, Marijo, was so kind and thoughtful and deeply attentive and he really made the experience feel welcoming and joyful. The food was great, but the drinks were really just incredible. Go for the Taste of Spring, fresh raspberries and lime, wow! The service was easily the best part, the best we've had in all our travels in Croatia!

Wow!! An absolutely amazing venue, great service from Valentino and to top it off fantastic food.
It was the best evening of our week in Dubrovnik. The fish was fantastic and as for the guy on his organ, Stevie Wonder eat ur heart out!!
Thank u v much.
The food is awesome. It comes with a great view and warm service!! Definetly we would come back again

Had a meal on the rear terrace pre booked a table with a view over the little port. Service and food was really good. it started to rain so we had to move table , the waiters were quick to respond. As we had to move table they gave us deserts and liqueur each free plus an extra 10% discount off the Bill. Definitely would go back service was some of the best we have had on this holiday

Do ask for a table with a view of the harbour, as that makes it a lovely setting for dinner. We tried to reserve a table, but that wasn’t possible, so just turned up and easily got a table. The outside tables are in the shade which was good for us. 

The food was OK, but very reasonably priced given the location. Tasty homemade bread too. Top notch service from the waiting staff. And not too noisy so easy to hold a conversation.

5 star service and fish of the day was divine
Lovely atmosphere, Great view of the harbour. Magical evening

I had a wonderful evening here with 5 friends. We booked a table and requested a harbour view (would definitely recommend doing this). Food was delicious and our waiter was very attentive. Probably the best night of the holiday!

We booked a table at the restaurant the night before we ate as I'd wanted to get a good table overlooking the harbour with great views. We were served by Marijo who was wonderful, extremely attentive and knowledgeable. He knew which wines to recommend with what dishes and he wasn't wrong, the bottle of wine we got went perfectly. We got the mussels to share to start and they were delicious. My husband got the beef bourguignon which was melt in your mouth and I got the salmon. Both dished were fantastic. The service was outstanding and the setting beautiful! would highly recommend

Walked into the restaurant in the hope of a table and was greeted with a warm welcome and asked to wait a couple of minutes. Then offered the best table in the place, at the front overlooking the bay/mariner. All staff were so attentive and food amazing.
