It was so good we returned the following evening to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. The food, service and wine and ambiance was just as good, if not better. Will definitely be returning to Dubrovnik and this amazing restaurant. Thank you!

Try the harbour side for amazing views, very special restaurant, great service, lovely food, top restaurant.

Went back for more to celebrate my mates 50th and didn’t disappoint.

Thanks for 2 lovely evenings.

I’d done some brief research and we were either having breakfast at Cafe Festival or here at Gradska Kavana Arsenal. Cafe Festival happened to be closer and we were ready to eat so went in and sat down. After a while and still not been attended to we left for Arsenal. What a great decision. There’s no comparison - we got a table port side, the menu was fantastic, quality was excellent, service was second to none and the price was unbelievably cheap for what you get. In addition, we got a 10% off voucher for one of their three restaurants-one of which we’d already booked for tonight (Panorama at the top of Mt. Srd). Amazing!

I arrived in Dubrovnik Old Town on a Friday for the weekend after disembarking from a week on the MSC Poesia cruiseship. I walked around Saturday morning looking for breakfast and stumbled upon this outstanding restaurant. It had nice breakfast offerings (vegetarian for me) and a picturesque view. It was most definitely a great choice. The food was prepared just right AND my lovely waiter Marijo found me some gluten free bread as well as provided perfect service. I would recommend wholeheartedly.

My wife and I had a lovely table overlooking the harbour. We ordered fish al forno and were recommended the Mare Postup 2015 red wine by our fantastic waiter, Valentino. He served the food and wine beautifully. We loved the meal, especially with the accompanying live cello music.

Highly recommended
A fantastic spot by the water. Great decour. Food was the best we had during our 4 day trip in Croatia. And the service/staff was superb (especially our waitor, Valentino!). Would highly recommend.

One of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik old town. Expensive but food was delicious and waiters were very attentive. Our catch of the day was a huge 2kg red snapper at 100 euros..but tasted amazing. views are simply amazing.

The tables on the terrace in the back overlooking the water are the best. I had the grilled squid, and my friend had the fresh sea bream. Both were excellent. The squid was well prepared, and the sea bream was deboned at the table. The service was personal and attentive, and the final tab was super reasonable, i. e., it is about the same as the places in the alleys with no views and lesser quality food.

Sometimes restaurants at such prime locations could be tourist traps, but this was not the case for Arsenal ! Prices are correct, great service and good food. We enjoyed everything in this restaurant and would recommend it.
We loved everything about this place. Make reservations to sit by the water. The service was great and the food even better. Highly recommended

We went here for dinner and had a great meal. Service was exceptionally fast and friendly and both our meals were delicious. The atmosphere in the restaurant was nice and still enjoyable despite not having a table right by the view of the port. When you dine at either Dubravska restaurant, Panoramic Restaurant (top of cable car) or here you get a 10% discount card off your next meal at one of these places. Recommend!

My husband and I had lunch here and enjoyed every moment. The atmosphere is fantastic and the service amazing. What a special place. The food is delicious. Very reasonably priced. I had the sea and mountain pasta and my husband the seafood risotto. Amazing. I have never tasted anything like this. I highly recommend this place and I bet it would be fabulous at night also.

Arsenal is large with one area on the square and another where we had lunch on the harbour. The view of the old harbour really sets the scene. The service is excellent, attentive but not intrusive. The food and wine, and the cocktails, were beyond reproach. Above all, it is a very atmospheric place to eat and thoroughly and unhesitatingly to be recommended.

We did not have a reservation for a Saturday night and wanted to sit by the water. The friendly hostess had us sit outside street-side while we enjoyed a cocktail. In a short time, she had a table for us by the water. Our wine was beautifully decanted table-side. Service was fabulous. The setting was lovely with romantic lighting reflecting off of the water. The tender octopus salad covered in caviar was the highlight of my meal. We also enjoyed the mussels and grilled fish which was filleted table-side. Our meal ended with complimentary desserts and fig brandy. Perfect ending. I highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic old city fine dining experience.

What a lovely experience , we was asked if we wanted a view, which we said yes, shown to our seat and what a lovely biew of the harbour. We was given a menu my husband had prosciutto salad and i had marinated zucchini salad. We order fries, drinks was a bottle of water a non alcohol cocktail, a glass of wine and cappuccino to finish. Food amazing, service fantastic, staff attentive and with the view a lovely lunch, a good memory to take home to Devon

We came here twice in our recent stay in Dubrovnik and I must say we were not disappointed! We had worried that it’s setting would mean that the food was substandard, but how wrong were we! The breakfast we had here was second to none. We were given a glass of orange juice, bread, croissants, preserves, honey, a hot drink. All that was included along was a hot breakfast. We had a mixture of the vegetarian and meat options and they were both superb. I really can’t recommend it enough as it is excellent value for money too!! We also had an excellent evening meal here, again very reasonable prices and excellent food!! The setting is also stunning. Again I must say the baby changing facilities were excellent too!!

Interesting restaurant that has a terrace on the main strip through the city but also, on the other side or the restaurant, a terrace overlooking the harbour. Take you pick, we preferred the town side.
Service was impeccable with fluent English spoken, details of the wine, grapes and provenance. The food is imaginative and amazing, truly fine dining. 
This is the place to go to impress your partner and win some brownie points, truly special.

Great food, creative plates, correct prices!
We prefered the terrace on the townside (they have a 2nd one viewing on the little harbour). Favourites: marinated aubergines with greek cheese; grilled bar.

I had been to this restaurant during my previous trips to Dubrovnik and had fond memories of it. I managed to renew those memories during my recent trip. The view is that of the citadel's harbour and the ambience is great. The food and wine have been exceptionally good everytime. It will remain on my itinerary next time I visit. The chateaubriand was cooked to perfection and the dingac wine was equally good. Excellent service as expected from a first class restaurant.

After an 8 hour trip with some along the way to Dubrovnik arriving at the Old Town in time for dinner this evening. We chose Gradska Kavana Arsenal Restaurant on the harbour are enjoying a nice and relaxing diner with some fabulous music, an Aperol Spritz and glass of wine. The Salmon and Pork Belly were delicious and finished off with a Creme Caramel to share.

The under cover terasse is great with a nice view of the port. The food was good but the service a bit too slow. The plates could be a bit more generous in terms of portions. We had fish well cooked but a tiny piece of veggies on side.

A great place to eat with outstanding food. Hostess Nika is as pleasant as she is beautiful and is very attentive. As the “face” of the restaurant she makes a very positive first impression. 

Try to make reservations for your meal on the outside veranda (seaside) in the first row... you won’t be disappointed. 

Mussels
Oysters
Grilled calamari
Truffle pasta 

All excellent options!! 

Ask about the promotion card which gives you a 10% discount.

My husband and I were very surprised to find a good deal breakfast at this restaurant as it looked a bit fancy. For 60 kunas you received a plain omelette, mozzarella and tomatoes, croissants and breads with spreads, hot drink of your choice and orange juice. Service was friendly too!

The restaurant is very beatiful and it has great views. The staff is super friendly and very accommodating. Unfortunately all the meals werent as good as expected. The fresh fish was cooked well so no complaints there, but the sides were average. My husband’s salmon and veggies weren’t great ie the beets were still hard. I see that the restaurant got great reviews so maybe it’s just what we ordered??

My wife and I stopped in here on a Friday night. While we did not have reservations, the hostess was kind enough to find us a table although it was crowded. Our server, Valentino offered great recommendations, and the food was exquisite. I will definitely be returning next time I am in the area!

We went here 4 times during 
our trip to Dubrovnik! The food was incredible and the staff and service is the best I’ve ever experienced. The staff are incredibly helpful and will go above and beyond to make sure you have a great experience. The atmosphere is magical, and the food is highly recommended.

I am reviewing the experience I have had over the course of one full week in Old Town, Dubrovnik where I had breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert repeatedly during my week stay. I didn't need to go anywhere else since the food quality and service was 5-stars! 

There are actually two dining experiences to this outstanding restaurant. The restaurant covers the entire width of the street with a town-side and a seaside. The "town-side" location is perfect to relax and people-watch in the main square. The "seaside" location is perfect to take your breath away from the beauty of the sea, and the landscape is a picture perfect postcard! 

Now that you know about the physical atmosphere, the staff and service must first be address as outstanding! 

I have met the most wonderful people who are part of this restaurant, and I hope you get the chance too! The hostesses, Maria and Nika are so friendly and helpful. I instantly felt like we have been friends forever. 

My main waiter, Marjio, is so professional, friendly and kind. He is very attentive and helpful. He offered comfortable blankets and a complimentary warm coffee drink on the night where it was slightly chilly. These little details are what are truly memorable and make an outstanding experience! 

As my friendships with everyone there grew, I got to know Igor, the Manager, and since I stayed quite a long time working from my laptop, he was so thoughtful to send over a beautiful tropical juice. I felt that I had a wonderful new group of friends. If you need a place for wifi, it is a great location and the seaside location you can sit next to beautiful flowers throughout the outside space. 

Everyone there greets you with a smile and is so respectful and friendly. This is very helpful and appreciated, especially as a solo traveler.

The food was delicious. I had the Arsenal breakfast (many times) with orange juice, eggs, bacon, sausage, beans, bread and a hot beverage (tea). They are generous to bring more hot water to replenish. I loved the cute bread basket and side of jams, Nutella, butter, and honey. For lunch, my favorites were the grilled octopus (amazing flavors) and the octopus salad (the presentation looks like a little plant is growing from soil). It was so tasty! 

For dinner, I had the seabass and chocolate fig pie dessert. One night for dinner there was a large reserved party and my dinner arrived a little later than planned (not by much time at all) but they surprised me with a cheesecake as an apology. I didn't need an apology but I was delighted how creamy and delicious the cake tasted.

In the evening, there is musical entertainment with a trumpet player one night, a pianist another, and sometimes a combination of the two. It is truly a wonderful place to relax and enjoy life! I'm so thankful I had this experience!

Prior to arriving in Dubrovnik we were recommended this restaurant twice and now know why.

We pre booked a table for Friday evening and were seated next to the harbour which was beautiful.

Staff were really friendly and helpful with any questions that we had on the menu.

The mussels and salmon and whitefish ceviche starters were really good. The pork belly and grilled squid were also great.

Given the view, great service and beautiful food. This was probably the best meal that we had in Dubrovnik and I’d definitely recommend it in the future.
Very nice food (we had sea bass and lovely cakes for desert). Atmosphere is nice with live music and a beautiful view on the harbour. Staff is excellent. Reasonably priced as well.

Delightful restaurant. We were wise to book in advance. Cocktails to start, two courses, the fish stew was really very good, the apple dessert a bit "catering supplier" not so great. Friendly service, they apologised for one of the fish dishes delayed by only a couple of minutes & made the dessert complimentary. We decided to have a digestif spirit to finish the evening, they made that complimentary too ! Good experience, lovely evening location - recommended.

With its great view and friendly staff we had a lovely time at the Gradska Kavana Arsenal. We went there for lunch, and had a burger and a chicken toast. We ordered non-alcoholic drinks which were delicious!

As one of 8 Exotic ladies, I can only endorse my friends review of this restaurant. 
The 'Arsenal, experience truly was sublime. The food, view , staff, wines and atmosphere was of exceptional quality. The care and attention by the staff was probably some of the best service I had encountered and other restaurants world wide would benefit from observing their brilliant and professional practice.
A warmth of welcome with beautiful Croatian sunshine in this fabulous restaurant would be a travesty not to indulge. 
special Thank you to Marino , Valentino, Ivan and Verdun, and all of the management and team for the most fabulous of Dubrovnik memories

A visit to the Old Town would be wasted if you did not eat at The Arsenal. The food is delicious but what really makes the experience memorable is the outstanding service. It was so good we visited 4 times, twice for dinner and twice for breakfast. We shall miss the care and attention ... and banter.... with the Dream Team of Marijo, Valentino, Ivan and Verdan. We particularly enjoyed exploring the range of local wines, which the extremely knowledgeable waiters recommended. We shall return 
‘The 8 Exotic Ladies’

We initially hesitated about trying this restaurant, but on our final evening we went for it. Beautiful setting, helpful knowledgeable staff (advising on good local wines), and really good food. One of us had fish of the day, filleted at the table, two had chateaubriand - which was perfectly cooked medium rare. I had salmon and it was delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant. They even gave us complimentary portions of different puddings - all delicious but we were too full to do them credit!

The beef cheek bourguignon is to die for. The rest of the party had Chateaubriand which they all commented on positively. Went back one evening during our stay for drinks in the bar. Can highly recommend Strawberry cheese cake (cocktail) ✔️ The surroundings are wonderful with suddle music.

We are regular guests in this place for years... But, as we always stay in hotel with h/b, we have never eat here :( However, coffee/tea/drink/cake...is great. And location too. If you are in Dubrovnik, you simply MUST sit here at least once :)

I discovered this place while visiting Dubrovnik for the first time and I liked it so much that I went there about eight times. The place serves amazing breakfast, coffee, pastries, lunch and dinner. Everything I ate was delicious, from the cocktails, to the tuna tartar to the cheesecake who is for sure a must try. 
The location is great because you have different areas. One that is more for a quick coffee break or cocktail which is at the front where you have a nice view of the main street of Dubrovnik. Then you can eat inside but the best if at the back where you have stunning view of the port and dubrovnik walls and it is impossible not to fall in love with this gorgeous scenery. 
Though the most important thing about this place is the service which is perfect. Everyone working there is really friendly, professional and will do anything to help you and to make you have the best time while you are there. 
So I would like to thank all the staff for its wonderful work and commitment to service which is a tough industry. Special thanks to Valentino, Ivan, Marijo, Mario and all your other colleagues. Sorry for forgetting the name. Without its amazing staff the place would not be the same.

We had dinner in this beautiful restaurant, with a table at the harbor side, next to the walking trail. We had the opportunity to see the sunset color the mountains, the old city wall and the sky purple and orange - spectacular view! The ambience was terrific, and the service was kind of low key, but extremely kind and attentive. The food was better than average. The whole restaurant was packed, and there is no wonder why.

Visited this beautiful restaurant on a Friday in May – perfect temperature for al fresco eating – great space looking out onto the Old Port, with high vaulted ceilings – nicely laid and positioned tables with plenty of room – extremely attentive and professional waiters – great, reasonably priced Croatian rose – what's not to like?! 
Food excellent – interesting starters, then we shared a large sea bream, brought to our table to select, then baked and served with roasted vegetables and potatoes. Delicious! Expertly filleted and served at the table by Ivan, who then kindly procured an umbrella for us to dash back to our hotel during a short, late night cloudburst!
So good, we booked for Saturday night - same beautiful setting - dramatic, ghostly galleons drifting in and out the port - food with added theatre! 
This time the charming Marijo kept us 3 ladies supplied throughout the evening with great food and wine with good info about the local wines. A big added bonus was a great jazz duo - from the Dubrovnik Symphony no less, playing superbly, at just the right volume, throughout the evening.
We did eat at other places in Dubrovnik honest! But couldn't resist having lunch there on our last day - different, more buzzy atmosphere in the daytime, with boats in and out and great vantage point for people watching, but same good food and great service. We promised to give them a mention on TripAdvisor– deservedly so as this place certainly increased our enjoyment of this lovely town. All the staff from the super-helpful greeters to the waiters couldn't have done more to look after us. We hope to be back.

Wanted to eat something light for lunch but wanted a proper ‘sit down’. Tried this restaurant that has outdoor seating both towards the square and the harbour in the old city. Surprisingly I was seated at one of the best tables closest to the harbour (rate when eating alone). Great service, nice burrata captées and a good glass of wine. Would definitely go back.
We went about 7.30 just as the sun was setting making for stunning scenery as we ate our meal. This restaurant has a great balance between fine dining & reasonable prices, would definitely recommend!
Have the best experiance sercice.Food was great.Service was exelente.The waiter served exelnt serice.It was a plesaure to be on sight😍😍😍😍😙😙
Had a delicious lunch while watching the people and boats in the Harbour. Food and presentation were excellent. Good friendly staff and reasonably priced for the quality and service you are getting
Visited the Arsenal last night.. What a setting for an amazing meal.. Service was amazing.. Very helpful staff.. Food was awesome and the wine was quality too.. A must visit..

Our dinner at this venue was a highlight of our visit to Dubrovnik. The evening views right on the harbour were breathtaking. The service was attentive and professional with the staff welcoming and friendly. The food was served promptly, succulent, tasty and presentation could not be faulted. Really impeccable.
Great view of Old Port. Breakfast was good value and very generous with Croissants, Fruit and Cooked food, served in that order which rather confused my English eating habits!
We went last night and the three of us had the fish special. The entire experience was fantastic, topped off we sea views from our table!!

When we first walked in we thought it looked too modern but the foyer is more a bar than a restaurant. Make sure you book and get a table outside overlooking the harbour.

Service was excellent, professional, helpful, informative and attentive. Food matched up, a good selection, quickly serviced and delicious. 

Good wine list, not too pricy and served in a top class way decanted etc.

What was particularly moving was that if you go to the war museum at the top of the cable car you can watch videos of shells falling immediately in front of where you will be sitting, tragic.

I was a little hesitant about going in here at first as I thought it would be a real tourist trap with its excellent location next to the harbour but an impending rain shower forced my hand. It was a good decision. The service was very good even with almost every table taken. I had seafood risotto to start which was really tasty but the star was the steak which was excellent and cooked to perfection. Topped this off with a couple of glasses of wine so all in all a good night. The price was also very reasonable for the quality of the food and the location.

We came across this by chance and had an amazing meal with exceptional service and the Croatian Chardonnay was a fantastic recommendation. The chicken and pork belly were delicious topped with a fantastic desert. Highly recommend this and we’ll be back.
We had dinner three times very well. Fish and food in general very good. Very kind staff. Definitely an obligatory stop in Dubrovnik. Highly recommended!

Very good food. Charming location. Perfect staff, they took care of all our special wishes. Normal Dubrovnik prices. We literally had to wait 45 seconds for our table, as an excuse for that they accomadated us with a discount. Recommend.

On our last night in Dubrovnik, we came across to this stunning restaurant. The food was phenomenal from the Antipasti to the Desserts. The service was impeccable and the location was one of the best spots in the old town. We had a table overlooking the sea & the old port and was so relaxing. Definitely one of my favourite place to eat in the old town.

We only had a day in this beautiful city and did not have much of a plan. We wandered by this place while hungry and chose it despite it being prominently located exactly at one end of the primary street and an obvious choice for uninformed visitors. We were greeted with friendly service, given great suggestions from the menu, the view over the sea from the back patio dining area was outstanding and the food was of high quality on offer at a fair price. Try the local prosciutto as a starter. The pasta here also exceeded my expectations.

Arguably my favourite restaurant of our trip to Dubrovnik, just left feeling a little salty after my starter!

To start, we had a creamy truffle, mushroom and spaghetti dish which was lovely (though a little too creamy for my partner) and some mussels in a garlic and white wine sauce. Unfortunately whilst the mussels were tasty, the sauce with it was far too salty and overpowered any other taste.

The main dish of salmon fillet with the chosen white wine (the only medium dry one!) was incredible and we both really enjoyed it.

The service was spotless and the waiters were very attentive and were pleasant to talk to! I’d definitely recommend visiting here, I am sure my salty starter was a one off!

We needed to get out of rain and enjoy a cup of tea. Glad we picked the right spot.
Service was exceptional, tea was served with all the right panache.
Enjoyed a chocolate croissant along with it. It was also very good.
We were not rushed to leave, so we were able to warm up and stay dry for a bit.
Very pleasant experience.

This is honestly the best meal we’ve had in Dubrovnik. 

We were attracted by the location of this restaurant as it was next to the pier and was under the city walls. We were a little skeptical at first because we knew views and food quality doesn’t always come together. But we saw the reviews and decided to take our chances. 

We got a seat in the first row, sat under a 13th century arc and had the most amazing view of the harbour. 

We had the fish stew and the mussels. Both were amazing. The fish stew had a delicious sauce and the fish were of good quality. The mussels sauce was great as well.

More importantly, we received absolutely THE BEST SERVICE of all time (and we’ve been on holidays for 4 weeks now). The manager Tomislav was very friendly, introduced us a great wine and educated us a lot on Croatian wine! We asked for a takeaway of the bottle because we were so fond of it and the manager gave us a bottle on the house. We enjoyed absolutely EVERYTHING. 

Thank you so much to the restaurant and the manager Tomislav! Such a nice and beautiful experience to remember from Dubrovnik! 100% recommend to all who travels to the city!

Simply put, the food here is sublime and the staff are fantastic, attentive and professional. They went above and beyond with helping with our 11 month old and accommodating a table change for a better view of the harbour.

We had previously eaten here a few years ago for lunch when we visited Dubrovnik and enjoyed it so on our return trip I thought I would book for dinner. Unfortunately my booking didn't seem to be on the list when we arrived but they managed to get us a great table on the terrace with great views of the docks. The food wasn't as amazing as I had hoped for but was still really yummy. 
All of the staff were wonderful and the atmosphere was really nice so we had a great time. After dinner we went to the front of the restaurant for drinks and the was a jazz due playing softly which was a really lovely touch. We have also recommended this restaurant to a few of friends who are visiting later on this year.

Marija managed to sort out a front row seat in this wonderful seaside restaurant. Stephan was the most attentive and fantastic waiter. Had the fish stew which was amazing as was the cod and grilled calamari. It was my birthday and I was made to feel so very special l!! A wonderful and memorable evening.
We stopped in for a drink, ended up making friends and returning for breakfast. The service is incredible and the food was amazing. A must visit restaurant in Dubrovnik.

We initially chose this restuarant for the great view from the terrace and were not disappointed with the food and ambiance.
It was first class service food was great all dishes fish and pasta and meat dishes all good standard .
Staff were very attentive not too hurried so you can enjoy the harbour life from the terrace .
It was so good we went back for second visit few days later and were not disappointed it was just as memorable !
Highly recommended.....
Wonderful place. The terrasse is great, service is perfect and the food very tasty! All what we are looking for in a good restaurant

Visibly, possibly the nicest looking Restaurant in Dubrovnik and certainly didn't disappoint. Was a bit hesitant with deciding to go there as it looked expensive however no more expensive than UK and for much better quality food and service. Had chicken, side, bread, cocktail and water for approx £23. Lovely staff, terrace seating is comfy and cocktails are second to none.

had lunch here two days out of our fours days in Dubrovnik, the service is second to none at a great price for Dubrovnik, we had drinks on our first nite at there sister restaurant by the pile gate that got us 10% off here for food and drink.

Overlooking the harbour, this is a prime location. Arsenal not only has excellent service and in particular Ivan who was one of the most helpful, caring and competent waiters we have ever met. It has a rarified air of comfort, charm and relaxation. The menu has a concise food and extensive drinks list. A lovely restaurant to visit when in Dubrovnik old town. Arsenal is also affiliated with two other restaurants. One outside the Pile gate and the other close to the upper level of the aerial lift.
Really loved our visit for dinner yesterday! I had the 'sea and mountains' pasta and it was so good, really mushrooms and creamy. The view at the back is something else!

At first came here for coffee and dessert mid day with family and service from Mario was excellent! We had non alcoholic drinks and coffee and dessert (cheesecake and chocolate cake). Their dessert is homemade each day and so fresh! Family decided to come back for dinner and try their food. Marijo served us and was very helpful in suggesting foods we should try. We took his recommendations and was blown away! From their octopus salad, sea and mountain (my personal favorite), their daily catch of the day (fish which was tasty), and their caprese salad (mozzarella was fresh!) would highly recommend this restaurant. Best view and great service and food. Went back the next day for lunch before our flight! Every staff member went above and beyond to make our dining experience memorable. Thank you marija. Mario, Marijo, Ivan, Valentino, the manager (makes the best ice coffee), Roberto and the rest of the staff here! Again, highly highly recommend this place! Best restaurant in all of Croatia hands down.
Sit facing the square or the harbour and enjoy great food and service. We'd just stop for a cocktail or lunch.

Pros: good people watching and free WiFi(but you could get that at ANY restaurant in Dubrovnik).

Cons: low quality food for breakfast. Old, stale, and flavorless. Fruit was brown and aged. Pricey. Seriously poor service. Waitress didn’t come back during breakfast even once to see if we needed anything. Just avoid it, not worth starting the morning irritated over breakfast.

My son lives in Europe so we met in Dubrovnik for Easter. Our hotel was walkable to to the Old Town and we ate at this restaurant on our first night. Food was very good, view on port side amazing, view on city side great , prices reasonable & staff fantastic. 

We did eat at another restaurant owned by the Nautika* chain; however, we liked Arsenal the best. A server gave me clue where my son could get haircut before Easter Mass at St. Ignatius Loyola, and a lovely blond woman who worked at restaurant gave my son suggestions for our roadtrip to Cavtat. All in all - we felt very at home here and loved every aspect of this restaurant. 

* I was a food journalist in New York and felt this was a better value than the other restaurants in the chain. Also more fun!

One of a chain of three restaurants. just outside the entrance to the old city in a beautiful old building elegantly restored. Great food while watching the boats go in and out of the harbour, fantastic views, and our mussels and seafood spaghetti were fresh and tasty.... . Drinks and food somewhat cheaper than other restaurants around it and a lot of locals seemed to eat here too. They have 2 other restaurants with a 10% off card given when you pay but sadly we had run out of time to try the others!

One of a chain of three restaurants. Their sister restaurant , the Panaramic , is located just outside the entrance to the old city, the other one by the cable car. Our favourite was the Arsenal. Great food watching the boats go in and out of the harbour , fantastic views , the panaramic restaurant gave us a card that gave 10% off all their restaurants can be re-used every visit . Drinks and food about a 3rd cheaper than other restaurants around it yet this restaurant is on the sea front !

This was our last night in Dubrovnik and was also our daughter’s birthday. We had an excellent experience both in terms of the quality of food and the quality of service. The mushroom linguine and the ‘Sea and Mountains’ starters were particularly good as was the sea bass main course. The waiters were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We also had a table nearest the water which made for very picturesque view making the evening even more enjoyable.

Cocktails here are amazing. Food a bit too posh for my liking. Small amounts and look fancy. Also got my order wrong but did take the drink price off the bill. Staff were also nice and very apologetic.

We got a reservation here while we were up at the Panarama Restraurant on Mount Srd. This is a sister site, along with another one outside of Pile Gate. We probably wouldn't have needed the reservation given it still isn't too busy in the old town in early April. The prices are actually quite reasonable and we also had a 10% off card given to us when we were at the Mount Syrd restaurant. The service was very good and my wife did not particularly end up liking her pasta dish (my salmon was fine!) though it was just due to her not liking it, not that they made it badly. That happens once in a while when you choose something new to you. When our server noticed that she didn't finish her bowl he asked if anything was wrong and my wife just said it wasn't her thing, nothing they did wrong. Well, when we got our bill they took this off the total! They said if she didn't like it they wouldn't have her pay for it. Very classy! My only slight complaint was that the sliced bread pieces brought out were getting a little dry/stale...probably because they just weren't that busy yet. But other than that I really enjoyed the food and the service! And I thought the prices were reasonable along with very pleasant views out into the marina if you sit outside!

This place is in a fabulous location! We went twice, once for coffee, and once for drinks and dinner. They serve one of the best cocktails (Lady's Choice) and the service was excellent too! An great place to while away the hours!
Seafood was fresh and delicious. Service was great. We had two people in our party with gluten food restrictions, they were very accommodating and we didn't have any problems.

I booked this restaurant following a recommendation that it was one of the best. Dont go there, it is very poor. I had an email confirming our booking but when we called in to confirm they had no idea about us. We arrived in time and were seated in the corner, never a good place, I ordered the red sparkling rissotto with scallops, let me tell you, it had no sparkle at all infact it had no flavour what so ever and the scallops were over cooked. I followed this with beef cheek borguignon which took 75 minutes to arrive, no one came to tell me it would take that long no one cared we just sat there waiting. When it did arrive, it was nothing like it said on the menu and was certainly not beef bourguignon, not by any stretch of the imagination. After another 45 mins we actually saw a waiter who was very quick to offer the bill even though everyone esle in the restaurant was offered a complementary house drink, we were not. This was one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life and when I told the two waiters when leaving, they really didnt care. Totally over priced, poor food, rubbish service, advice is, steer well clear

We visited this restaurant during our trip to Dubrovnik as part of the Easter break. We were initially drawn to the restaurant by it's beautiful location, situated by the waterfront of the Old Town. 

To add to it's excellent setting and atmosphere, the food was top quality and all waiting staff went above and beyond to ensure that our party felt well accomodatyed and cared for.

As other reviewers have mentioned, the general manager Marijo was an excellent host who made us feel like VIP's during both of our visits. He sets an shining example as to how any restauranteur should run their business, and his brilliant service lead to us returning for a second meal which was also cooked to a very high standard.

We visited the restaurant on our trip to Dubrovnik this Easter. We had receommedation for this restaurant from the Drubrovka (which is another of the restaurant of the same chain) 
Although, we weren’t sure of the quaility or the price we decided to give it a go one evening for dinner. It was beyond excellent experience, excellent food- I ordered the cod with pea purée and my husband ordered the salmon with beet root and asparagus. Both the dishes looked stunning and tasted even better, fish was moist and cooked to perfection. I who hate mushy peas loved the pea purée, that good!
Staff were very caring and welcoming, and explained a lot about the local produce. Like other fine dining restaurants they didn’t keep straight face but smiled and made you comfortable the whole time. Time and time they checked if we liked everything or if they could offer us anything else,with big smiles on their face always. 
In the end, they even got us some complimentary local liquor to try. Sitting by the old port, hearing the waves crash on the shore and scrumptious food, we couldn’t have asked for more.
Overall an unforgettable experience and cherished dinner in Dubrovnik.

We ate here on our last night in Dubrovnik because the location can't be beat. But the food was nothing special. Mussels came out cold and had to be sent back, seafood risotto was okay, wine was good. Service was very nice and accommodating, and the location was a great spot for a meal. But given all the other restaurants we tried in town, we were least impressed by the cooking here. Solid for a drink and an appetizer and people watching, but that's about it.

Loved this restaurant! Food was incredible, the fish stew in particular was amazing. Marijo was a wonderful waiter who went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable. Would highly recommend this restaurant if you are visiting Dubrovnik!

Had a dinner here last week, good location, nice view and def. a good place to enjoy the atmosphere! Ordered fish stew, truffle & mushroom linguini and they were delicious! Good service by Marijo and his recommendations on Wine and tips to Dubrovnik ended my trip in Croatia nicely. Thanks!
Service was excellent. Food was very good. But it was expensive because of the wine. Tney do not sell a "house wine" and the cheapest was Kuna 220 a bottle which made it an expensive meal.

With a school group from the US, we visited this restaurant for coffee and cakes and were not disappointed. Marijo was our waiter and did a wonderful job of making us feel welcomed and important. He was friendly, funny, answered any questions (as silly as they may have been) from my students and made our time very enjoyable. Not to mention the drinks and desserts were amazing. Hvala!
The decor was nice and the staff were really friendly. The hot green tea was served with honey. You should really visit if you are in Dubrovnik.
Four of us sit here for a coffee and cake. Coffee was excellent and cake really tasty. Service was professional and friendly. Place is very clean. Location is the best. Highly recommended
Amazing location. It is great feeling sit here and drink coffee. Very clean place. Good and polite service. Great coffee and excellent cake

We went there several times already and will be going again!! Food and location are number 1.

Even better is the service, the friendly staff. Ivan, Roberto, and Mario were just fabulous, welcoming, accommodating. 

When we went there the first time, we missed breakfast (arrived at 11:30 but it ends at 11:00). Ivan (Manager) saw we were disappointed. Not his/their fault. He still offered us two complimentary desserts at the end of our meal!!!!

THANK YOU!! You MUST eat here. Don't miss it!!

Lovely restaurant with very friendly staff who can’t do enough for you - Ivan was especially friendly and very accommodating! The menu hasn’t got the widest of choices but what we ordered was lovely (prosciutto and cheese and the beef bourguignon) and everything else around us looked tasty. Great location in the evening with the square lit up and they provide heaters/blankets for the colder evenings. Would definitely recommend and go back.

Had a lovely meal here. They fit us in quite late, just before they clsoed when it pouring with rain and we couldn't find anywhere else open. Waiters were great - friendly, spoke English well, recommended a delicious local croatian wine, and the food mas magnificent. Left a nice big tip to say thanks!

Stopped here for a coffee, ended up sampling local liqueurs... the fig one was nice... the wormword a bit like bad medicine. This then was followed by the grilled octopus, a plate of cheese and olives. It was such a lovely place to stop, people watch and enjoy the local art of fjaka. The service (Valentino) was great and very friendly. Would return
Had a lovely lunch, I had the fish fillet of the day and girlfriend had beef cheeks, which was all very nice and really good portion size, we had the local red wine which went down really well!

Stumbled in here while exploring the old city on a cold day... my friend and I warmed up with tea & rum and a French coffee, both of which were so good. Our server Mario was very attentive, friendly and eager to answer any questions. Menu is small and simple but the food was good.
Fine place for a drink and view over the square with the Orlando Column. Very good and attentive service.

Been there twice this trip. Maitre de 'Ivan' realy made it. Jovial and knowledgable, about the wine and food and Croatian culture. Simple menu but great for lunch or light dinner. Thoroughly reccomend! :-)

Friendly service, it was raining and cold so they gave us blankets and a heat light. Food was very good quality and not expensive at all. Overall, a very good experience! The beef cheek bourguignon was very nice

Right in the centre of the Old City, near the Palace and the St Blaise Church. This is an old style, elegant place to have a cup of coffee or have something to eat. The service is also excellent, and the prices are reasonable. Highly recommended.
We stopped in here for lunch and wow, the service, food and drinks were amazing. After walking around old town it was really nice and refreshing.

This is like most famous place to drink coffee. It is really nice and sunny too, but always full of people so it is hard to find aviable seats. Staff is nice, coffee good and view form this place on city is beautiful.

During a recent visit to Dubrovnik, we had two evening meals here - and were delighted with both. Extensive menu, food was lovely and the service was excellent.And food and drink prices were very reasonable.

And two very different dining areas - either on the terrace, facing into Old Town, or on the other side, facing Old Port... with lots of space in between.

Happy to recommend that you try it.

This is a large restaurant on the harbour, but for all that the service personable and very attentive; we arrived drenched from a sudden downpour and were wrapped in towels whilst our coats were dried out. Roberto our waiter was cracking, seek him out. The main thing about this restaurant, and it set me on a course for the rest of my stay in Dubrovnik, was the calamari. I am a particular fan of good calamari and have eaten the dish hundreds of times. It's a simple dish, grilled squid, but rarely is it perfectly served. Well, here it was, ten out of ten. It was good in other restaurants but none achieved the perfect ten. And it wasn't a one off. We were so impressed by our impromptu stop we returned in the evening - and more of our group had the calamari, again perfectly grilled. So if that's your thing, do yourself a favour. And if you don't, the rest of the food was well received by all, so worry not.

Bread was stale, chicken was cold and bland, drink portions were a joke. Eggs were made of butter, which was disgustingly greasy. Everything looked and tasted as if it was premade two days ago. The food came quick but at the cost of any sort of quality. Definitely would not come back again, ever.

Would absolutely not come here again...our chicken was cold and stale, our cheeseburger buns were stale, my breakfast vegetarian option didn’t come with bread. We had to ask for our dirty dishes to be cleared well after we had finished. 

The only good thing is that the waiter took our orders very quickly after we arrived and the food arrived promptly.
This restaurant is delightful, good portions and prices fair! Service is great, food super tasty and drinks lovely! Visited twice during our three night stay, highly recommend!

Stumbled on this great restaurant sheltering from a downpour! Great staff who dried our coats, wrapped us in blankets and served the best octopus we had ever eaten. 
Returned a couple of hours later with our other two friends in our group and did it all over again - minus the coat drying,,
Roberto a great host! and the chef a delight.
Wonderful restaurant with very kind and attentive waiters. Exquisite domestic liquors. Perfect place to sit on the terrace and watch life in Old Town.
